item.title: New Ghost in the Shell Scheduled for July 2026! With Music by Taisei Iwasaki, Ryo Konishi and Yuki Kanesaka!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Ghost in the Shell is a series revered by fans worldwide, and continues to leave an impact on creators across borders and generations. In conjunction with the opening of the first-ever Ghost in the Shell exhibition “Ghost and the Shell”, currently being held at NODE Tokyo, it was announced that the latest TV anime production of Ghost in the Shell will be airing in Japan starting July 2026. The very first key visual and promotional video was released as well.
  • The first key visual and original artwork from the series is currently on display at the “Ghost and the Shell” exhibition.
  • The musical producers for the new series have also been announced! The musical director is Taisei Iwasaki, known for composing the score for Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime (Belle), which won a Japan Academy Award for “Best Music”. In addition, Ryo Konishi, who served as the music director the Osaka World Expo and produces for artists such as Chara+YUKI, Mrs. Green Apple, TOMOO and more, will be collaborating with U.S.-based composer Yuki Kanesaka, who produced the music for TV anime Dr. Stone.
  • Updates will be posted to the new Ghost in the Shell website and official social media accounts.
    • https://youtu.be/xl8bNn3BRRM Ghost in the Shell Exhibition “Ghost and the Shell” tokyonode.jp/sp/exhibition-ghostintheshell

    About Taisei Iwasaki

    Award-winning musician who’s known for his work on Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime, Hateshinaki Scarlet, Giant God Warrior Appears in Tokyo, TV anime Kekkai Sensen, Spriggan, Marriage Toxin, and more. Moteki and Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime won the 35th and 45th Japan Academy Awards for “Best Music” respectively, while Ryuu to Sobakasu Hime went on to win the 36th Japan Golden Disc Award for “Best Soundtrack of the Year”.

    Comment from Taisei Iwasaki

    “In middle school, I came across a magazine with an illustration of Motoko Kusanagi inside. That was the moment when I discovered Ghost in the Shell. Its unique touch and color set it apart from other works. Even the author’s name, Masamune Shirow, captivated me. I was stunned. I’ve since encountered the series in various forms. Now, I am truly honored to be a part of this project and its long history. The concept I envisioned for this project is “Sound Public Security Sector 9”. With the help of my talented friends, I will strive to make this long-awaited work even better. May we all come together soon.

    About Ryo Konishi

    Born July 25, 1988 in Tokyo. Musical composer, arranger, and performer on saxophone, flute, clarinet, synthesizer, and vocoder. He served as the musical director for the opening ceremony of the Osaka World Expo, and has produced for numerous theatre productions, drama productions, and artists including Chara+YUKI, Mrs. Green Apple, TOMOO and more. His style as a performer involves mastering and playing multiple instruments, making him a valuable multi-instrumentalist in multiple settings including Chara and Millenium Parade led by Daiki Tsuneta. He’s participated in numerous festivals both domestically and internationally, including NHK’s “Kohaku Uta Gassen”, Fuji Rock Festival, and Summer Sonic.

    Comment from Ryo Konishi

    “I first watched Innocence when I was in junior high school. Ever since my heart was stolen by its intense charm, I’ve pursued everything related to Ghost in the Shell. Its influence is deeply ingrained into my own work and philosophy. At first, I couldn’t believe that I was entrusted with creating music for this work, but I wanted to embrace this precious world. With that feeling in my heart, I took on this project with my entire body and soul. Follow the whispers of my ghost!”

    About Yuki Kanesaka

    A music creator and composer based in Boston, creating music daily across the U.S. and Europe. In recent years, he’s been working as an assistant professor at Berklee College of Music, discovering music and developing technology, while also developing products for companies like Sony and AlphaThetha/Pioneer. He enjoys working and can play around 74 instruments. Recent works: - Shiryu Sejima (artist) - Dr. Stone/Jujutsu Kaisen/Snowball Earth (anime music) - olkswagen/Kyupi/Meiji/Yonex (commercial music) - Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure/Sonic Racing (game music)

    Comment from Yuki Kanesaka

    “I began with a single utterance: “Ghost in the Shell? Never heard of it!”, before immediately ordering every English and Japanese version I could get on Amazon. As I dove into composing at my private studio in Boston, a vast number of motifs began preparing for their musical journey. To Nashville, where my allies wait, for additional recordings. To a Shanghai hotel, for tailoring. Finally, the motifs’ journey comes to an end in Tokyo, transforming from a phenomenon called “a passage” into a message called “a suite”. A journey without hesitation, without blurring, without rewriting. These songs are like maps, etched with a trail of my thoughts and impulses. Ghost in the Shell Official Accounts Official Website: theghostintheshell-anime.jp Official X: @thegits_animeEN Official Instagram: @thegits_anime

item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has opened orders for its second wave of The Prince of Tennis II collaboration true wireless earbuds. The latest additions to the line-up are the TE-V1R-TP3, inspired by Hyōtei Gakuen Junior High School (Hyōtei), and the TE-V1R-TP4, inspired by Shitenhoji Junior High School (Shitenhoji).
  • Based on the TE-V1R, the TE-V1R-TP3 and TE-V1R-TP4 are special edition wireless earbuds designed to fully capture the charm of The Prince of Tennis II.
  • Both models feature eight characters’ voices. The Hyōtei model includes Keigo Atobe, Yushi Oshitari, Ryoh Shishido, Gakuto Mukahi, Jiroh Akutagawa, Munehiro Kabaji, Chotaroh Otori, and Wakashi Hiyoshi, while the Shitenhoji model features Kuranosuke Shiraishi, Senri Chitose, Koharu Konjiki, Yuji Hitouji, Kenya Oshitari, Gin Ishida, Hikaru Zaizen, and Kintaroh Toyama.
  • Together, the two models contain 330 newly recorded voice lines, from operational voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status to a “random voice” function that plays memorable quotes from the series. Users can switch between 16 modes through the dedicated app.
  • From the earbuds and charging case to the packaging, every detail has been carefully crafted for a premium, fan-focused experience, with audio tuned by series composer UZA for optimal music playback. In the promotional video, Kenya Oshitari and Yushi Oshitari themselves introduce the products. Please check it out!
    • https://youtu.be/LKSdf6aG2o8

    Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOT’s popular V series, which has sold approximately 190,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDAC™ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of April 2025 Special Voice Lines The earbuds feature over 330 newly recorded lines across two models, including voice guidance for notifications such as power and connection status, as well as a “random voice” function with memorable quotes from the series. The Hyōtei and Shitenhoji models each offer eight modes featuring the schools’ regular players, switchable through the app. To see the other voice lines, please check the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-tp-s2. Special Design The charging cases sport glossy Hyōtei and Shitenhoji-themed color schemes, with original series logos on the sides and metal earbud parts. Complementing the first wave’s Seigaku and Rikkai models, this series offers a cohesive, collector-friendly set.

item.title: Nao Toyama Announces Upcoming Hiatus. Final Live Performance at the Nippon Budokan to Be Held Next Year!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Voice actress and singer Nao Toyama’s long-held dream “to reunite with everyone at the Nippon Budokan” will be coming true next year. The 10th Anniversary Final Live “Over The Rainbow at Nippon Budokan” will be held on March 11, 2027 and her upcoming hiatus from musical activities was also announced.
  • The announcement was made during a solo concert on February 8 in front of an in-person and livestream audience. She conveyed her message with a letter and requested her fans’ help in making her dream come true. She described her reason for the upcoming hiatus as “a positive decision to deliver a culmination of her decade-long journey and to think about the next phase of her career.” She did not announce when her upcoming hiatus will end. Her final concert will be held next year on her birthday, March 11, and promises to be a special event filled with emotions and shared alongside all those who’ve walked this path together with her, as they step forward into the future. Tickets to the concert will go on sale Wednesday, March 11, 2026 at 10 AM, Japan Standard Time.
  • Furthermore, a new album will be coming out as a culmination of her ten year-long musical career leading up to the Budokan concert. More details will be announced at a later date.
  • In addition, a live birthday countdown stream will be hosted on YouTube on Tuesday, March 10 at 11 PM (JST) where she’ll share more information about tickets and exclusive details regarding her final concert.
    • Nao Toyama’s Special 10th Anniversary Website: jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/toyamanao/10th

    Concert Information

    Title: 10th Anniversary Final Live “Over the Rainbow at Nippon Budokan” Performer: Nao Toyama Date/Time: Thursday, March 11, 2027 at 6 PM (Doors open at 5 PM) Place: Nippon Budokan, Tokyo

    Nao Toyama's Profile

    Birthday: March 11 Blood Type: A Hometown: Tokyo Hobbies: Singing, dancing, playing the electric organ Nao Toyama made her voice acting debut in 2010. She attracted a lot of attention for her role as Kanon Nakagawa in the TV anime The World God Only Knows. After that, she went on to play characters in numerous popular works, such as Karen Kujo in Kin-iro Mosaic, Chitoge Kirisaki in Nisekoi, Reina Prowler in MacrossΔ, and Rin Shima in Yuru CampΔ. She also belongs to popular groups Rhodanthe* and Walküre, both of which were born in anime, and has enthralled fans with her clear voice and flawless performances. On February 1, 2017, she made her debut as a singer with “True Destiny/Chain the world,” tie-up songs for the anime Chain Chronicle: Haecceitas no Hikari, and on February 3, 2018, she held her first solo live at the Nippon Budokan. In 2019, she held her first solo tour and performed overseas in Taipei and Shanghai. In 2020, she celebrated her 10th anniversary as a voice actress by releasing her character song best album “Special Thanks” and holding a 10th anniversary concert titled “Special Thanks! Festival” at Tokyo Garden Theater. In 2022, she celebrated the 5th anniversary of her singing debut with five projects. On February 22, 2025, she held her solo live concert “Watashi no Kangaeta Muteki na Setlist!” Social Media Official X (formerly Twitter): @naobou_official Line account search ID: toyamanao Artist homepage: toyamanao.com Official blog: ameblo.jp/naobouofficial Official YouTube channel: youtube.com/c/naobou_channel Instagram: @naobou_official TikTok account: tiktok.com/@official_naotoyama

item.title: Winners Announced for MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025, with Publication in Japan Confirmed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="Illustration by Seira Minami" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • KADOKAWA CORPORATION, in partnership with qdopp Inc. and MyAnimeList Co., Ltd., co-hosted the MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 – THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA. The English-language isekai fantasy novel contest was held on Honeyfeed, a novel submission platform operated by qdopp, with the goal of discovering exceptional storytelling talent from around the world. The winning works were announced today on the contest’s official webpage.
  • Out of a total of 1,240 entries, one Grand Prize winner and two Contest Winners Prize recipients were selected.
    • MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 – THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA Webpage: mhwc.myanimelist.net/202507

    Grand Prize “Isekai’d with my dog, I'm not the hero?!” by Frettiko

    An average guy named Mitsuta is reincarnated into another world along with his pet dog, Toast. However, the goddess becomes utterly smitten with the adorable Toast and grants all of the hero’s bonuses to him instead. For a level 99 “Hero” Pomeranian, defeating monsters is a walk in the park. Meanwhile, his owner Mitsuta remains stuck at level 1... Constantly dragged along by the free-spirited Toast, Mitsuta gathers a group of quirky companions and runs an odd-jobs business, gradually carving out a place for himself in this new world. At this rate, they might even end up defeating the Demon King someday? A fluffy, feel-good comedy about a fun-filled isekai life with a beloved pet. Go read “Isekai’d with my dog, I'm not the hero?!” on Honeyfeed.

    Contest Winners Prize “HR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with my Appraisal Skill” by Kaorin

    Hiroyuki, an HR manager, is summoned to another world by a goddess. He has no combat ability whatsoever, but armed with the Divine Appraisal skill, which reveals hidden potential, he recruits allies and assembles the ultimate party. As Hiroyuki builds his team, however, the shadow of an assassin targeting him draws near... In a world far harsher than expected, can this hero’s party stand up to the Demon Lord’s army? A grand adventure begins as Hiroyuki uses his appraisal skills to save the world. Go read “HR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with my Appraisal Skill” on Honeyfeed.

    Contest Winners Prize “Drinking Buddies: Hangover In Another World!” by Literate_Manul

    Marcus and Gus are transported to another world while hungover. Desperate to impress an elf princess, they end up boasting that they will “defeat one of the Demon Lord’s generals.” By sheer chance, Marcus awakens to beer magic and starts blasting beer while shouting “Hop Missile!”, while Gus’s right arm, whose power he cannot consciously control, suddenly awakens... With zero ability and zero planning, but unmatched bravado, these two men launch into a wildly unpredictable isekai buddy comedy! Go read “Drinking Buddies: Hangover In Another World” on Honeyfeed.

    Overall Review by KADOKAWA’s Editorial Department

    KADOKAWA’s first English-language novel contest on Honeyfeed received 1,240 submissions, the highest number in the platform’s contest history. We are deeply honored by this response and delighted to see such strong interest from English-speaking creators in Japan’s light novel market. Following a rigorous selection process, one Grand Prize winner and two Contest Winners Prize recipients were selected. After initial voting by Honeyfeed users and volunteers, the final judging was conducted by Aneko Yusagi (author of The Rising of the Shield Hero) and editors from KADOKAWA. The Grand Prize winner, Isekai’d with My Dog, I’m Not the Hero?!, stood out for its catchy, approachable premise, making it easy to imagine on the shelves of Japanese bookstores. The novel delivers plenty of laugh-out-loud comedic moments, along with charming portrayals of Toast, the adorable dog. We were eager to read more about Toast’s exploits, his bond with the protagonist Mitsuta, and Mitsuta’s growth over the course of the story. The author, Frettiko, will receive a cash award of USD 5,000. The winning work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and is scheduled for translation and publication in Japan, with a target release in 2027. The first Contest Winners Prize recipient, HR in Another World: Building the Strongest Parties with My Appraisal Skill, made effective use of the appraisal skill trope that has become a staple of the isekai genre, while capturing the distinctive feel of Japanese web novels. At the same time, its expansive setting evoked the scope of a large-scale open-world game. The careful portrayal of each character, along with story developments involving figures whose allegiance is unclear, added depth and originality to the narrative. The author, Kaorin, will receive a cash award of USD 3,000. The work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and revised with the aim of translation and publication in Japan. The second Contest Winners Prize recipient, Drinking Buddies: Hangover in Another World!, is a lighthearted comedy that keeps the pages turning. Its one-of-a-kind tone, blending concepts like “beer magic” with a chunibyo-style demonic arm, creates a brand of absurd humor that is strangely compelling. The two protagonists, Marcus and Gus, drinking buddies from our world, are character types rarely seen in Japanese fiction and are likely to feel fresh and distinctive to Japanese readers. The author, Literate_Manul, will receive a cash award of USD 3,000. The work will also be assigned a KADOKAWA editor and revised with the aim of translation and publication in Japan. Going forward, KADOKAWA plans to continue hosting web novel contests in Japan and abroad to discover talented writers from around the world who share a passion for Japanese entertainment content.

    Comment from Aneko Yusagi (author of The Rising of the Shield Hero) on the Grand Prize-Winning Work

    Isekai’d with My Dog, I’m Not the Hero?! feels like a novel written with a strong understanding of Japanese light novels. The characters are comical, the pacing is brisk, and the story offers a genuinely light, comedic reading experience. I read it with excitement, eager to see what would unfold in the misadventures of this delightfully mismatched party.

    About MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 – THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA

    Through this contest, KADOKAWA opened submissions worldwide for English-language isekai fantasy novels, looking for the next hit to follow in the footsteps of globally popular hits such as Overlord, Re:ZERO − Starting Life in Another World, The Rising of the Shield Hero, Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation, and Sword Art Online.

    About KADOKAWA’s Global UGC Content Development Project

    In recent years, Japanese anime has surged in popularity worldwide, with many hit titles originating from light novels. In parallel, overseas online novel platforms have seen a growing number of works influenced by Japanese light novels, becoming fertile ground for creators with global potential. In response, KADOKAWA launched the Global UGC Content Development Project in 2025 as part of its Global Business Acceleration Program, which supports new overseas-oriented business initiatives. Through this project, KADOKAWA aims to discover global talent from international novel submission platforms and publish their works in Japan and abroad to create new hit IPs. The MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 – THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA represents the first step in this effort. As another initiative under the same project, KADOKAWA also held the “Japan Debut Showdown☆Fantasy Light Novel Contest” in 2025 on KadoKado, a novel submission platform operated by Kadokawa Taiwan Corporation that accepts submissions in Traditional Chinese. The announcement of the winning works is scheduled for June 2026. In addition, plans are underway to publish Why Kill? When Witches Can Be Tentacled!, a work submitted to Honeyfeed, as well as selected winning titles from the JNC Original Light Novel Contest hosted by M12 Media LLC.

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. With a vibrant community of readers and writers, Honeyfeed provides an immersive space for storytelling across various genres, including anime and manga-inspired narratives. For more about Honeyfeed, please visit honeyfeed.fm.

    About MyAnimeList (MAL)

    MyAnimeList is one of the world’s largest communities and databases for Japanese anime and manga, with 16 million registered members from 240 countries and regions worldwide. An indispensable site for tracking anime and manga progress, it holds over 1.2 billion records of viewing and reading big data. Founded in 2004, MyAnimeList has become a crucial source of information for overseas fans, especially among Generation Z in North America. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net.

MyAnimeList and Honeyfeed Announce the Return of NOVELOUS Worlds for 2026, Powered by Shogakukan
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • MyAnimeList and Honeyfeed are proud to announce the return of NOVELOUS Worlds as part of the MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2026, inviting writers from around the world to craft original Rom-Com and Psychological Horror stories.
  • Powered by Shogakukan, this year’s contest offers aspiring authors the opportunity to reach new audiences by having their work featured on NOVELOUS, the official light novel reading app for North America.
  • Unlike traditional writing contests, NOVELOUS Worlds highlights more than just its winners. The top ten finalist novels will be showcased on the NOVELOUS app during the public voting period, allowing thousands of light novel fans across North America to discover emerging talent.

    • Contest Information

    Entry Fee: Free Writing Platform: Honeyfeed Voting Platform: NOVELOUS Novel Entry Period: February 16, 2026, at 20:00 EST – May 10, 2026, at 23:59 EDT Judges Voting Period: May 11 – June 28, 2026 Public Voting Period (Finals): June 29, 2026, at 21:00 EDT – July 27, 2026, at 23:59 EDT Winners Announced: August 12, 2026 Contest Prompts: Prompt 1: Rom-Com Prompt 2: Psychological Horror Prizes: - Most Voted “Rom-Com” Entry: US$3,000 - Most Voted “Psychological Horror” Entry: US$3,000 - Jury Choice Award (Across Both Prompts): US$3,000 Spotlight: All 10 finalist entries will be featured on the NOVELOUS app during the voting phase. NOVELOUS Worlds continues MyAnimeList and Honeyfeed’s mission to bridge global creators with the Japanese light novel industry, offering writers a platform to showcase their stories alongside professionally published works. For complete contest details, submission guidelines, and updates, please visit: mhwc.myanimelist.net/202602

    About NOVELOUS

    NOVELOUS is an app for reading Japanese light novels. While many people are already familiar with the countless anime and manga series born in Japan, light novels, which often serve as their source material, remain lesser-known. This is partly due to the lack of widespread translations. Through NOVELOUS, Shogakukan, one of Japan’s leading publishers, will introduce North American readers to light novels that have yet to gain wide recognition, offering translations directly from the source.

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. item.title: majiko to Release New Song “Ribbon” in April as Opening Theme for The Food Diary of Miss Maid
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer-songwriter majiko, who has garnered over 200 million streams across Asia and more than 580,000 YouTube subscribers, has been chosen to perform the opening theme for the TV anime The Food Diary of Miss Maid, which will begin airing in April. A new artist photo has also been released.
  • The new song is titled “Ribbon” and is scheduled for digital release in April to coincide with the anime’s broadcast. A preview of the track can be heard in the anime’s newly released promotional video.
  • This will be majiko’s first anime tie-in since moving to Bandai Namco Music Live’s label UNIERA in July 2025. After releasing the EP GOLDEN JUNKIE last October and holding a solo concert in December, majiko continues to expand her activities in the music scene.

    • Comment From majiko

    I had the honor of writing a brand-new song titled “Ribbon” for the opening of The Food Diary of Miss Maid. When I read the story, I remember feeling my heart slowly warm, thinking, “What a gentle, heartwarming world this is...!” As I reflected on where I had felt this kind of warmth before, I realized it was in my interactions with all of you, my fans. “Ribbon” is a song I wrote by blending Suzume-chan’s bright way of finding happiness in everyday life with the many heartfelt feelings I’ve received from my fans. I would be happy if this song, along with the series, could softly tie itself into your daily lives as well.

    Product Information

    GOLDEN JUNKIE Now available on music streaming websites: lnk.to/GOLDEN_JUNKIE

    About majiko

    Since 2010, majiko has been posting cover songs on video-sharing platforms, gradually building a following in the online scene. She writes, composes, arranges, and illustrates her own work, showcasing her multifaceted talents across a range of creative activities. In recent years, she has held solo shows in China and Taiwan, and with over 200 million streams across Asia, her growing success is now drawing attention both regionally and worldwide. Mrs. GREEN APPLE Drops “lulu.” Season 2 OP Theme for Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End with Surprise Music Video
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Mrs. GREEN APPLE released their new song “lulu.” today. Originally announced as the first track of Phase 3, a new chapter in the band’s career that began on New Year’s Day, the song has now been revealed as the opening theme for season 2 of the anime Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End, which begins airing on January 16.
  • A music video for “lulu.” was also surprise-released on Mrs. GREEN APPLE’s official YouTube channel. Ahead of this release, a YouTube livestream began at 10:00 p.m. on January 11 after only the stream URL was posted on social media, without prior explanation. The livestream ran for approximately two hours before transitioning directly into the premiere of the “lulu.” music video, with peak concurrent viewership exceeding 200,000.
  • Unlike Phase 2, when music videos were typically announced in advance, the release of “lulu.” took place without prior notice, marking an unpredictable start to Phase 3 for Mrs. GREEN APPLE.
    • https://youtu.be/MjeiIal1ZR0

    Comment from Motoki Ohmori (Vo/Gt)

    I’ve loved the series since the original manga, so it’s an honor to be involved. “lulu.” is a song about life, treasured things, memories, and will being passed from one person to another, flowing steadily into today and on to tomorrow. It also conveys the strength to move forward while carrying one’s hometown in one’s heart. As a fan of Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End, I’m already very much looking forward to what this season will depict. I hope you’ll enjoy “lulu.” alongside the series. https://youtu.be/RH-FcW94z00

    Song Information

    Mrs. GREEN APPLE Digital Single Title: lulu. OP theme for Season 2 of Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End Release Date: January 12, 2026 lnk.to/MGA_lulu_0112

    About Mrs. GREEN APPLE

    Motoki Ohmori (Vo/Gt) instagram.com/motoki_ohmori_mga Hiroto Wakai (Gt) instagram.com/hiloto_wakai_mga Ryoka Fujisawa (Key) instagram.com/ryoka_fujisawa_mga Mrs. GREEN APPLE was formed in 2013 and made their major debut in 2015 with the mini-album Variety. After releasing their best album 5 in July 2020, the band temporarily suspended activities before resuming in March 2022 following a hiatus of approximately one year and eight months. Their return was marked by the comeback concert “Utopia” and the release of the mini-album Unity on July 8. Later that year, they released “Soranji,” the theme song for the film Fragments of the Last Will. In 2023, their 10th anniversary year, Mrs. GREEN APPLE released the album ANTENNA, staged their largest arena tour to date along with their first dome shows, won the Japan Record Award with “Que Sera Sera,” and made their debut appearance on NHK’s Kohaku Uta Gassen with “Dance Hall.” In 2024, they released “Nachtmusik,” the theme song for the film Silent Love, followed by “Lilac,” the opening theme for the TV anime Oblivion Battery. Across major streaming platforms, 31 of the band’s songs have each surpassed 100 million plays. Among them, “Ao to Natsu” has exceeded 900 million plays, while multiple tracks including “Tenbyou no Uta (feat. Sonoko Inoue),” “Dance Hall,” and “Lilac” have surpassed 800 million. item.title: Rico Sasaki Announces Full-Length Album RI PATHOS, Featuring Ten All-New Tracks
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer and voice actress Rico Sasaki has announced that she will release her full-length album RI PATHOS on June 3, 2026. Featuring ten all-new songs, the album reflects her journey to date and the future she is moving toward as an artist.
  • Each track is built around themes closely connected to Sasaki herself, with the album as a whole shaped by the choices she has made and the people she has encountered along the way, including detours and unexpected turns.
  • The limited first-press edition will include a bonus track, “Tezukuri no Uta,” the first song for which Sasaki wrote both the lyrics and music herself.
  • In addition, tracks from the album will be released digitally over five consecutive months ahead of the full release. The first advance track, “Maru de Matryoshka,” is now available on streaming services.

    • Comment from Rico Sasaki

    The full album RI PATHOS represents the path I have walked so far. Even when things didn’t go smoothly, moments of uncertainty or stopping to move at my own pace were all important parts of that journey. I believe the time I spent taking those detours was necessary to connect with people I could never have met by moving straight ahead. Driven by passion, this album captures, in new songs, the moments when my soul was deeply moved. Through the five months of advance digital releases and the album’s release, I would be happy if you would continue walking this path together with me.

item.title: REIRIE Reveals New Artist Photos and “AISHITEYO” Music Video Ahead of Major-Label Debut EP Amethyst
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • REIRIE, a two-member unit formed in 2023 by Rei Kuromiya and Rie Kaneko, will make their major-label debut with the release of their first EP, Amethyst, on January 28, 2026, via MoooD Records, a label under Bandai Namco Music Live. Ahead of the release, the group has unveiled new artist photos, the EP’s jacket artwork, and the music video for “AISHITEYO,” one of the tracks featured on Amethyst.
  • The new visuals feature a black-and-white palette set against the theme color of amethyst. Styling that layers contrasting materials such as lace, fur, and leather reflects REIRIE’s balance of stillness and movement. Their delicate yet sharp demeanor leaves a strong impression as the start of a new chapter.
  • Amethyst will be released in three editions: the REI Edition, the RIE Edition, and the Standard Edition. The REI Edition includes a Blu-ray featuring footage from the free live show “JAM,” held on September 12 at Kabukicho Tower Stage, while the RIE Edition comes with a Blu-ray of the Tokyo performance from REIRIE Live Tour 2025 -BaD＝DoLL-, held on October 26. As a first-press bonus, all editions will include one randomly selected trading card from a set of six.
  • The EP comprises five tracks rooted in guitar rock, incorporating emotional, alternative, and R&B elements that highlight the duo’s expressive range and vocal contrast. The advance digital single “BaD＝DoLL,” composed by Yuki Tsujimura and MEGMETAL, delivers an emotionally charged rock sound. “AISHITEYO,” by the same creative team, channels raw emotion and heightened drama, further brought to life in the music video released today.
  • The EP also features “Holy Brighters,” which portrays heroism that moves forward despite doubt and anxiety, “Not Philosophy,” which explores strength and love through emotion rather than words, and “Contact,” a soulful R&B-based track that affirms even pain and inner conflict.
  • In addition, REIRIE will launch their nationwide tour, “REIRIE Live Tour 2026 -Amethyst-,” in February 2026. Spanning 12 cities, the tour will be the largest of the group’s career to date.

item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Maaya Sakamoto just released her newest digital single “Tokei”, which has also been chosen as the theme song for the final chapter of popular mobile RPG Fate/Grand Order. The multi-talented singer, voice actress, actress, songwriter and essayist released her 30th anniversary album M30~Your Best~ in October 2025.
  • “Tokei” is the sixth track in the Fate/Grand Order series, following “Shikisai”, “Gyakko”, “Kuuhaku”, “Yakudo” and “Dokuhaku”. Maaya Sakamoto wrote the lyrics herself and composed the theme song for the conclusion of the series she has been a part of for ten years.
  • The theme song is an emotional track depicting “hope for the future”, setting it apart from previous theme songs from the FGO series. Ryo Eguchi arranged the song, a member of la la larks who helped compose and arrange “Shikisai” and the arrangement for “Gyakko”.
  • The result is a richly-layered track that is fitting for the final chapter of the FGO series, created by a team who know the series by heart.
  • The music video for “Tokei” premiered December 29 and features an animated style, numerous characters from the Fate/Grand Order series, and visuals that complement the grand finale of the work and its theme song.
    • https://youtu.be/BGURhEDsAnw

    Release information

    Artist: Maaya Sakamoto Title: Tokei (theme song for final chapter of Mobile RPG Fate/Grand Order) Date: December 28, 2025 Lyrics and composition: Maaya Sakamoto, Arrangement: Ryo Eguchi, String arrangement: Ryo Eguchi and miri

    Streaming information

    Available on select music streaming services and major music download platforms such as iTunes Store, Rekochoku and mora December 28, 2025! Streaming services: Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube Music, LINE MUSIC, Amazon Music, Deezer, AWA, Rakuten Music, KKBOX, Qobuz Watch the music video on Apple Music, YouTube Music, LINE MUSIC, and U-NEXT.

    About Maaya Sakamoto

    Born in Tokyo, she began her career as a child actress at the age of eight. She made her CD debut in 1996 with the single “Yakusoku wa Iranai.” Following her 2011 album You Can’t Catch Me, which topped the Oricon chart, she began actively collaborating with a wide range of other artists and musicians. Since her 2013 album Singer-Songwriter, she has also been composing music for other artists. In 2019, she released her 30th single “Uchuu no Kioku” (produced by Ringo Sheena) and her 10th original album Kyou Dake no Ongaku. In 2020, she released her 25th anniversary album Single Collection+ Achikochi and the digital single “Yakudo,” which topped the Oricon chart. In July 2021, her radio program “Vitamin M,” which she had been hosting for 20 years, reached its 1,000th broadcast and entered its 21st year. In May 2022, she released the double tie-up single “Sumire / Kotoba ni Dekinai,” with music written and arranged by Shigeru Kishida. In October 2025, she released her latest album celebrating her 30th anniversary as an artist, M30~Your Best~. To date, she has released 36 singles and 11 full albums. In addition to writing her own original songs, she has also written lyrics for other artists, including Kinki Kids’ “Hikari no Kehai,” Mamoru Miyano’s “Toumei,” and Walküre’s “Kaze wa Yokoku Naku Fuku,” and has published her own lyrics book Shishu (Kadokawa). She won the 38th Kazuo Kikuta Theater Award for her performance as Jerusha in the musical Daddy-Long-Legs. As of December 12, she is currently appearing in the latest production of Daddy-Long-Legs at Hibiya Theatre Crea as Jerusha for the first time in five years. Her latest essay collection Manpukuron - Asu ni Kaburitsuke (Kadokawa) has also garnered attention. In addition to her singing career, she is active as a voice actress, actress, lyricist, essayist, and radio personality. TV Anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka OP Theme Song “Kirei.” and ED Theme Song “Wakaba no Koro” Announced!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • New information regarding the release of upcoming singles “Kirei.” and “Wakaba no Koro,” the opening and ending theme songs for TV anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, have been released. Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, also known as “Wash It All Away” in English adaptations, will begin airing January 5, 2026. The original work by popular manga artist Mitsuru Hattori is a heartwarming series that follows a cleaning service based in Atami, Japan.
  • The opening theme song “Kirei.” is performed by up-and-coming singer Yuu., known for her powerful vocal abilities and expressive voice, who has become popular among teens and twenty-somethings with over 370,000 subscribers on YouTube. The song was written and composed by Vocaloid producer Jin, renowned for songs such as “Yobanashi Deceive” and “Summertime Record” and for providing music for numerous forms of content.
  • Yuu.’s first CD release has also been announced. First edition copies and standard edition copies will be available. The first edition copies will come with a bonus Blu-ray disc. More details will be released at a later date. The standard edition bonus track will be produced by Takaaki Natsushiro, a popular Vocaloid producer, composer and artist known for hit tracks like “From Tokyo.” The first edition bonus track will be produced by popular creator NayutalieN, known for “Solar System Disco”, an addictive track with over 10 million views on YouTube.
  • The ending theme song “Wakaba no Koro” is written and performed by songwriter and actress Natsumi Kiyoura. The heartfelt pop song was written through the eyes of the anime’s main character Wakana Kinme. Both the theme song and the additional bonus tracks were produced by Katsutoshi Kitagawa from Round Table, who has supported Kiyoura’s live performances throughout the years.
  • Kiyoura’s latest artist photo has also been released! The photo and CD jacket were photographed in Atami, where the upcoming anime takes place. CD jacket details will be released at a later date.
  • Both opening and ending theme songs will be available to stream January 5, 2026!

    • Comments From Yuu. (Singer for OP Theme Song “Kirei.”)

    I’m Yuu., nice to meet you!It’s an honor to perform the opening theme song. I’m very happy to be singing my very first anime theme song at 20 years old! I sang while imagining the beautiful sea of Atami and cherishing the human connections and feelings of warmth that are evident throughout this story. I hope you enjoy this anime while appreciating the heartwarming scenes and feelings it evokes.

    Comment From Jin (Writer and Composer for OP Theme Song “Kirei.”)

    Things that are clean, transparent, and tidy. Things that change shape over time. Things that are layered with stains and scratches that give them character. “Kirei” comes to mind. Such a word that is soaked in human emotion is the theme of this song.

    Comment From Natsumi Kiyoura (Singer and Lyrics for ED Theme Song “Wakaba no Koro”)

    My first impression of the original manga left me pondering Ms. Kinme’s dedication to her work and her kindness, as well as the dappling sunlight through the trees and seasons we see during our everyday life. “Wakaba no Koro” captures the feelings of early summer, fleeting moments of youth, and singular pages in the story of life. You can trust the ending theme song for this anime in my hands.

    Comment From Katsutoshi Kitagawa (Producer for ED Theme Song “Wakaba no Koro”)

    Having lived in Hakodate until high school, imagining life in a coastal town brought back memories. Like biking to the shore and spending the afternoon with a paperback book. I thought I’d like to make a song that is filled with the essence of the original work and my memories like the smell of a seaside town. I hope you can feel the softness of the acoustic guitar and string instruments and the warmth of the woodwinds.

    uct Information

    TV Anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka OP Theme Song “Kirei.” by Yuu. Release Date: March 4, 2026 First edition (CD and Blu-ray): VTZL-267 / 3,850 yen (tax in.) Standard edition (CD): VTCL-35392 / 1,430 yen (tax in.) Tracklist First edition 1. Kirei. (Written and composed by Jin/ Producer: Sucrose) 2. Title Unannounced (NayutalieN) More track details coming soon. Bonus Blu-ray disc details coming soon. Standard edition 1. Kirei. (Written and composed by Jin/ Producer: Sucrose) 2. Title Unannounced (Written and composed by Takaaki Natsushiro) 3. Kirei. (TV size) 4. Title Unannounced (Instrumental) TV Anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka ED Theme Song “Wakaba no Koro” by Natsumi Kiyoura Release Date: March 11, 2026 VTCL-35393 / 1,430 yen (tax in.) Tracklist 1. Wakaba no Koro (Lyrics: Natsumi Kiyoura, Composer/Producer: Katsutoshi Kitagawa) 2. Bokura no Mirai (Lyrics: Natsumi Kiyoura, Composer/Producer: Katsutoshi Kitagawa) 3. Wakaba no Koro (Instrumental) 4. Bokura no Mirai (Instrumental)

    Streaming Information

    Both songs will be available from January 5, 2026 (24:00 JST) on select music streaming services and major music download platforms such as iTunes Store, Rekochoku, mora and more. Streaming services: Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube Music, LINE MUSIC, Amazon Music, Deezer, AWA, Rakuten Music, KKBOX.

    About Yuu.

    Born December 22, 2005. She began singing as a child and started posting covers of songs on YouTube at 12 years old. At 13 years old, she was releasing high-quality cover songs with the mixing and producing all handled by herself. Upon graduating high school, she began to take her hobby as a musical artist more seriously. On the last day of high school, she released her first single “Seishun Saigo no 1 Page” with her acquaintance SAKURAmoti, another Vocaloid producer of the same age. Her song about the sentimental feelings of school life, and her cheerful and unique voice, encouraged many of her peers. Afterwards, her a cappella short videos became popular on YouTube and TikTok, gaining approximately 200,000 subscribers in just a few months. As of December 2025, her YouTube subscriber count has surpassed 370,000. In August 2025, she released her second single, “Highlight!”. Her popularity caught the attention of a record label, she was chosen to sing the theme song to TV anime Kirei ni Shitemoraemasu ka, premiering January 2026! Keep an eye on this rising star and her future activities as a solo singer. SNS Platforms X: x.com/Yuu_mr_ YouTube: youtube.com/@Yuu_mr TikTok: tiktok.com/@yuu_mr

    About Natsumi Kiyoura

    Born in Chiba, Japan July 4, 1990. She debuted as a film and TV actress at age 12. Her music career launched in 2007 with her single “Kaze Sagashi”, released by Flying Dog. She formed the group Tweedees in 2015 and went on to release four more albums and two mini-albums through Nippon Columbia. In 2024, she released her first solo mini-album Breakfast. She left TWEEDEES in March 2025 to pursue activities as a solo artist. She has participated as a vocalist in a wide range of works including commercials, movies, dramas, anime, and games. She is also active as a lyricist and provides songs to other artists. SNS Platforms and Official Sites X (Twitter): x.com/kiyouranatsumi Instagram: instagram.com/kiyo_723 YouTube: youtube.com/@kiyoura723 Official Site and Fan Community: kiyouranatsumi.bitfan.id

  • The third trailer for upcoming new anime Easygoing Territory Defense by the Optimistic Lord, airing January of next year, has been revealed along with the ending theme song which will be sung by Nonoka Obuchi. “Make it” will be her third single and is scheduled to be released February 25, 2026. A new artist photo and CD jacket photo has also been revealed.
  • The popular “isekai” fantasy series Easygoing Territory Defense by the Optimistic Lord: Production Magic Turns a Nameless Village into the Strongest Fortified City has gained a following for its thrilling exploits and the unyielding personalities of its characters, with over 2.5 million physical and digital copies sold.
  • The latest update on the upcoming anime revealed the third trailer, the second teaser visual, new characters and the ending theme song. The new character Lada Priora will be voiced by voice actress and singer, Nonoka Obuchi, who also sings the ending theme song for the anime “Make it.” Nonoka Obuchi’s third single “Make it” is scheduled to be released February 25, 2026.
  • The new single will be released in three editions: the standard edition, anime edition, and a limited edition that comes with one of ten randomly chosen autographed polaroids and a photobook that came with her first and second singles. “Make it,” produced by emon(Tes.), is a gentle track with an upbeat sound that invites listeners to unwind. Check out a snippet of the new single in the latest teaser for the anime. The limited edition single will also come with a recording of Fuwari’s “SweetRoom823,” the theme song for Obuchi’s upcoming drama Fukukaicho no Omona Oshigoto, scheduled for January 2026. Standard and anime editions of the single will feature more songs written and produced by artists such as Karasuyasabo, Yasuhiro, and furu_ri.
  • The jacket cover for the standard and limited edition singles is florally-inspired, featuring Nonoka Obuchi with a stunning bouquet of flowers. The anime edition will feature a special illustration that will be released at a later date.

    • Nonoka Obuchi’s Comment

    When I first read the original series, I was moved by the warmth of Van and his crew, despite coming from various walks of life. If you worry about what you were born with or where you are currently, give this song a listen, take yourself by the hand and take it easy.

    emon(Tes.)’s comment

    This song is my attempt at giving sound to the feelings of the characters and the atmosphere of the original work. Music builds on the emotions that are brought forth from a story, so I’d be happy if this song sits quietly in the heart of everyone who listens to it.

item.title: [Honey’s Anime Interview] Nowlu: The Voice Behind “Shirogarasu” and Her New EP "Dose"
item.content:encoded:
With a growing international fanbase and a sound that’s been catching more and more ears, Nowlu is becoming a name people don’t just hear, but remember. We had the chance to talk with her once again, this time about her new EP, the journey so far, and the mindset behind the artist fans have come to love.

Nowlu
Honey-Chan
Interview with Nowlu
[gray-hex-decoration]
Hello, Nowlu. Welcome back to Honey's Anime! So, for those who don't know you, your artist name “Nowlu” is described as combining the words “Night," "Owl." and "Luna”. Could you tell us how you came up with this name, and which aspects of those words resonate with your music?
Thank you! Nowlu comes from the image of a lone owl spreading its wings toward the moon (or the world) at night. My team and I explored words inspired by my voice and discussed them until we arrived at this name. It’s difficult to compare the words individually, but I feel the “Night” aspect shines through most strongly in the worlds my voice creates.
That’s so cool and poetic! Your music often blends R&B, neo‐city‐pop, 80s/90s inspired beats, and a smoky voice. How do you balance these stylistic elements with your own personal sound?
When I sing, I try to preserve a sense of nostalgia while also challenging myself with new things.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DgXTP6Y59I
Can you tell us about your most recent release, the ending theme of the TV anime "Mugen Gacha" (Backstabbed in a Backwater Dungeon)? What kind of feeling or message did you want listeners to carry with them after hearing ‘Shirogarasu’?
“Shirogarasu” means “white crow.” In this song, the crow symbolizes revenge and white symbolizes justice. A white crow is a metaphor for something impossible, which ties into the story, and it also reflects the protagonist Light, who carries both light and shadow within him. That overlap made the title feel like a perfect fit. Flight usually carries a positive image of moving forward with determination, but I approached it from a different angle. The lyrics contain traces of irony toward those driven by revenge, as if saying “I’m above you.” The words evoke a “quietly burning inner blue flame,” and the sharp, spicy piano lines give it a tingling edge, creating a sophisticated, cool house track. I hope listeners enjoy that interplay. Even if the story’s exhilarating moments leave you drained, I think this song will help you remember your purpose again and serve as the fuel that carries you to the next episode.
Your new EP 'Dose' was released on September 1, 2025 and features six previously released songs and the brand-new title track of the same name. In choosing to build the EP around your earlier works together with this new song, what was your intention behind the title Dose? How do you see the title track reflecting your growth or change as an artist, especially compared with the previous songs included?
The new song “Dose” opens the EP, and from there, the previously released tracks trace my journey. It’s like a profile of the path I’ve walked so far. “Dose” is about a truly painful night in my life. I felt the fear and loneliness of being unnecessary, and the vague anxiety of wondering how long it would last, until it built up to the point where I could barely breathe. It was terrifying and agonizing. Humans tend to beautify memories, so eventually even this will fade and be forgotten. At the time, I wanted to forget it because it was so painful, but I also remembered the desperate notes I had scribbled during those days. “Dose” was actually the working title. It’s a word of resignation in Japanese, but it was this word that somehow pulled me out of that unbearable suffering. I decided to turn it into a song because I felt that the memory of that night, and the emotional outburst it carried, might offer comfort to someone else. Even though it’s a song born from despair, I also wanted people to feel the melody and move to it. So I focused on singing in a more danceable, groovy way than usual. I hope that comes through.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdZPNeEBTbo
Your song “Stuck on you,” one of our favorites, achieved major streaming success overseas, especially in North America. How does it feel to have an international audience, and how do you keep in mind the global listeners when creating music?
This year, I performed live overseas for the first time, in Brazil and Malaysia, and had the chance to meet listeners face-to-face. That’s when I truly felt, “Ah, I really am Nowlu.” (laughs) At the same time, I was genuinely amazed that, even in countries with different languages, there are listeners singing along with Japanese lyrics. It’s such a wonderful and heartwarming experience, and it reminded me once again of just how incredible Japanese anime is. Because I have so many global listeners, I’m particularly careful with my lyrics and ways of expressing myself, aiming to let people feel the beauty and depth of the Japanese language.
Are there any songs in your repertoire that you feel more personally connected to, or that tell a story you’re especially proud of?
Of course, all of my songs and works are meaningful, but if I had to choose, I’d say “Yoin” and “Dose.” “Yoin” is a song about a fresh start and was also the ending theme for my first TV drama (Wingman), so it’s deeply memorable and holds a special place in my heart, fulfilling a dream I’ve had since childhood. “Dose” isn’t just cool musically, it’s very much a reflection of my heart. I hope to make it a song that many people can love deeply and for a long time.
And where do you imagine yourself artistically in five years? Any dream projects, genres to explore, or performance venues to conquer?
I want to be surrounded by the voices of tens of thousands of people singing my songs. Absolutely. I also want to keep expressing, through my words and poetry, what I believe is right, along with a touch of irony, without compromise. A major goal of mine is to stand on the stage of Madison Square Garden, where the person I admired and who inspired me to start singing once stood, and take in the same view they saw.
When her latest EP was released, we had it on repeat for days. And now, after talking with Nowlu, it’s easy to understand why people connect with her music: there’s honesty, a little grit, and a lot of heart behind everything she creates. If you haven’t already, check out her new EP 'Dose' or dive into her earlier tracks. You can also follow her on social media to keep up with her news and future releases.
Connect with Nowlu Official website Youtube Twitter Instagram Spotify YouTube Music Apple Music

  • It’s been announced that Macross Frontier Galaxy Live☆Final 2025 will be released on blu-ray April 29, 2026. The two-day live concert was held over the weekend of July 26-27 this year at K Arena in Yokohama, and welcomed 38,000 people, making it the largest event in the history of Macross.
  • It’s been 17 years since Macross Frontier first aired on TV, yet the hype lives on. The news was announced during Sheryl Nome’s birthday event on November 23. Not only is April 29 Ranka Lee’s birthday, it also marks exactly one year since the release of Macross Frontier All-Time Best Album Nyan Nyan Greatest☆Hits!
  • Macross Frontier Galaxy Live☆Final 2025 took place July 26 and 27 at K Arena in Yokohama. The two-day event welcomed 38,000 concertgoers, making it the largest concert in Macross history. The Blu-ray release will include the encore segment of the concert that took place on Alto Saotome’s birthday July 27 with the appearance of special guest Yoko Kanno. The main disc will also include commentary on the concert by May’n and Megumi Nakajima.
  • Limited and special editions will include a photobook of the concert and a special blu-ray disc featuring songs from the first day of the concert, making-of footage, and interviews. The special edition will also include a CD recording of the live concert, a set of two silver tape straps and two acrylic stands, all packaged in a deluxe “Yack Deculture” case. The cover illustration for the blu-ray release, designed by character designer for Macross Frontier Risa Ebata, was also released. More information regarding the blu-ray will be provided on the official product website.

Daoko Releases Music Video for “Rhythm in the Sunset,” Lead Track From New EP meta millefeuille
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Daoko has released a music video for “Rhythm in the Sunset,” the lead track from her latest digital EP meta millefeuille, which came out on November 19, 2025.
  • The popular “isekai” fantasy series Easygoing Territory Defense by the Optimistic Lord: Production Magic Turns a Nameless Village into the Strongest Fortified City has gained a following for its thrilling exploits and the unyielding personalities of its characters, with over 2.5 million physical and digital copies sold.
  • The video was directed by Yuichiro Saeki, who previously handled Daoko’s music videos “Otogi no Machi” and “Kaeritai!” and is currently joining her Asia tour as a VJ. The piece blends nostalgic footage from Daoko’s everyday life with modern graphics, creating a warm, 2000s-inspired work that evokes brief flashes of memory.
    • https://youtu.be/oTyn9eP8oGE

    Daoko’s Comment

    I put this song together by arranging my favorite words found in everyday life to match namitape’s exciting sound. While creating it, I pictured scenes from a walk, and with that image in mind, I wanted the music video to feel familiar and approachable, so I asked Director Saeki, with whom I have a close relationship and whom I deeply respect. The shoot was very enjoyable, with a calm, pleasant atmosphere throughout. The gentle expressions we captured during that warm, sunlit moment are closer to my natural self than what I’ve shown before, which makes me feel a little shy, but Director Saeki brought everything together beautifully, so I hope you enjoy it.

    Yuichiro Saeki's Comment

    I hope you can enjoy Daoko’s expressions and gestures, which shine with a unique radiance while remaining true to herself, together with the world of the song.

    Video Credits

    Starring: Daoko Director: Yuichiro Saeki Director of Photography: Ryuichi Taniura Camera Assistant: Kaoru Noguchi Stylist: Mika Masuda Hair & Makeup: Natsuho Makino Lyric Design: Minoru Shimizu Location Support: Chofu Film Commission Producer: Masato Kudo Produced by FAB A music video for the EP track “MeeM” is scheduled to be released on December 3. The digital EP meta millefeuille, featuring “Rhythm in the Sunset” and “MeeM,” is available now. It includes five tracks in total, among them the July single “Zense wa Bushō” (arranged by Seiichi Nagai), the September single “Boku dake no Photon” (arranged by x0o0x_), and “Iiyo,” the opening theme for the TV anime Who Made Me a Princess, arranged by GuruConnect. The artwork is by rising illustrator Yu. Under the theme of “kawaii,” the collection brings together a series of finely crafted pop tracks that showcase Daoko’s sharp, distinctive sensibility and her intimate connection to everyday life, marking her latest musical direction.

    Release Information

    Daoko Digital EP meta millefeuille Out now! Find it on your favorite streaming service! lnk.to/meta_millefeuille Tracklist 1. MeeM Lyrics: Daoko Composition: Daoko Arrangement: GuruConnect 2. Iiyo Lyrics: Daoko Composition: GuruConnect, Daoko Arrangement: GuruConnect 3. Zense wa Busho Lyrics: Daoko Composition: Seiichi Nagai, Daoko Arrangement: Seiichi Nagai 4. Boku dake no Photon Lyrics: Daoko Composition: x0o0x_, Daoko Arrangement: x0o0x_ 5. Rhythm in the Sunset Lyrics: Daoko Composition: namitape, Daoko Arrangement: nametape
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Jacket Illustration: Yu

    Daoko's Profile

    Tokyo-born in 1997, Daoko rose to prominence at 15 with a song uploaded to Niconico Douga, making her major debut in 2015. Since then, she’s been active across music, anime, and commercial projects. Her hit collaboration with Kenshi Yonezu, “Uchiage Hanabi,” has surpassed 600 million views on YouTube. A multi-talented creator, Daoko has also written novels, organized live events, held painting exhibitions, and acted, earning high acclaim both in Japan and abroad. She founded her own agency, teftef, in 2019. Alongside her solo activities, she began performing as part of the band QUBIT in 2023. In 2024, she released her first solo album in about four years, Slash-&-Burn, and drew attention with her featured appearance on Shiina Ringo’s seventh album track, “a grand triumphant return.” In 2025, she attracted further notice for her collaboration with Giga & TeddyLoid, “ACT feat. Daoko.” On November 19, her latest EP meta millefeuille was released digitally. PassCode Reveals New Song at Arena Concert! Roll Over and Die Tie-Up to Be Released as Single Next Year!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • On November 9, the four-member female vocal and dance group PassCode held their arena concert PassCode YOKOHAMA BUNTAI 2025 “DESTINEX” at Yokohama BUNTAI in Kanagawa. Marking their first arena performance in about three years and nine months since their 2022 Budokan show, the event was a special occasion for both the group and their fans. On this day, they surprised the audience with the first-ever live performance of their latest song “Liberator,” announced as the opening theme for the TV anime Roll Over and Die, set to begin airing in January 2026. They also revealed that the song will be released as a single on March 4, 2026.
  • Published by Micro Magazine, Roll Over and Die is a dark fantasy story about the protagonist, Flum, who, despite having zero stats, is chosen by the God Origin to join the Hero’s Party and continues to push forward alongside newfound companions. PassCode’s opening theme “Liberator” can be heard in the anime’s newly released PV.
  • Alongside the single announcement, PassCode unveiled a new artist photo featuring the denim-based outfits worn at Yokohama BUNTAI. The fresh visual marks a shift from their previous images, showcasing a brighter, more pop-inspired style.
  • It was also announced that the Yokohama BUNTAI concert will be exclusively streamed on U-NEXT, with the streaming start date to be revealed later via PassCode’s official social media. Leading up to that release, several past performances will be available for unlimited streaming: PassCode ASIA TOUR 2024 Final at Zepp Osaka Bayside on November 13, PassCode presents VERSUS PASSCODE 2024 Vol.2 at Spotify O-EAST on November 27, and PassCode Zephyren 10th Anniversary A.V.E.S.T project Kodo at Yoyogi National Stadium First Gymnasium on December 18. Whether you couldn’t make it to the arena or joined the excitement in person, you can relive the energy through these past live performances before the Yokohama BUNTAI stream goes live.
    • https://youtu.be/kgPDvYyeJzk

    About PassCode

    PassCode consists of four members: Nao Minami, Kaede Takashima, Hinako Ogami, and Emily Arima. They have a versatile repertoire based on a band sound, punctuated by their distinctive shouts and screams, and have performed at numerous major festivals such as SUMMER SONIC and ROCK IN JAPAN FESTIVAL, earning broad support from both rock enthusiasts and idol fans. After making their major debut in 2016, they released their first international album Ex Libris PassCode in America, Europe, and Canada under the UK’s JPU Records in October 2018. The track “Ichikabachika” from their 2019 album CLARITY was selected as the opening theme for the TV drama Kakegurui season 2 and the movie Kakegurui. In 2020, their single “STARRY SKY,” which was chosen as the theme song for the drama 182 Days Left, earned them their first-ever No. 1 on the Oricon Weekly Single Chart and Billboard JAPAN Weekly Single Chart. They also made their debut appearance on Nippon Broadcasting System’s All Night Nippon 0. In February 2022, they held their first concert at Nippon Budokan. In 2023, they embarked on their first US tour, “PassCode US / JAPAN TOUR 2023 -GROUNDSWELL-,” which included stops in Dallas, Los Angeles, and New York, as well as 11 cities and 12 venues in Japan. In June 2024, they moved to Bandai Namco Music Live. Their September release “WILLSHINE” was chosen as the OP theme for season 2 of the anime SHY, and their new song “SKILLAWAKE” was selected as the OP theme for season 2 of As a Reincarnated Aristocrat, I’ll Use My Appraisal Skill to Rise in the World. Looking ahead, their first arena concert in about three years, PassCode YOKOHAMA BUNTAI 2025 “DESTINEX”, is scheduled for November 2025. item.title: AVIOT Releases The Prince of Tennis II Collaboration True Wireless Earbuds in North America!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has released its The Prince of Tennis II collaboration true wireless earbuds in North America. The earbuds are available in two models themed after the series’ iconic schools: TE-V1R-TP1, inspired by Seishun Academy (Seigaku), and TE-V1R-TP2, inspired by Rikkai University-Affiliated Middle School (Rikkai).
  • Based on the TE-V1R, the TE-V1R-TP1 and TE-V1R-TP2 are special edition wireless earbuds designed to fully capture the charm of The Prince of Tennis II.
  • The Seigaku model includes voices from nine characters: Ryoma Echizen, Kunimitsu Tezuka, Shuichiro Oishi, Shusuke Fuji, Sadaharu Inui, Eiji Kikumaru, Takashi Kawamura, Takeshi Momoshiro, and Kaoru Kaido. The Rikkai model includes eight characters: Seiichi Yukimura, Genichiro Sanada, Renji Yanagi, Masaharu Niou, Hiroshi Yagyu, Bunta Marui, Jackal Kuwahara, and Akaya Kirihara.
  • Together, the two models contain 350 newly recorded voice lines, from operational voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status to a “random voice” function that plays memorable quotes from the series. Users can switch between 17 modes through the dedicated app.
  • From the earbuds and charging case to the packaging, every detail has been carefully crafted for a premium, fan-focused experience, with audio tuned by series composer UZA for optimal music playback. In the promotional video, Ryoma Echizen and Kunimitsu Tezuka themselves introduce the products. Please check it out!
    • https://youtu.be/MZGwMhqIjcE

    Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOT’s popular V series, which has sold approximately 190,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDAC™ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of April 2025 Special Voice Lines The earbuds feature over 350 newly recorded lines across two models, including voice guidance for notifications such as power and connection status, as well as a “random voice” function with memorable quotes from the series. The Seigaku model offers 9 modes featuring Ryoma and teammates, while the Rikkai model includes 8 modes featuring Yukimura and his teammates. To see the other voice lines, please check the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-tp. Special Design The charging cases feature color schemes inspired by Seigaku and Rikkai, with a glossy finish for a premium feel. The sides of the cases and the metal parts of the earbuds are adorned with original logos based on the series title, creating a design that captures the anime’s world while blending naturally into everyday use.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Packaging The packaging showcases brand-new illustrations of the players enjoying the earbuds, highlighting their expressions and charm.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Tuning The sound was tuned by UZA, who composed the soundtrack for The Prince of Tennis II, creating a unique audio experience that lets you feel the excitement of the Prince of Tennis Festival wherever you are. Comment from Composer UZA “With this tuning, my goal was to recreate the atmosphere of the Prince of Tennis Festival. I drew on songs from across the series’ 20-plus-year history as reference material, but with such a long history, the volume levels and sound quality varied widely, which made finding the right balance a real challenge. When in doubt, I went back to my roots: I listened to the first season’s opening, “future,” and adjusted the sound so the lows and mids would carry more weight, while the highs would highlight the richness and vibrancy of the artists’ and voice actors’ voices. I hope you’ll feel the same excitement as if you were actually at a Prince of Tennis Festival. Whether recording, mixing, or mastering, I always strive for the best balance and sound quality, and through this collaboration with AVIOT, I was reminded that sound can always keep evolving. Thank you!” About UZA UZA (Lyricist, Composer, Sound Producer, Singer-Songwriter) Born in Tokyo on April 23, 1970. He began his career in 1993 after participating in “BAD AUDITION,” organized by Being, and signed an exclusive songwriter contract with the company. After going freelance in 1999, he focused on club music with a strong Western influence. In 2001, with the first season opening of The Prince of Tennis, “future,” he became involved in producing many anime songs. In 2006, he founded Aglets Entertainment, taking a more hands-on role in production, from songwriting and composing to planning, recording, and mastering. In 2019, he opened the Aglets Music School, dedicating himself to nurturing new talent. Major Collaborations: AKB48, Masayuki Suzuki, Hiromi Iwasaki, Ryu Si-won, Tackey & Tsubasa, Maki Goto, Bless4, Yui Horie, Aki Toyosaki, Yui Makino, and others. His work spans a wide range, from anime songs for The Prince of Tennis, GeGeGe no Kitaro, and the Pretty Cure series, to music production for stage performances such as Kinichi Hagimoto’s Meijiza shows, as well as sound production for corporate mascots, including those for GMO Internet and Kanro. In 2015, at the request of his hometown, Higashimurayama City, he created the departure and arrival chimes for Higashimurayama Station using a traditional local folk song. On August 31, 2022, he released his fourth full album, Yumeutsutsu, through Bellwood Records.

mekakushe’s New Song “Space Gate” Now Streaming! Full Tracklist Revealed for Upcoming Album Love After 13.8 Billion Years!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer-songwriter mekakushe has released a new song titled “Space Gate” on streaming services. This track is a pre-release from her upcoming digital album Love After 13.8 Billion Years, which will be out on November 7, 2025. Written and composed by mekakushe and arranged by Kosuke Hayashi of Scenarioart, “Space Gate” is a beautifully crafted medium-tempo ballad that expresses a yearning for pop music through a rich, live arrangement. The jacket illustration and music video were created by illustrator Otsukimi.
    • https://youtu.be/Hj4Tg9Eu1P0

    Product Information

    Track Title: “Space Gate” Lyrics/Composition: mekakushe　 Arrangement: Kosuke Hayashi (Scenarioart) Jacket Art: Otsukimi On streaming websites: linkco.re/TZan8fg4

    Digital Album Love After 13.8 Billion Years Tracklist

    1. Retronym of Love (ED theme of Kowloon Generic Romance) 2. Rendezvous 3. Oyasumi Beige 4. Kimi wa Snorkel 5. Zutto Emerald 6. Yuwanamerou (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) 7. Snow Globe Galaxy 8. My Own Polaris (insert song from Kowloon Generic Romance) 9. Sky Above 10. Space Gate Pre-add/Pre-save: linkco.re/HrHzqSFv

    Mekakushe’s Comment

    When we are born, and when we die, we are all alone. Even when you’re beside me, I am still alone. That loneliness feels unbearable sometimes. Unless you—Loneliness itself—knock on the door of dawn, my night will never end. But lately, I’ve begun to think maybe that’s alright. It’s okay to be lonely. Because I’m lonely, I want to be with you. Because I’m lonely, I sing. And I want to feel joy in that. May my album Love After 13.8 Billion Years never stop playing. May I keep wandering through your universe, even in the next life.

    Kyabeshi’s Comment

    Just like you see different scenes when you flip a snow globe, we’ve packed a variety of scenes into this music video. I’d love to hear how this video, this world, looks to you. P.S. I secretly hid seven shrimp, Mekakushe’s favorite, somewhere in the video. See if you can find them!

    Meyoco’s Comment

    It’s an honor to create an artwork for mekakushe-san’s music. I had a lot of fun creating the illustration from beginning to end. I was given the chance to create the artwork according to my style, which I deeply appreciate. The main theme I wanted to cover is a combination of “time” and “space,” with the motif of the clock being a dominant element in the artwork alongside the girl. I wanted the artworks to look warm and peaceful, the way you would feel when remembering someone you love. I hope my illustrations could serve well as a companion to mekakushe-san’s music.

    Comment from Kousuke Hayashi (Scenarioart)

    I arranged the song to evoke a sense of nostalgia in anyone’s heart. While working on it, I found comfort in how the music seemed to gently loosen the heart, like returning to a shared hometown.

    Comment from Otsukimi

    I’m truly honored to have been asked to create the music video for “Space Gate.” I had a wonderful time illustrating a world inspired by the moon, the stars, and the cosmos. The rotating merry-go-round scene is especially dear to me. It came together through many rounds of brainstorming and careful fine-tuning. The reversal of its rotation between the first and second halves expresses the emotional shift of the girl in the story. I hope you enjoy this touch along with the beautiful song and lyrics.

    Kousuke Hayashi’s Profile

    Vocalist and guitarist for the rock band Scenarioart, Kosuke also works as a lyricist, composer, and arranger. X: x.com/kosukedao

    Otsukimi’s Profile

    A Tokyo-based illustrator whose work centers on the theme of “softness with a touch of romance.” Known for designs featuring moon and star motifs that bring out the gentle charm of girls. X: x.com/otsukimi8　 Instagram: instagram.com/_o_tsukimi_

    Mekakushe’s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist “Kirakira Pop Japan” with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances. [Honey's Anime Interview] ASH Talks Ultraman, Inspiration, and What’s Next for ASH DA HERO
item.content:encoded:
Once again, we’re thrilled to welcome ASH, the charismatic frontman of ASH DA HERO, for another interview with Honey’s Anime! Known for his powerful vocals and boundless energy, ASH has been captivating audiences both in Japan and overseas with his band’s electrifying performances. Following the release of “Kyoukai Revolution,” the ending theme for the second half of Ultraman Omega, ASH sat down with us once again to talk about his love for the Ultraman series, the creative process behind the new songs, and what fans can look forward to during the band’s ongoing world tour.

ASH
Honey-Chan
Interview with ASH from ASH DA HERO
[gray-hex-decoration]
We love the Ultraman Omega opening and ending themes. How would you describe the connection of “BRIGHT EYES,” and which elements of the series influenced the music and lyrics of the song?
It’s truly an honor. From NARASAKI, who composed the music, and Matsui, who wrote the lyrics, I received a song of great importance. The moment I first heard the demo, I thought, “This is Ultraman.” I’ve been a huge fan of the Ultraman series since childhood, right up to now. For all six years of elementary school, I used to write letters to Ultraman. I would even get replies, and reading those letters was part of my childhood. That’s why, with all my love for Ultraman, I put my heart into singing every single note, hoping to give courage to the children who will grow up watching Omega. Who knows, maybe among those kids, there will be someone who dreams of becoming a musician and one day sings a theme song like I did. I want to keep passing the baton into the future.
You incorporated rap and lyrics into "Missing Link," the ending theme with MindaRyn. Do you prefer rapping or singing, and which do you find more challenging to perform live?
Both are part of my expression and my roots. I don’t find either one more challenging than the other. I always strive to give my best and make sure I’m fully prepared.
https://youtu.be/vkyJG809-mQ
Now, ASH DA HERO is currently on a world tour. What has this experience been like so far? Do you have a road story you'd like to share with your fans?
It’s been full of interesting experiences. One tour story that stands out is from San Antonio, Texas. When I sang Deep in the Heart of Texas, the audience sang along and clapped with me, which was both wonderful and hilarious! Everyone in San Antonio was laughing, kind of like, “Why?” I really love surprises like that.
And what can ASH DA HERO fans anticipate for the rest of the dates of the tour? Could you offer a sneak peek into the stage setup or setlist?
We plan to play new songs from our new album. And of course, we’ll play the Omega song as well. A special guest has also been confirmed to join us.
That's so exciting! So, what are your plans for 2026?
I’m going to immediately start working on new music. Please look forward to it!
We always talk about your amazing career, and how fans have been follow you for so long, but what are some of your preferred songs and music videos that you would suggest to new listeners?
I’d love for them to listen to HYPERBEAT! It turned out to be an amazing album!
As always, ASH’s passion for music and his genuine connection with fans shine through in every word and performance. With HYPERBEAT marking an exciting new chapter for ASH DA HERO and more music already in the works, there’s plenty for fans to look forward to. We’d like to thank ASH once again for taking the time to speak with us, and we can’t wait to see what comes next from this unstoppable force of rock.
