item.title: Six Full-sized Music Videos by Cornelius Featuring Songs from Ghost in the Shell: Arise Now Streaming Online!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Cornelius collaborated with various artists and filmmakers to release six full-sized music videos featuring songs from the Ghost in the Shell: Arise series, all of which are now available to stream on major platforms. Cornelius’ cutting-edge musical vision combined with the philosophical talent of these filmmakers pose striking questions for the modern age.
  • Utilizing diverse methods such as animation, live-footage, CG, and physical expression, the videos explore recurring themes from Ghost in the Shell: the uncertainty of existence, the fusion of city and body, and the relationship between humans and technology. The seamless blend of sound and visuals in this collection offers a new experience not only for fans, but for anyone with an interest in musical and visual expression.
  • Cornelius’s interview has also been published on the official Ghost in the Shell global website.

    • Three Years of Expressing a Cyber-Society through Music: The Relationship between Cornelius and Ghost in the Shell

    Find the intervew here: theghostintheshell.jp/news/cornelius-interview Keigo Oyamada, a.k.a Cornelius, produced music for Ghost in the Shell: Arise for three years. He fuses acoustic instruments and electronic sounds to create a vision of a cyber-societal world with “the existence of soul” as the keyword. He talks about using his own style to create the soundtrack and theme song while staying true to the sci-fi nature of the work, and how that influenced his career as a musician.

    Ghost in the Shell: Arise Opening Theme “Ghost in the Shell: Arise”

    https://youtu.be/jq8iRxA88pk Music: Cornelius Director: Yugo Nakamura This experimental technique uses still images from the anime that are printed and photographed individually against an urban backdrop. The ambiguity of cyborgs is expressed by blending them into the real world.

    Border:1 Ending Theme “Jibun ga Inai” by salyu x salyu

    https://youtu.be/ijuSIUKzB24 Lyrics: Shintaro Sakamoto Composition: Keiga Oyamada Director: Koichiro Tsujikawa Performance: Salyu This poetic visual world where bodies and voices overlap in multiple layers explores the space between “absence” and “presence.”

    Border:2 Ending Theme “Soto wa Senjou dayo” by Ichiko Aoba and Cornelius

    https://youtu.be/oSDRRsj-XQU Lyrics: Shintaro Sakamoto Composition: Keigo Oyamada Director: Koichiro Tsujikawa Through the innocent faces of children, it quietly questions humanity and the loneliness of society as a battlefield.

    Border:3 Ending Theme “Heart Grenade” by Sean Lenon and Cornelius

    https://youtu.be/kYqPaPm60TI Lyrics: Sean Lenon Composition: Keigo Oyamada Director: Koichiro Tsujikawa Videography: Toyotaro Shigemori A bittersweet love story depicting romance between two machines.

    Border:4 Ending Theme “Split Spirit” by Yukihiro Takahashi & Metafive

    https://youtu.be/Yes-5sHaG-Q Lyrics: Leo Imai, Yukihiro Takahashi Composition: Keigo Oyamada Producers: Yukihiro Takahashi & Metafive, Keigo Oyamada, Yoshinori Sunahara, Tomohiko Gondo, Leo Imai Director: Koichiro Tsujikawa Performance: Leo Imai As philosophical images resonate with the rhythm of the city, it makes a pointed statement about our own multifaceted nature and fragmented mentality.

    Ghost in the Shell: Arise Alternative Architecture Opening Theme “Anata o Tamotsu Mono” by Maaya Sakamoto and Cornelius

    https://youtu.be/YW8Q0bKhvkc Lyrics: Shintaro Sakamoto Composition: Keigo Oyamada Director: Koichiro Tsujikawa CG/VFX: Munechika Inudo An overwhelming visual poem, featuring the transparent and impressive voice of Maaya Sakamoto, where cities and bodies, reality and virtuality intersect.

Streaming services: Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube Music, LINE MUSIC, Amazon Music, Deezer, AWA, Rakuten Music, KKBOX, Qobuz Watch the music videos on Apple Music, YouTube Music, LINE MUSIC, and U-NEXT.

    Keigo Oyamada's Profile

    Born in Tokyo on January 27, 1969. After Flipper’s Guitar disbanded in 1991, he began his solo career, going by the name “Cornelius” in 1993. His albums The First Question Award and 69/96 found great success, and he became a lead figure in the Shibuya-kei movement at the time. In 2006, Sensurround + B-sides was nominated for Best Surround Sound Album at the 51st Grammy Awards in the United States. He is currently active in a wide range of fields, collaborating, working on remixes and producing music with numerous artists both in Japan and abroad.

item.title: fhána and Sachiko Kobayashi Celebrate the Release of New Theme Songs for Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid Movie: “Parade of Tears” and “Bokutachi no Hibi”
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="Author/Photographer: Junichi Tsukagoshi" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • A special event was held on July 13, in AEON LakeTown mori, to celebrate the release of the new opening and ending songs for the Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid movie!
  • Kyoto Animation’s newest work is a heart-warming tale about family and the bonds that unite us. Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid: A Lonely Dragon Wants to Be Loved is the latest installment in the animated series, which started airing in 2017. Of course, seeing these popular scenes from the original work on the big screen has been a huge hit with the audiences!
  • On July 13th (Sunday), fhána and Sachiko Kobayashi made an appearance at AEON LakeTown mori, to help kick off the release of their respective opening and ending songs, “Parade of Tears” and “Bokutachi no Hibi.” Since Koshigaya in Saitama Prefecture serves as the story’s backdrop, the location couldn’t have been more fitting.
  • Tickets for the priority viewing area (which came with the purchase of one of the CDs being released that day) sold out in a flash. The space was packed with spectators before the event even started. Since there might not be enough time during the concert itself, Kevin Mitsunaga (sampler, etc.) gave the crowd a primer on the choreography for “Parade of Tears” during their rehearsal, and asked them to lead the rest of the audience for the real deal.

    • About the Event

    The event itself started right at 1:00 p.m., with fhána’s performance of one of the definitive opening themes from the anime, “Rhapsody of Blue Sky.” Towana (vocalist) got the audience all fired up as her voice rang out from the stage, accompanied by Junichi Sato on the keyboard, and Kevin on the metallophone. The crowd sang and clapped along, clearly enjoying their amazing pop performance. Pausing just long enough to announce their group name, fhána launched straight into “Love Supreme!”, the opening song from Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid S. Towana and Kevin’s bright, bouncy rap makes it a memorable song, and their fast-paced repartee, mingled with the crowd’s applause, created an euphoric atmosphere.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    During the MC segment, they mentioned that they were pleased to be visiting Koshigaya for the first time. And most people in attendance raised their hands when asked whether or not they’d seen the Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid movie. On seeing that, Junichi mentioned that their next song had been “inspired by Kanna’s (CV. Maria Naganawa) tears.” Then, Kevin gave the crowd a quick review of the choreography before launching straight into the movie’s opening theme, “Parade of Tears.” The crowd was quick to put those moves into action when the chorus came around. Though, for an upbeat pop song, there’s an element of melancholy to it. Since fhána has created each of the series’ opening songs, their lyrics and melodies have really stuck with the listeners. Junichi joined in the dancing partway through, livening up the performance even further—but was probably going to limit that to this event. (Or possibly the upcoming Animelo Summer Live event.) ”Yeah, I think that’s it for the dancing,” he said, mellowing the mood out.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    This was the perfect transition into the ending theme’s portion of the event. The audience called out for “Kobayashi-saaan!” (just like the titular character), Sachiko Kobayashi took to the stage to sing “Bokutachi no Hibi.” The message there is that “Nothing is certain, but that’s easy to forget. We might have met here by accident, but that’s a kind of miracle. These precious moments ought to be cherished.” Standing on stage in her stunning red dress, Sachiko’s gentle voice rang out, instantly catching everyone’s attention. Her voice couldn’t be better suited to a song that talks about how the “usual” things are the foundation of life. The performance was only a few minutes long, but it was a wonderfully moving piece that truly encapsulated the movie. After that touching finale to a rousing mini concert, fhána closed out the event by signing CDs that the fans had purchased. Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid: A Lonely Dragon Wants to be Loved is a huge hit! fhána and Sachiko Kobayashi’s opening and ending songs have gone on sale to great acclaim! Plus, it was okay to take pictures and videos at this event, so there are probably plenty of those to check out on social media.

item.title: “HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle- Movie”& “Uta no☆Prince-sama TABOO NIGHT XXXX”Anime Expo 2025 Screening Report
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Fans of anime, manga, games and cosplay from all over the world had the opportunity to attend a special double screening from King Records of "HYPNOSIS MIC -Division Rap Battle- Movie" and "Uta no☆ Prince-sama♪ TABOO NIGHT XXXX" at Anime Expo, the largest anime event in North America.
  • Here’s our report of the screening held at The Novo on Saturday afternoon!

    • HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle-

    I arrive at my second-floor front-row seat 15 minutes before showtime. While it doesn't seem too crowded, I look to the first floor front-row seats to see several groups of what appear to be fans in cosplay, checking their penlights. Looking at the screen, I see a QR code to download the app that will be used to determine each battle's winner, as well as how to vote during the screening. This won't be your typical theater experience — it's something entirely new, where the outcome of the movie lies in the hands of the audience.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    "Hypnosis Mic -Division Rap Battle-", or "HypMic" for short, is a story set in a world where armed conflict is illegal, and territory is instead gained via rap battles using Hypnosis Mics, special microphones that interfere with human psyche. Teams representing each division compete in the "Division Rap Battles", led by the all-female team Party of Words. Battles are fought in teams of 3, with 6 teams total: → Buster Bros!!!: Ikebukuro Division → MAD TRIGGER CREW: Yokohama Division → Fling Posse: Shibuya Division → Matenro: Shinjuku Division → Bad Ass Temple: Nagoya Division → DOTSUITARE-HOMPO: Osaka Division
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    The team that wins the first and second stages will proceed to the final stage where they can challenge the Party of Words in battle. The full movie covers events up until the final stage, but for this specially-edited AX closing screening, only up until the second stage is shown. But what sets this movie experience apart is the mid-movie voting, done via a mobile app called CtrlMovie. After each battle's conclusion, a 10-second countdown begins on the app where viewers vote for the best-performing team by tapping the division's logo. After a few seconds, the winning team is displayed and the story continues. As the fate of each team is decided by the audience, even for those who might not call themselves fans, the tension in the room as the countdown begins is electric. As the result flashes on the screen, the audience erupts—united in a chorus of both joy and heartbreak that reverberates through the theater. The characters' reactions and comments differ depending on the results, which makes every viewing a unique thrill. In total there are a whole 48 different ways the story can play out. Fans will watch them all, no doubt. I realize it's almost time for the movie to start and take a last look around behind me to see that the seats are now filled to overflowing, with even more people standing behind the last row. The first floor is of course also packed. Seeing this spectacle, I feel the excitement building as the MC stirs up the crowd. Then, the screening finally starts. Over the roars of the crowd, the first thing we see are clips introducing each division. Every team is met with screams of excitement, with the waving penlights changing color each time. I now realize that the pre-screening penlight checking was for this all-important color-changing operation. The introductions perfectly capture each team member's characteristics and their relationships with each other. Next is the opening video, where we get to hear everyone’s singing voices, and includes every character. The battleground is set. The cheers were so loud for every single division that I could not even guess which one might win.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    And now for the rap battles to begin!

    First stage, first battle

    Buster Bros!!! Vs Bad Ass Temple The battle between Ichiro (Buster Bros!!! leader) and Kuko (Bad Ass Temple leader), who are former teammates, is a must-see. Time for the vote of destiny. After a short silence, Buster Bros!!!’s logo appears on the screen, followed by loud cheering and crying. Up on the screen, Kuko approaches Ichiro and they congratulate one another. Fans cheer out warmly.

    First stage, second battle

    MAD TRIGGER CREW Vs DOTSUITARE-HOMPO Samatoki (leader of MAD TRIGGER CREW) and Sasara (DOTSUITARE-HOMPO leader) were also once partners on the same team. They know each other inside out — every strength and every weakness. But today isn't a duel. It's a team battle, where the team that unites their strengths to the fullest seizes victory. Voting time again. A few seconds pass in silence before DOTSUITARE-HOMPO's logo flashes onto the screen. The crowd erupts. In the face of his loss, Samatoki speaks gracefully and the crowd’s comforting words left an impression.

    First stage, third battle

    Fling Posse vs Matenro Ramuda (leader of Fling Posse) and Jakurai (Matenro's leader) say they hate one-another, but what is the truth...? During the battle their faces were so close they almost touched, which resulted in cheering and screaming throughout the venue every time. Once again it is time to vote, and after a short silence, Matenro's logo appears and is met with loud cheering and screaming. The resentment between the two leaders fades and Jakurai approaches Ramuda amicably, but Ramuda's irritation at Jakurai's unintentionally condescending remarks makes for an amusing conclusion. The second stage is a tournament between the three teams that won the first stage. Buster Bros!!! Vs DOTSUITARE-HOMPO vs Matenro Fate once again is in our hands, and this time the choice is between three teams. Cheers for each team echo across the venue, but it's DOTSUITARE-HOMPO who claim victory. The cheering and the screaming reach their climax. At long last, it's time for the final battle with Party of Words. The MC reappears and the screening comes to an end. While the winning division was not my first choice, the result made me very interested to see what a battle between the Kansai team DOTSUITARE-HOMPO and the all-female team Party of Words would look like. You can check out the results via the link below: hypnosismic-movie.com/voting-status/ax2025 You can also check out the results for all the screenings held in Japan here: hypnosismic-movie.com/voting-status/results

    "Uta no☆Prince-sama TABOO NIGHT XXXX"

    After a (small) switch up in the audience between HypMic and Uta☆Pri fans, the MC introduces the next feature and turns the fans' excitement all the way up! This movie is the third theatrical release for Uta☆Pri and contains a full-length live concert as well as a brand-new animation featuring QUARTET NIGHT. The "Uta no☆Prince-sama♪ Maji Love" series is a part of the larger Uta☆Pri multimedia franchise, originally a romance visual novel aimed at women. The movie features four members who form the idol unit QUARTET NIGHT: → Reiji Kotobuki → Ranmaru Kurosaki → Ai Mikaze → Camus Setlist: * Jewelful XXXX Seize me if you can (Reiji) Force & Faith (Ranmaru) Wandering in a maze (Ai) Do you know who I’m (Camus) * Ice Pierrot (Camus) * Zero (Reiji) * Black Panther (Ranmaru) * Am I a fairy or...? (Ai) * The RUN to the RAY (Reiji & Ranmaru) * God Love (Ai & Camus) * TABOO NIGHT XXXX (all members) * JINN-Ω-RAY (all members)
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    The audience cheered and changed the color of their penlights for each idol, and joined in every single idol call. And in perfect Japanese, of course.It was just like being at an idol concert in Japan. After seeing both movies, I was reminded that the love and enthusiasm of fans here rivals — or perhaps even surpasses — that of fans in Japan. From the happy faces of the fans after the screening, there is no doubt that this passion and love will continue to grow. — King Records Editorial Department

    Event outline

    Anime Expo 2025 "HYPNOSISMIC -Division Rap Battle- Movie” & “Uta no☆Prince-sama♪ TABOO NIGHT XXXX" Screening July 5, 12:30 – 2:30 PM | The Novo

    Screening information

item.title: Official Report: Bandai Namco Music Live Festival at Anime Friends 2025! Southeast Asia Concerts Also Confirmed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • The Bandai Namco Music Live Festival returned to Anime Friends 2025, held in São Paulo, Brazil from July 3 to 6. This marks the second consecutive year the festival has appeared at South America’s largest anime convention, which draws an annual attendance of around 150,000.
  • Bandai Namco Music Live manages labels including Lantis, SUNRISE Music, Kiramune, MoooD Records, and UNIERA, and is home to a diverse roster of artists. On the festival’s opening day, four acts took the stage: ASH DA HERO, STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION, Nowlu, and MindaRyn.
  • TUfave is excited to announce its new collaboration jewelry collection with the TV anime “Attack on Titan”. These necklaces (5 designs total) delicately capture the attractiveness of the characters and the series' world, inspired by iconic scenes. Each piece features a simple design centered around a large natural stone, creating "collaboration jewelry for adults" that subtly blends into daily life.

    • Nowlu Kicks Off the Show with Her Anisong Debut

    Nowlu opened the festival with a confident performance that defied the fact it was her first-ever live show. She began with “Arika” (GUILTY GEAR STRIVE: DUAL RULERS) and “yoin” (Wingman). “I’m so happy to have my first live show here in São Paulo,” she said with a smile, drawing warm cheers. She followed with “Stuck on you” (More Than a Married Couple, But Not Lovers), creating a calm, intimate moment that brought the crowd together. Her debut ended to enthusiastic applause. Next up was a DJ set by ASH DA HERO member DJ Dhalsim. The crowd couldn’t help but dance as he spun one anisong hit after another: “Ai♡Scream!”, “Bokura wa Ima no Naka de” (Love Live!), “Shika-iro Days” (My Deer Friend Nokotan), and “Hare Hare Yukai” (The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya). The energy of anisong swept through São Paulo, connecting fans across generations.

    “Brazil, I’m back!” MindaRyn Returns with a Smile

    MindaRyn took the stage next, returning for a second year in a row. “Brazil, I’m back!” she called out with a big smile before launching into a set of three powerful yet gentle songs: “Daylight” (Arifureta: From Commonplace to World’s Strongest Season 2), “Shiny Girl” (SHY), and “Fireworks” (Why Raeliana Ended Up at the Duke’s Mansion).
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    During her MC segment, she asked, “Was anyone here last year? Thanks to those seeing me for the first time, too!” connecting warmly with the audience. As part of her world tour Hello New Friends, which began in June 2025, she performs special covers of songs from her label, Lantis. For Brazil, she sang “Rhapsody of Blue Sky” (Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid, originally by fhána) and “Sparkling Daydream” (Love, Chunibyo & Other Delusions, originally by ZAQ). She followed with a high-energy rock trio: “HIBANA” (Sengoku Youko: The Reformer Siblings Arc), “SURVIVE” (Why Raeliana Ended Up at the Duke’s Mansion), and her breakout hit “Like Flames” (That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime Season 2), which has surpassed 22 million views on YouTube. Her explosive performance had the entire venue fired up.

    STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION: Sound and Vision in Perfect Sync

    STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION (R・O・N) made his Brazilian debut with a 17-song medley set to anime visuals. Highlights included “ALPHA” (Moriarty the Patriot), “Renegade” (GANGSTA), and the fan-favorite “STORYSEEKER” (That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime Season 2), which has surpassed 10 million views on YouTube.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    The set closed with “Daisy” (Beyond the Boundary), with the crowd gently swaying their hands in unison. R・O・N recalled fans in Chile asking, “Aren’t you coming to Brazil?” and now that he had, he understood why. The crowd responded with knowing nods and applause.

    Surprise Collaboration with Ultraman Omega!

    After a brief pause, the word “Ultraman” appeared on the screen, instantly stirring the crowd. MindaRyn returned to perform “BLACK STAR” (Ultraman Blazer), followed by an appearance from Ultraman Blazer himself, drawing cheers and excitement.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    The event then transitioned into the new series Ultraman Omega. ASH performed the opening theme “BRIGHT EYES,” while MindaRyn and ASH debuted the ending theme “Missing Link” live for the first time. The blend of hero action and rap interplay brought the crowd’s energy to a fever pitch.

    ASH DA HERO Brings the Festival to a Climactic Close

    ASH DA HERO took the stage for the grand finale, joined by Dhalsim (DJ), Sato (bass), and WANI (drums). Kicking off with “Super Sonic,” they followed with “YELLOW FEVER DANCE” and “Hankou Seimei” as the crowd pumped their fists and sang along. They kept the energy high with “LA VIDA LOCA,” already a live anthem despite being a recent release, then surprised the audience with “Octave” and “Beast Mode,” insert songs from Blue Lock: Episode Nagi, accompanied by anime footage. After introducing the members, they launched into “Judgement,” the opening theme for the anime’s second cour. The crowd erupted, singing along as ASH stepped off the stage shouting, “Sing it, Brazil!”
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    They closed with a final roar of “We are ASH DA HERO!” as ASH triumphantly returned to center stage.

    A Powerful Finale: All Artists Unite

    For the final act, all performers returned to the stage at ASH’s invitation for the first-ever band performance of “Trinity” (That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime: The Saga of How the Demon Lord and Dragon Founded a Nation). ASH took on Takuma Terashima’s part in this rare collaboration, thrilling fans. The concert closed with a group photo and a wave of thunderous applause.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    The excitement didn’t stop even after the main festival ended. On Friday the 4th, all the performers held a meet-and-greet and Q&A panel. On Saturday the 5th, ASH DA HERO took the stage, followed by STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION and MindaRyn on Sunday the 6th. In its second year, the Bandai Namco Music Live Festival at Anime Friends powered up with even stronger artist × IP collaborations. Alongside powerful performances, the festival featured fan events and previews of new projects, highlighting the full potential of anisong. The anisong wave that swept Brazil in 2024 has firmly taken root—and is still growing!

    Next Stop: Southeast Asia!

    The Bandai Namco Music Live Festival isn’t just heating up Brazil; it’s heading to Southeast Asia next. The festival will appear at COS-MIC 2025 in Malaysia on September 13, and AniEx 2025 in Bangkok, Thailand on November 22. The anisong excitement born in São Paulo is spreading across borders, forging new connections through music. The journey of the Bandai Namco Music Live Festival is only just beginning. Photo by Kakeru Inoue Bandai Namco Music Live Festival at Anime Friends 2025 Date: July 3, 2025 (local time) Venue: Pavilhão de Exposições do Distrito Anhembi (São Paulo, Brazil) Official Event Website: animefriends.com.br Bandai Namco Music Live Festival at COS-MIC 2025 Dates: September 12 – September 14, 2025 (Live performance on September 13) Venue: Sunway Pyramid Convention Center (Selangor, Malaysia) Bandai Namco Music Live Festival at AniEx 2025 Dates: November 22 – November 23, 2025 (Live performance on November 22) Venue: MCC HALL, The Mall Life Store, Bangkapi (Bangkok, Thailand)

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] BEYBLADE X Interview with Masahiko Yamazaki, Hisato Takaoka, and Makoto Muraki at the Los Angeles Anime Expo 2025
item.content:encoded:
As part of the BEYBLADE X World Championship, the company behind BEYBLADE held the U.S. National qualifier at Anime Expo 2025 in the Los Angeles Convention Center. Honey’s Anime had the opportunity to interview Masahiko Yamazaki (Head of Global Beyblade Business), Hisato Takaoka (General Manager of Beyblade), and Makoto Muraki (Specialist on the Beyblade Design Team). Let’s see what they had to say about BEYBLADE X’s first tournament appearance at AX!

Takaoka
Yamazaki
Muraki
Honey-Chan
Interview with the BEYBLADE Team
[gray-hex-decoration]
Why did you choose Anime Expo as the venue for the U.S. National qualifier? What goes into organizing an event of this scale here?
BEYBLADE launched in Japan in 1999, and in the U.S. in 2000. That means it has been 25 years since BEYBLADE first arrived in America. Last year was our first time bringing BEYBLADE to Anime Expo and we were very, very surprised and excited to find so many adult fans here. We have always believed the potential of American fans and community, and seeing their passion firsthand was a very great opportunity for us. That’s why we wanted to return and hold the tournament at this year's event. BEYBLADE started just as a toy, but we’ve been aiming towards making it an entertainment sport, that’s why we thought about Los Angeles, the city of entertainment. Anime Expo is a very, very huge event so, in line with our branch’s story, this is a very suitable opportunity and a suitable event at AX. If you had the chance to come here during the morning (Saturday, July 5, 2025) there were so many people in line, we were not expecting so many fans to show up! Last year, BEYBLADE was here, but this year is the first time that we’ve held a tournament. We could not have imagined the number of people who attended. We were pleasantly surprised and very impressed with the number of attendees.
What are you hoping that fans take away from this event, or what were you expecting to show fans by holding this tournament here at AX?
From what I’ve seen, there’s a great opportunity to further grow and support adult tournaments in the U.S. I want to give hope that in the future, we will have more and more events for the American fans. While at the booth, I wondered why 200, or 300 people had gathered here, staying all the time around the stage area; it got me thinking that maybe this is a very, very rare opportunity to witness an official BEYBLADE tournament.
I wanted fans to take away the experience of an official tournament. I hope that those people who participated in the Anime Expo Tournament, go back to their hometowns and do the same as they did here. We formally introduced how to participate in a BEYBLADE tournament, showed them not only the format, but the experience, and how it goes after you lose or win a match, where you shake hands, etc. That’s the experience I hope they take from this event.
After seeing the popularity of the BEYBLADE X tournament in Anime Expo, are you planning on coming back to AX next year or maybe plan on holding other official tournaments in other conventions across the U.S.?
Yes, as BEYBLADE X we plan to come to Anime Expo next year. We hope to expand with other tournaments or activities, as well as participate in other major U.S. conventions, working together with Hasbro, our U.S. partner.
With BEYBLADE X growing in popularity, what’s your vision for the expansion of the franchise in the next decade? Do you see it expanding into things like virtual or augmented reality battles, or is the focus more on growing physical product availability, especially here in the U.S.?
Seeing that there are many new technologies like AI, AR, or VR as you mentioned, in the case of BEYBLADE it had a weird introduction into the metaverse world through Roblox. Right now, nearly 40 million visitors from around the world have joined the BEYBLADE world on Roblox. I can see that technology is important, but from what I can see the most important thing is the community. BEYBLADE fans are encouraged to enjoy the brand in many ways, so it has great potential to cultivate a community no matter what technology it expands to. But we’ve committed to grow the community rather than focusing on introducing the brand to new technology.
Why did you choose Roblox as the “community builder” for BEYBLADE?
In Japan, Roblox is not really popular yet, but in the U.S.A, as well as other parts of Asia it's really popular. BEYBLADEs’ strength is that they can provide a physical experience, at the same time, this is our weakness. We want fans to enjoy BEYBLADE globally, but as of right now, Roblox is the answer the fans have created. And the fantastic thing is that you can play it from anywhere. [Takaoka proceeds to take out his phone, which is already online on Roblox and actively spectating a BEYBLADE match between real people that are online at that moment]
The players of that BEYBLADE world in Roblox, the total of Japanese players is maybe around 5% but the other 95% are from all over the world; number one is currently Thailand, followed by Mexico and the U.S.A. That's why we embraced Roblox, since it’s a global platform that surpasses the barriers and restrictions of our physical limitations.
When designing parts for BEYBLADE X with competitive players in mind, how do you strike a balance between performance, durability, and customization? Is one prioritized more than the others, or is it always a compromise?
Those three elements you mentioned are very, very important. First of all, BEYBLADE X is a product that can be enjoyed by children and adults, so our priority is safety. At the same time, it has to be truly thrilling and fun to play. Although it seems at odds with safety the features that make the game exciting—like high-speed, intense collisions are essential for our products so it is a big challenge for us to pursue both aspects. We try not to have tradeoffs or compromises, they try to deliver all those points at the highest possible “level”, This is something we really take care of when thinking about new model designs.
As a competitive game, BEYBLADE must often introduce different "battle strategies". I see BEYBLADE X has a gimmick called "X-dash" Could you walk me through how you come up with these strategies?
BEYBLADE X physical contact is really important. “Physical contact” is the base keyword in the company, so everyone keeps it in mind when creating the product. If it goes faster, would it be interesting? If it falls apart, will it be interesting? Those kinds of unique ideas are always brought forward by the team and we bring it to life as a demo product by the design team to test it out. After everyone has experienced it and it makes sense as a strategy, then the idea will move on to the next level until it makes it to the actual product. One thing we’re always taking care of is that we don’t create only an idea, but also create a demo product to test it out within the team.
As for battle gimmicks like the X-Dash, so far what has been the most challenging or interesting gimmick that you have created?
3rd generation BEYBLADE Burst. This was the first time that the toy would be torn apart, breaking into pieces. That gimmick introduced in the 3rd generation was challenging because the point was for them to break apart on purpose, but also you should be able to put it back together. On top of that, we had to achieve for it to spin super fast and all the pieces would fly out all over the place, so safety was a challenge. Before this model, the arena did not have the guard piece, so we had to come up with the arena barrier too.
Now that you have seen the popularity of BEYBLADE X in Anime Expo, and of course, Anime Expo caters to an Otaku culture, do you have in mind any collaboration with some big anime title? For example, a series of toys inspired by big IPs?
In Japan, we’ve had experience collaborating with celebrities and sports groups. We won’t deny any future collaborations with any anime IP. We have already collaborated with major IPs like Star Wars and Marvel featuring characters like Skywalker or Spiderman, we even have a collaboration with FC Barcelona, a legendary European multi-sports club based in Catalonia.
I want to ask you all for your personal experience watching the popularity of the BEYBLADE X booth and seeing all the fans there as well as the competitive U.S. Bey community playing in the tournament. Has anything surprised you? Has the U.S. player base inspired you in any way? How’s the US community different from the Japanese community? Any personal feelings that you’d like to share about your experience at Anime Expo and the BEYBLADE Championship?
As I expected, United States fans are really full of emotion. Most of the American　fans are shouting “Woo, I did it! I did it!”. I like this style of celebrating, it's something I am really glad to see, hahaha.
During BEYBLADE’s panel event at AX, we played the first episode of our new anime season. The fans there were very very excited and had a good reaction. But we not only talked about the animation, we also talked about BEYBLADE as a product and the community was very curious about how we design our toys, about the making process. It gave me the impression that the U.S. fans are extremely curious about BEYBLADE, so I enjoyed their reaction to our panel.
When I saw the participants of the tournaments and noticed the kind of Beys that they use I thought their selections were interesting. Usually, when you compete in tournaments, the ultimate goal should be to win, right? But seeing the U.S. participants, they are using the BEYBLADEs that they really like, ones that they have emotional attachments to. The ratio is a lot higher in the U.S. than in Japan. The way that fans enjoy BEYBLADE X here in the U.S. is wider, so that’s the point of view I gained from this experience and I will take it into consideration for future product design.
The passion and enthusiasm surrounding BEYBLADE X at Anime Expo 2025 was undeniable. It's clear that BEYBLADE continues to evolve as more than just a toy, it’s a global phenomenon fueled by community, creativity, and competition. With plans to return and expand further into U.S. events, the future of BEYBLADE is spinning faster than ever!

They primarily stream in Japanese on YouTube and Twitch.
  • Their debut track, “Starry Connection,” was released today at 13:00 (JST), alongside its official music video. It features a Japanese hyper pop sound that highlights the unique personalities of all four members. The lyrics were written by utumiyqcom, who appeared on Rap Star, and the music was composed by up-and-coming Vocaloid producer Tokyo Manaka. The song is packed with NOVA’s signature flair, even incorporating the members’ names into the lyrics. The music video, produced by Toei Zukun Laboratory, vividly brings NOVA’s fantasy world to life.

item.title: Jaleco Sports: Goal! - A Nostalgic Kick from the 8-bit and 16-bit Era
item.content:encoded:
[ad_top1 class="mb40"]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eOhDLZ9gdEg

Most of you probably weren’t even born back then, but some of us still remember what football games were like before they turned into lootbox fests catering only to online competitors. Back in the day, there were tons of different titles and approaches to the sport, and most of them had their own unique charm, offering countless hours of fun with friends and siblings. Among the standouts, the Goal! franchise was probably our favorite… and now it’s back in full glory, with both classic games bundled into one awesome package!

Football Unites the World

Yes, that’s actually one of FIFA’s recent slogans (the organization, not the video game series), and it perfectly captures one of the highlights of this new bundle. Originally developed by Tose and published by Jaleco (both Japanese companies) Goal! (known in Japan as Moero!! Pro Soccer) debuted in 1988. It was later localized for North America and Europe, with slightly different versions released in each region. Thanks to its popularity, a sequel followed in 1992, launching globally. But things weren’t as straightforward as they might seem…

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
Because the games were released in different regions and on different consoles, there are a number of notable differences—not just in the titles, but in the content itself. For instance, the lineup of national teams varies by version. In the Japanese release of Goal!, Uruguay and the USA are not included; instead, players get Northern Ireland and Scotland. Goal! Two features even more regional variation: the Japanese version includes teams like Colombia, Ghana, and Austria, while the Western release swaps them out for Canada, Mexico, and Venezuela. Meanwhile, the USSR and West Germany are present in the NES version but were omitted from the SNES port. Fortunately, this new bundle includes all versions of both games, giving players access to every regional team, no matter where they were originally released.

A Perfect Title for Collectors!

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

Another feature we absolutely loved is the inclusion of all the original cover art and instruction manuals. Back in the '80s and '90s, reading and re-reading those little booklets, or proudly displaying them on your shelf, was a big part of the whole video game experience. Sure, these games aren’t exactly complex in terms of controls or mechanics—after all, most systems back then only had a couple of buttons to work with. In fact, most of the instructions now feel like plain common sense to today’s players. Still, having access to the original manuals feels oddly refreshing. And best of all, you can switch languages with a single button press.

And What About the Gameplay?

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

The most notable addition to this bundle is the ability to rewind time at any moment (like in some racing games), whether it’s to stop a goal from being scored, avoid a yellow or red card, or simply get a second chance after completely shanking a shot into the stratosphere. Was it necessary? Probably not. Does it feel like cheating? Absolutely, and football purists will no doubt see it as a disgrace to the sport. But hey, it’s 100% optional, so no harm done… right? If anything, it’s just a modern safety net for retro frustration.

[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

No one expects games from four decades ago to stand toe-to-toe with modern sensations like EA FC, PES, or even Rematch. But firing up a few Goal! or Goal! Two matches with friends, whether out of nostalgia or curiosity, depending on your age, can still be a blast. Sure, we don’t see ourselves playing these games non-stop for days, but we genuinely enjoyed re-adapting to the punishing controls and arcade-style gameplay. Plus, there's something charming about scoring goals with national teams from countries that you don’t typically find in other football games, or that don’t even exist anymore. Nevertheless, if you like competing online, you can compete against other players on the monthly leaderboards!

Final Thoughts

Jaleco Sports: Goal!, the remake developed by Sickhead Games and Rock It Games, is one of those bundles we’re just happy to have in our library, ready to launch now and then for a few laughs and a trip down memory lane. The game is available for Windows PC via Steam and GOG. It's been announced there will be a PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch release later this year.

item.title: Azuki, COMISMA, and Xenotoon to Establish "Studio Azuki," a US-Based Anime Studio
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Azuki™, COMISMA Inc., and Xenotoon Inc. announced a new joint anime studio “Studio Azuki” based in the United States. The studio will develop, produce, and globally distribute original IPs and anime adaptations through unique production models shaped by the creative DNA of Azuki and its partners.
  • Originally launched as an NFT project, Azuki has been at the forefront in blending anime production with technologies and social media, while fostering collaboration between global creators and Japanese anime talents. By forming a joint venture with COMISMA and Xenotoon—both of which bring strong anime production expertise—Studio Azuki aims to strengthen its creative capacity and position itself as a next-generation global anime studio.
  • Azuki has been at the forefront of the rapidly growing global anime fandom, particularly in the U.S., where enthusiasm spans general audiences, Hollywood creators, celebrities, and businesses. Studio Azuki fuses this international momentum with Japan’s anime culture to pioneer new production models, elevate storytelling quality, enable fan collaboration, and introduce social-first formats that define the future of global anime.
  • Guided by its “Anime 2.0” vision, Azuki has launched several key initiatives, including the Enter The Garden anthology series, Anime.com, and being an early contributor to Animecoin Foundation. Studio Azuki will continue to explore how these platforms and blockchain technology can reshape the way anime is financed, produced, and experienced.
  • COMISMA, a founding partner of the new studio, is known for operating the manga app GANMA! and cultivating original works. It also owns the high-end animation studio Qzil.la. Xenotoon, meanwhile, brings a robust 2D/3D production pipeline and a creator-first studio network, exemplified by its collaborations with indie animators such as those behind Yasuda Gensho.
  • “With a global-first, creator-centric, and social-native approach, Studio Azuki is our bold step toward building the next generation of anime, one that empowers creators, & connects directly with fans,” said Feb Tea, Head of Content at Azuki Labs. “By joining forces with COMISMA and Xenotoon, we’re combining deep, authentic anime production expertise with fresh creative energy and global perspective. Together, we can redefine how anime is developed, financed, and experienced around the world, with new original anime titles, stories and creators for years to come.”

    • Comment From Koki Sato, CEO of COMISMA Inc.

    I’m truly excited to be part of the launch of Studio Azuki. At COMISMA, we have long been guided by our mission to make 'manga artist' a dream profession for children. Through trust in creators and strong engagement with fans, we have delivered many successful IPs to the world. With our anime studio Qzil.la focused on high-end anime, we aim to create globally beloved anime titles. I look forward to driving the industry's growth through Studio Azuki.

    Comment From Koichi Kawase, CEO of Xenotoon Inc.

    We are thrilled to announce the formation of Studio Azuki alongside such strong partners as Azuki and COMISMA. Our studio has experience across everything from social media-first short-form anime to feature-length theatrical works. From the beginning, our three companies shared a strong vision for the future of anime and entertainment. I believe it was inevitable that we would create a groundbreaking global studio together. This also marks a turning point in realizing our long-held vision to democratize the anime production, funding, and distribution pipeline. We look forward to creating a new chapter in anime history and co-creating titles that will captivate the world.

    Comment From Ko Yada, CEO of Westbrook Inc.

    At Westbrook, our mission has always been to tell stories that connect, inspire, and transcend borders. Partnering with Studio Azuki is a powerful step in that direction. Their creative vision and cultural insight align seamlessly with our global strategy. Together, we’re excited to identify and develop projects that resonate deeply with audiences around the world, blending authentic storytelling with boundary-pushing innovation.

    Strategic Partnership with Westbrook Inc.

    In conjunction with the studio’s formation, Studio Azuki has entered into a strategic partnership with Westbrook Inc., the global media company founded by Jada Pinkett Smith, Will Smith, Miguel Melendez, and Ko Yada, focused on empowering artists to tell stories that connect the world.. By combining Studio Azuki’s production capabilities with Westbrook’s deep Hollywood network and expertise in global entertainment, the partnership aims to bring next-generation anime content to audiences worldwide.

The brand AXGRIT is an original universe themed around flying and fighting in a post-apocalyptic world using anti-gravity units. Focusing on figurines, their various products, and exhibitions based on this concept will be showcased primarily at SHIBUYA TSUTAYA.

    The convergence point of all dimensions. Take back your freedom with wings of anti-gravity, and seize hope.

    AXGRIT Lore

    The convergence point of all dimensions. Take back your freedom with wings of anti-gravity, and seize hope. In a near-future Earth where science has advanced and civilization has flourished, humanity developed a device called the Cross Dimension, enabling access to the Multiverse. This breakthrough allowed humans to make contact with beings from alternate worlds, regardless of whether they were two-dimensional or three-dimensional. The barriers between dimensions had fallen, and the world cultivated even greater wisdom and wealth. However, one day, a catastrophic system failure known as the Dimension Accident occurred, causing countless worlds influenced by the Cross Dimension to merge into a single, unified realm. Although this unprecedented convergence plunged every world into chaos, order was gradually restored under the guidance of the United Earth Forces’ organization, the United Birth. Yet, numerous problems remained. The merging of worlds brought about unknown disasters and mysterious enemies immune to conventional weapons. To make matters worse, a faction known as Nemesis Gravitas (hereafter referred to as Nemesis) began exploiting the Gravity Core, the energy source of the Cross Dimension, in an attempt to dominate the residents of each world. item.title: Entries Open July 1 for Round 3 of the Anime Song Choir Project “ChoieL”, Now Featuring 28 Eligible Songs!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. will begin accepting entries for the third round of its anime song choir project ChoieL on July 1, 2025.
  • ChoieL is an ongoing online choir competition that was launched in August 2022, with a second round in March 2024. Round 3 brings back the 22 songs from previous editions and adds new selections from Bandai Namco Music Live’s SUNRISE MUSIC label, for a total of 28 eligible songs. As before, the contest features two categories: Full and Short.
  • Returning to the judging panel are Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision) and composer Tatsuya Tanaka, both of whom have served as judges since the first round.
  • Joining this round as official ambassadors is ARCANA PROJECT, an artist group from Bandai Namco Music Live’s Lantis label. A promotional video featuring the group is now available. ARCANA PROJECT will also serve as guest judges and present a new “ARCANA PROJECT Award.”
  • Entries will be accepted from July 1 to August 31, 2025, with both the Full and Short categories held concurrently. We look forward to your enthusiastic participation!

    • Participating Judges

    Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision)

    It’s been three years since ChoieL began, and thanks to your support, we’re now entering our third round. The six new songs for Round 3 include titles that will resonate with an even wider range of generations than the original 22. With the addition of new arrangers, we believe this round offers more than ever for both anime song fans and choral music lovers alike. We hope ChoieL continues to be a place where you can express your passion to the fullest.

    Tatsuya Tanaka (Composer)

    The ChoieL online choir competition is now entering its third round. The full lineup of 28 songs, including the six new additions, offers an exciting and enjoyable blend of anime songs and choral music in terms of song selection, arrangement, and composition. The past two competitions were full of unforgettable moments, and we’re already looking forward to seeing how participants will express themselves this time. If you have a passion for anime songs and choral music, that’s all you need to get started. We can’t wait to see your entry!

    Official ChoieL Ambassadors & Judges

    ARCANA PROJECT (Lantis/Artist)

    A vocal unit consisting of Usa Sakurano, Hana Hanamiya, Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano, Yuka Shidomi, and Sakura Yoshino, co-produced by DEARSTAGE and Lantis. With a tarot card-themed group motif, they bring a diverse range of songs, including anime theme songs, to life through their distinctive vocals and performances. Comment: We’re ARCANA PROJECT, and we’re honored to take part in the ChoieL anime song choir project as both official ambassadors and judges. As a group brought together by our love of anime and singing, we’re truly excited to be involved in such a wonderful initiative. Through our work as ARCANA PROJECT, we’ve come to feel that what matters most isn’t technical skill, but the joy of singing while making eye contact, the comfort of shared breath, and the freedom to express music from the heart. Discovering your own voice and connecting with others through song are deeply meaningful and precious experiences. We hope this project brings those same experiences to many people. We can’t wait to hear your voices. https://youtu.be/ivBlGhJhfPc

    About ChoieL

    The anime song choir project “ChoieL” was launched on June 1, 2022, with the aim of bringing together the beloved tradition of choir and the world of anime songs. Our goal is to draw out new charms from each, aspiring to a future where anime songs are loved as standard numbers in the choir world. As the first step of this project, we hosted our first online choir competition in August 2022, and 50 groups participated to showcase the fresh appeal of anime songs. Starting from the second online competition, the project has expanded to include sustainable activities that utilize the intellectual property of anime songs to deliver free music events to young people and fans worldwide. ChoieL Official Website: project-choiel.jp ChoieL Official X (formerly Twitter): twitter.com/Project_ChoieL ChoieL Official Instagram: instagram.com/project_choiel

    Overview of Anime Song Choir Project ChoieL Third Online Competition

    Organizers: Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. Supporter: Tokyo Choral Association Period: July 1, 2025 - August 31, 2025 *The Full and Short Divisions will run concurrently. Judges: Sohei Miyoshi (Choral Conductor / Secretary General of the Tokyo Choral Association / Planning and Supervision) Tatsuya Tanaka (Composer) Bandai Namco Music Live Official Ambassador: ARCANA PROJECT (Lantis/Artist) Entry Fee: There is no entry fee. However, sheet music must be purchased for each participant. Eligibility for Participation: *Applies to all divisions ・Please purchase the electronic sheet music of the song you would like to perform from L SCORE, the official music brand of Namco Bandai Music Live. ・The same choir may participate in both the short and full divisions. ・Multiple song entries are acceptable. (However, only one song per submission). ・A conductor is not required. ・Please play the accompaniment as specified in the score, or download the accompaniment soundtrack from the official website. ・In addition to regular choirs, virtual choirs can also be created by combining individual performances or multiple recordings by a single person. *There is no need to apply for the use of music for this competition. Benefits: Each winning group will receive a commemorative trophy and ChoieL original merchandise for all participants. The grand prize winner will also get to experience recording their choir performance in a professional studio and will receive the final audio recording.

    Eligible Songs (Total of 28 Songs)

    "Rhapsody of Blue Sky", TV anime Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid. Mixed choir, composed by Yuka Yamashita. "Kimi no Kokoro wa Kagayaiteru kai?", Love Live! Sunshine!!. Mixed choir, composed by Chieko Matsunami. "Can Do", TV anime Kuroko’s Basketball. Mixed choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Thank You!", The Idolm@ster Million Live!. Mixed choir, composed by Ayako Meida. "SKILL", 2nd Super Robot Wars Alpha. Mixed choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Spread the Wings!!", The Idolmaster: Shiny Colors. Mixed choir, composed by Masaya Ishiwaka. "TOKIMEKI Runners", Love Live! School Idol Festival ALL STARS. Mixed choir, composed by Tomoaki Yokoyama. "DRIVE A LIVE", The Idolmaster: SideM. Mixed choir, composed by Naoto Aizawa. "DREAM SOLISTER", TV anime Sound! Euphonium. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Bokura no LIVE Kimi to no LIFE", Love Live!. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Motteke! Sailor Fuku", TV anime Lucky Star. Mixed choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "MONSTER GENERATiON", Idolish7. Mixed choir, composed by Chieko Matsunami. "Yasashisa no Riyuu", TV anime Hyouka. Mixed choir, composed by Toyotaka Tsuchida. "Violet Snow", TV anime Violet Evergarden. Female choir, composed by Naoto Aizawa. "STARDOM!", TV anime Data Carddass Aikatsu Stars!. Female choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Hajimari wa Kimi no Sora", Love Live! Superstar!!. Female choir, composed by Kaori Morita. "Hana no Iro", TV anime Hanasaku Iroha. Female choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Caste Room", TV anime Classroom of the Elite. Male choir, composed by Noritaka Moriyama. "Dramatic", Ultraman Taiga The Movie. Male choir, composed by Noboru Kitagawa. "Namae wo Yobu yo", TV anime Bungo Stray Dogs. Unaccompanied male choir, composed by Noboru Kitagawa. "Hare Hare Yukai", TV anime The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya. Mixed voice acapella, composed by Chizuru Matsunaga. "Broadcast Parade". Mixed voice acapella, composed by Inhyeok Yeo. "Soldiers of Sorrow", Mobile Suit Gundam II: Soldiers of Sorrow. Male choir, composed by Tatsuya Tanaka. "Yusha Oh Tanjou", TV anime The King of Braves GaoGaiGar. Unaccompanied mixed choir, composed by Noboru Kitagawa. "Yakusoku wa Iranai", TV anime The Vision of Escaflowne. Female choir, composed by Kosuke Negishi. "Anna ni Issho Datta no ni", TV anime Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. Mixed choir, composed by Shotaro Miyamoto. "Orion o Nazoru", TV anime Tiger & Bunny. Mixed choir, composed by Miho Fujishima. "Shikairo Days", TV anime My Deer Friend Nokotan. Mixed choir, composed by Chieko Matsunami. For other details, such as participation rules and regulations, please refer to the official website (project-choiel.jp). The scores of all 28 eligible songs are now available on L SCORE, the official music brand of Namco Bandai Music Live! L SCORE official website: lscore.jp ★Videos of all 28 eligible songs are now available on YouTube. youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmgGL3shzkGPIOiTzDqo16yOT96SXPv4F

    About ChoieL’s Sustainable Activities

    Starting from the second online competition, the anime song choir project ChoieL will be carried out as part of the sustainable activities of Bandai Namco Music Live. The Bandai Namco Group has defined its Purpose as “Fun for All into the Future.” Under our IP strategy, the group, along with its fans, will promote sustainable activities to address societal issues. In line with our long term plan, which advocates for sustainability under the theme of “connecting smiles to the future,” we have identified five material issues and are actively working to resolve them. In the anime song choir project ChoieL, we aim to utilize our intellectual property of anime songs to deliver free music events to young people and fans worldwide. To continue being a company cherished by communities and fans, and recognized as essential by society, Bandai Namco Music Live will continue to engage in sustainable activities in the future. Bandai Namco Group Sustainability Page: bandainamco.co.jp/en/sustainability/index.html

item.title: [리뷰] 이번에는 해외 배송이다! '데스 스트랜딩 2'
Global Search for the Next Isekai Hit Begins July 7: “MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA” Launches Worldwide!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="Illustration by Seira Minami" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • KADOKAWA CORPORATION will co-host the novel contest, "MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA," in partnership with qdopp Inc. and MyAnimeList Co., Ltd. The contest will be held on Honeyfeed, a novel submission platform operated by qdopp, with the goal of discovering exceptional storytelling talent from around the world.
  • This contest aims to discover fresh talent who can craft stories with the potential to stand alongside industry-defining titles like Overlord, Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-, The Rising of the Shield Hero, Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation and Sword Art Online. As an added bonus, the contest features a special guest in the jury panel: Aneko Yusagi, writer of The Rising of the Shield Hero. Winners even receive personalized feedback from this renowned and experienced Isekai author, an incredible chance to gain insight directly from one of the most successful storytellers in the genre.

    • Comment From Satoshi Arima, Project Manager and Editor in Chief of MF BOOKS

    In recent years, Japanese anime has seen a surge in global popularity. Many of these popular anime titles originate from light novels. At KADOKAWA, we are constantly seeking new talent to create the next big hit. Amid this trend, an increasing number of stories styled after Japanese light novels are being posted on overseas novel submission platforms. These platforms are emerging as hubs for content and creators with the potential to achieve widespread success not only in Japan but around the world. In response to this global trend, KADOKAWA has launched the Global UGC Publishing Project as part of its Global Business Acceleration Program, which supports new business ventures targeting international markets. This project aims to discover global talent through overseas novel platforms and bring “internationally-born” light novels to audiences both in Japan and worldwide. The MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 – THE ISEKAI presented by KADOKAWA marks the first step in this initiative. Moving forward, the project will expand through initiatives such as a Traditional Chinese writing contest hosted on KadoKado - the novel serialization platform operated by KADOKAWA TAIWAN CORPORATION - as well as the publication of selected winning titles from the JNC Original Light Novel Contest organized by M12 Media LLC.

    Contest Information

    Entry fee: Free Writing platform: Honeyfeed Voting platform: MyAnimeList Novel entry period: July 7 to September 29, 2025 Judges voting period: September 30 to November 16, 2025 Public voting period (Finals): November 17 to December 15, 2025 Winners announced: February 9, 2026

    Prizes

    Grand Prize — $5,000 USD Winners: 1 Your novel will be scheduled for publication by KADOKAWA in Japan as a light novel, subject to KADOKAWA’s final approval. Important: The Grand Prize may not be awarded if no submission meets the standards for publication. Contest Winners Prize — $3,000 USD Winners: 2 winners; or 3 if no Grand Prize is selected You might be offered publication of your novel in Japanese by KADOKAWA in Japan as a light novel. For complete contest details, submission guidelines, and updates, visit mhwc.myanimelist.net/202507.

    About KADOKAWA CORPORATION

    KADOKAWA Group, a comprehensive entertainment company, develops a wide range of businesses such as Publication, Animation, Film, Gaming, Web services, and Education/EdTech. We discover talent globally, create diverse IP (Intellectual property), and deliver it through various media. We maximize the value of IP under our strategy “Global Media Mix with Technology” which refers to global rollouts of created IP by utilizing technology. Please visit group.kadokawa.co.jp/global,

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. With a vibrant community of readers and writers, Honeyfeed provides an immersive space for storytelling across various genres, including anime and manga-inspired narratives. For more about Honeyfeed, please visit honeyfeed.fm.

    About MyAnimeList (MAL)

    MyAnimeList is one of the world’s largest communities and databases for Japanese anime and manga, with 16 million registered members from 240 countries and regions worldwide. An indispensable site for tracking anime and manga progress, it holds over 1.2 billion records of viewing and reading big data. Founded in 2004, MyAnimeList has become a crucial source of information for overseas fans, especially among Generation Z in North America. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net.

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • ARCANA PROJECT, known for performing theme songs for popular titles such as The Aquatope on White Sand and Ultraman Arc, released their new digital single “Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka? / Ruby Ruby” on June 23.
  • These two tracks serve as the second set of image songs for LINK TRAVELERS, Bandai’s new IP that launched through “shokugan” (candy) and “gashapon” (capsule toys) in May 2025.
  • “Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka?” is a classic idol anthem in the current trend, perfect for energizing a live crowd. In contrast, “Ruby Ruby” offers a nostalgic idol vibe with a fresh, uplifting melody. Both songs have been released in two editions: a Short Size used within the LINK TRAVELERS project, and a Full Size performed by all six members.
    • https://youtu.be/NhFv_0DWhKY

    Product Information

    Digital Single “Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka? / Ruby Ruby” On music services: lnk.to/LZC-3148 Tracklist 1. Kimi no Ichioshi Arimasu ka (Short Size) Artist: ARCANA PROJECT (Usa Sakurano, Hana Hanamiya, Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano) Lyrics, Composition, Arrangement: Shinji Suzuki (KEYTONE) 2. Ruby Ruby (Short Size) Artist: ARCANA PROJECT (Shion Aida, Hikaru Amano) Lyrics: Futa Shintani; Composition, Arrangement: Takaaki Kimura (KEYTONE) 3.     LINK TRAVELERS Product Overview

    Bandai’s new IP LINK TRAVELERS is built around two main distribution channels: “SIDE:C (CANDY = Shokugan)” and “SIDE:G (GASHAPON = Capsule Toys).” Following the major success of the original capsule toy figure series “Gashapon Quest,” LINK TRAVELERS was announced in November 2024 as its spiritual successor. This new series shifts the stage to both shokugan and gashapon markets for a fresh rollout. Anticipation was high from the start of online pre-orders, and the product officially launched in May 2025. Featuring highly detailed figures and a wide variety of interchangeable parts, the line gives users the freedom to play and customize according to their preferences. Its richly developed story and setting further deepen the imaginative experience. Official Homepage: bandai.co.jp/candy/linktravelers Official Otona no Shokugan X: x.com/otona_shokugan

    ARCANA PROJECT is an anime song vocal unit jointly produced by DEARSTAGE and Lantis. Known for their rich, fantastical sound and the unique tarot card motifs assigned to each member, they have gained strong support, leading to anime tie-ins and performances at major festivals. On April 29, 2025, during the encore of the Tokyo show of their ARCANA PROJECT TOUR 2025 “ARCANA CARAVAN” held at Daikanyama UNIT, the group surprised fans by announcing the addition of two new members: Yuka Shidomi and Sakura Yoshino. item.title: Takuma Terashima to Release 12th Single “more than W”!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Voice actor and artist Takuma Terashima will release his 12th single “more than W” on August 27, 2025. The title track will serve as the ending theme for the TV anime Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin, which begins airing in July. The jacket art and a new artist photo have been revealed.
  • This single features a special collaboration with TAKE from FLOW, who has frequently performed alongside Terashima at events. TAKE handled the music and composition, while Terashima contributed the lyrics himself. The result is a dark, passionate rock track inspired by the elf sisters from the anime.
  • The limited edition comes in a deluxe EP-sized paper jacket. The letter “W” (symbolizing world, word, and twins) is a key motif, and the cover features a slightly eerie, almost optical illusion-like design.   • SERRA, known for her emotionally resonant voice that has earned her the title “Diva of Emotions,” will release her highly anticipated first album Dawn Light on August 27, 2025, under Bandai Namco Music Live’s label Lantis.
  • SERRA made her major debut with the digital-only single “EYERIS” on November 25, 2022. In April 2023, she performed her first anime tie-in with “Always and Forever,” the ending theme for the TV anime Why Raeliana Ended Up at the Duke’s Mansion. She wrote both the lyrics and music herself, earning high praise from fellow creators not only for her vocals but also for her songwriting talent.
  • On social media, she launched a viral campaign featuring a cappella videos filmed while holding a lantern. These videos quickly gained widespread attention, sparking a buzz among fans. In 2024, she expanded her activities by providing vocals and original songs for other artists as well.
  • Her long-awaited debut album Dawn Light features ten tracks, including two new songs, a remixed version of her major debut track “EYERIS,” the anime tie-in “Always and Forever,” and the fan-favorite “Blackout.” The album also offers fresh remixes and rearrangements of previous songs, offering listeners a fresh perspective on her work.
  • Reflecting the journey of the “Diva of Emotions,” who faced pain and doubt while holding onto hope, this album captures the fleeting moment of a new dawn, when faint light breaks through deep darkness.

    Pain, loneliness, feelings of inferiority, and inner conflict—things I’ve carried alone in the middle of the night. Even in that darkness, I still wanted to believe in the light. item.title: MindaRyn to Hold First World Tour “Hello New Friends”!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • MindaRyn, the Thai-born anisong singer known for theme songs from hit anime and tokusatsu titles like That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime, Arifureta: From Commonplace to World’s Strongest, and the upcoming Ultraman Omega, will embark on her first world tour, “Hello New Friends,” starting from June 2025.
  • In August 2024, she released her second album Across Miles, featuring many of the anime theme songs she has performed. After appearing at the world’s largest anisong event, Animelo Summer Live 2024 -Stargazer- at Saitama Super Arena, she further expanded her global presence with a performance at ANISAMA WORLD 2025 in Manila.
  • “Hello New Friends” will kick off with a performance at Anime Friends 2025 in Brazil this July, followed by stops in cities across North America, Europe, and Southeast Asia. At Anime Friends 2025, MindaRyn will also take the stage with ASH, vocalist of ASH DA HERO, in a special collaboration performance of “Missing Link,” the ending theme for Ultraman Omega, airing in July. This exclusive performance, available only on the world tour, is not to be missed.
  • Full tour details will be updated on MindaRyn’s official website.

    • MindaRyn World Tour “Hello New Friends” Schedule

    Anime Friends 2025 Dates: July 3 – July 6, 2025 Location: São Paulo, Brazil Venue: Distrito Anhembi Website: animefriends.com.br Scheduled performance date: Sunday, July 6 NärCon Sommar 2025 Dates: July 24 – July 27, 2025 Location: Linköping, Sweden Venue: Linköping University Website: narcon.se Performance date to be announced. Additional appearances currently being arranged. Further information on performance dates will be announced on MindaRyn’s official website and X (formerly Twitter).

    About MindaRyn

    Originally from Thailand, MindaRyn was exposed to Japanese culture and anime from a young age and eventually relocated to Japan to pursue a career as an anime song singer. She is a trilingual artist fluent in Thai, Japanese, and English. In November 2020, she made her artist debut under Lantis with the ending theme “BLUE ROSE knows” for the TV anime By the Grace of the Gods. Since then, she has performed theme songs for numerous anime and tokusatsu series, including Ultraman Blazar, That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime, and Arifureta: From Commonplace to World’s Strongest. In 2024, she appeared at Animelo Summer Live 2024 -Stargazer- at Saitama Super Arena, the world’s largest anisong event. In 2025, she will perform “Missing Link,” the first ending theme for the tokusatsu drama Ultraman Omega airing from July, featuring ASH, the vocalist of ASH DA HERO. item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer/songwriter mekakushe’s song “Yuwanamerou,” which was used in Episode 10 of the TV anime series Kowloon Generic Romance, was released online on June 8.
  • Kowloon Generic Romance is a hugely popular mystery-romance anime based on Jun Mayuzuki (of After the Rain fame)’s latest work, which has sold more than 1.5 million copies.
  • Following the ending theme “Retronym of Love” and the Episode 7 insert song “Watashi Dake no Polaris,” this marks the third mekakushe track featured in the series.
  • “Yuwanamerou” was written and composed by mekakushe, with arrangement by Ryohei Sataka (Hifumi, inc.), who also handled the series’ score. The result is a wistful pop song that delicately expresses the complexity of a woman’s hidden emotions.

    • Product Information

    Digital Single mekakushe “Yuwanamerou” Lyrics/Composition: mekakushe　 Arrangement: Ryohei Sakata (Hifumi Inc.) On streaming websites: linkco.re/BQGVYe3c Official audio: youtu.be/k-4W-ea1bnM

    Mekakushe’s Comment

    To me, love is like the aurora—like a mirage, it shines beautifully because it’s born from loneliness. When I imagined the moment of meeting someone, it felt like a rush of heat sweeping through my heart, creating an aurora. It was something like a solar flare. That feeling is what inspired me as I wrote “Yuwanamerou.”

    Mekakushe’s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist “Kirakira Pop Japan” with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances. AVIOT Spring/Summer Promo Tour to Visit Five Major North American Anime Conventions!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, is launching its 2025 Spring/Summer Promo Tour with appearances at anime conventions across the United States. At each event, AVIOT will showcase and sell character voice earbuds and collaboration merchandise.

    • About Character Voice Earbuds

    AVIOT’s character voice earbuds are special-edition models created in collaboration with anime, VTubers, and voice actors. Each pair features exclusive designs, packaging, and voice guidance recorded by the featured cast, providing voice prompts for functions like power and battery status. They also include a “Random Voice” feature, which lets you enjoy iconic lines or exclusive phrases only available through the earbuds. Simply touch and hold the right earbud to hear surprise voice clips at any time. Most models offer multiple voice modes, which can be easily switched via the companion app, allowing you to enjoy different characters or personalities with a single pair. Sound tuning is supervised by the original artists or voice actors to capture each title’s unique atmosphere. Select models also include specially drawn artwork*, designed with close attention to detail to reflect the world of your favorite character. *Sound tuning and special artwork may not be available for all models. In addition to fan-focused features, these earbuds also offer high-end specs such as noise cancellation and long battery life, making them a great choice for everyday use. Several collaboration models are based on the TE-V1R, a high-spec base model that has received multiple awards, including the PCMag Excellence Award.

    Exhibition Schedule

    AVIOT will appear at five anime conventions across five North American cities from April to August 2025, as outlined below: April 18–20: Sakura-Con (Completed) May 21–23: Anime Boston (Completed) June 19–21: OffKai EXPO July 3–6: Anime Expo August 23–25: Anime NYC At each convention, AVIOT will exhibit and sell collaboration earbuds and merchandise created in partnership with a variety of IPs, including anime, games, and VTubers. Some products will also be available for hands-on trials at the booth. In addition, exclusive displays will showcase upcoming collaboration models currently available for pre-order, giving you a chance to experience them before anyone else! You can view the products scheduled for sale at the conventions via the link below: shop.aviot.jp/collections/us-convention-items Please note that quantities are limited and items may sell out. Product lineup is subject to change without notice.

    Scenes from past exhibitions

    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Online Store Sales

    Some of the featured products are also available for purchase or pre-order through AVIOT ONLINE MALL or our official Amazon store. AVIOT ONLINE MALL: shop.aviot.jp/collections/us-convention-items Amazon US: amazon.com/stores/page/0DD062F7-4674-4072-9760-099249E3254F

    About AVIOT

    AVIOT, born in 2018 as the original brand of Preseed Japan Corporation, aims to deliver products that convey high-quality Japanese craftsmanship in sound, delicate and beautiful design, and easy-to-use electronic products. In 2023, the brand restarted with the addition of “A Visionary Innovation On Technology” to its name, aiming to be an electronic devices brand that goes beyond the framework of audio-visual products. The vision is to bring innovation through the power of technology and deliver “something that changes your lives” to customers.
