TOMY Group to Showcase BEYBLADE X, T-SPARK, and Gacha at Anime Expo 2025!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • TOMY Company will exhibit at Anime Expo 2025 (AX2025), North America’s largest anime and manga convention, held in Los Angeles from July 3 to 6. The company will operate three exhibits, each dedicated to a different brand: the BEYBLADE X series, the modern version of “bei-goma” spinning tops; T-SPARK, a hobby label for high-end customers; and the Gacha® capsule toy brand, distributed by T-ARTS Company,Ltd.
  • At the BEYBLADE X booth, the U.S. Open Class of the BEYBLADE X National Tournament will be held on July 5. The winner will qualify for the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025, scheduled for October in Japan, the birthplace of BEYBLADE.
  • This will mark the second consecutive year that BEYBLADE X is featured at the event, while T-SPARK and Gacha will make their debut appearances. Through these exhibits, TOMY Group will continue to share the excitement of play with fans around the world.

    • About BEYBLADE

    “BEYBLADE” battling tops, debuted in 1999, are a modernized version of traditional Japanese battling tops known as “bei-goma.” Over 520 million units have been shipped cumulatively in more than 80 countries and regions around the world (as of April 2023). Each series has created a craze in many countries across the world including Japan. The fourth generation, BEYBLADE X started in July 2023 in Japan.

    Highlights of BEYBLADE X booth

    → The U.S. Open Class (ages 13 and up) of the BEYBLADE X National Tournament will be held to determine the top blader who will advance to the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025. → Visitors can enjoy a free-play area and showcases of upcoming products. For more details about the U.S. Open Class of the BEYBLADE X National Tournament, see: takaratomy.co.jp/english/product_release/pdf/p250605_en.pdf

    About T-SPARK

    “T-SPARK” is the unified brand for hobby products for adults developed by TOMY Company, symbolizing innovation and sophisticated adventure. Leveraging TOMY Company’s expertise in “transformation,” “combination” and “articulation” ― the features that have attracted hobby lovers ― T-SPARK offers a diverse and engaging hobby experience. Some of the T-SPARK products are available through the official North American Online store “TOMY PLUS” (us.tomy.com/brand/tomy-plus) operated by TOMY International, Inc. Official T-SPARK website: takaratomy.co.jp/products/tsparkofficial (Japan).

    Highlights of T-SPARK booth

    → Over 30 new items across 8 series on display: DIACLONE original sci-fi character toys / ZOIDS real moving kits (build-it-yourself motorized toys) / REALIZE MODEL action plastic model kits / TOYRISE REALTOY products / SYNERGENEX collaborative items (Macross 7 × Transformers Basara Prime) / Q VILLAGE cute-meets-cool deformed format series / COLLEKAZARO collectible figures / SPARK Fig character figures in both scale and non-scale sizes. → A mini diorama of Q VILLAGE and a photo spot recreating the world of the characters will be on display. → The third Q VILLAGE collaboration, featuring the manga Initial D, will be revealed for the first time. → COLLEKAZARO: A series of 3.75 inches (10 cm) collectible figures. The products in collaboration with the TV anime series My Hero Academia and its official spin-off My Hero Academia: Vigilantes will be on display. → SPARK Fig: The first figure in the series, Princess Ripple from the TV anime Princession Orchestra, will be on display. Product Details: Q VILLAGE, COLLEKAZARO, SPARK Fig takaratomy.co.jp/english/product_release/pdf/p250528_en.pdf https://youtu.be/4xrQvyHJjik

    About Gacha

    Gacha® Capsule toys, which originated in the U.S. and arrived in Japan in 1965, will celebrate their 60th anniversary in Japan in 2025. Under the Gacha brand, T-ARTS Company,Ltd. has expanded these capsule toys across the country, with Gacha machines found in train stations, airports, major shopping malls, and more. Beloved across generations, Gacha has become a familiar part of daily life and is now attracting attention not only within Japan but also internationally as a unique aspect of Japanese culture. Official Gacha website: takaratomy-arts.co.jp/items/gacha (Japan)

    Highlights of Gacha section

    Free Gacha experience. Popular Gacha items from Japan will be available for purchase. Display of PERIHAPI!, a blind box figure series born from the Gacha brand, with first-ever appearance of products from Haikyu!! and Piapro Characters. Photo spot where visitors can step inside a giant Gacha machine.

    Event Overview

    Event Overview Date: July 3 – July 6, 2025 (Pacific Daylight Time) Venue: Los Angeles Convention Center Booth Numbers: ENTERTAINMENT HALL – E-25 (BEYBLADE X), E-10 (T-SPARK, Gacha, PERIHAPI!) AX2025 Official Website: anime-expo.org/ax

item.title: AVIOT to Open Pre-Orders for KizunaAI Collaboration True Wireless Earbuds!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, opened pre-orders for the TE-V1R-KZN true wireless earbuds, a collaboration model with KizunaAI, on April 28. Based on the TE-V1R, this special edition features design and sound tuning fully supervised by KizunaAI, packaging with brand-new visuals, and newly recorded voice lines in Japanese and English.
  • Based on the latest model in AVIOT’s hit V series, which has sold approximately 170,000 units*, the TE-V1R-KZN is a special edition packed with the unique charm of KizunaAI, who resumed activities in February.
  • KizunaAI (“Kizuna” means “bond” or “connection” in Japanese) is a virtual being and artist who works under the theme, “I still want to connect with you and get to know you.” This collaboration model features earbuds with a design overseen by KizunaAI herself and sound tuning optimized to highlight the full appeal of her singing voice. The packaging showcases a brand-new visual by champi. In addition to newly recorded voice guidance for power and connection status, the earbuds include a “random voice” feature that allows you to listen to special voice lines anytime you like. With the ability to switch between Japanese and English voice modes, these earbuds are a perfect match for an AI who connects with people around the world.
  • KizunaAI introduced the product herself during a special listening party on April 29. Don’t miss it!

    • Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOT’s popular V series, which has sold approximately 170,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDAC™ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of January 2025 Special Voice Lines The voice guidance for notifications such as power status has been newly recorded specifically for this model, with KizunaAI speaking to you as if she’s right there! It also features a “random voice” function that lets you hear lines from KizunaAI anytime you like. As is fitting of an AI who connects with people around the world, the earbuds come with both Japanese and English modes.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Voice line samples are available on the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-kzn Special Design The off-white and soft pink color scheme captures KizunaAI’s signature style, giving the design a calm and refined feel. The charging case features a logo symbolizing her reactivation, while the earbuds themselves are adorned with her iconic emblem. The design was created to have a timeless appeal, making it easy to pair with any outfit or setting.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Packaging The packaging features a brand-new visual created by the illustrator champi, capturing a rare moment of KizunaAI enjoying music through the earbuds. This special design is exclusive to the collaboration and even looks great displayed on its own.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Tuning With full supervision from KizunaAI, the earbuds feature two sound modes that can be switched anytime via the app: Music Mode, specially tuned to bring out the full charm of KizunaAI’s singing voice, and Streaming Mode, designed to deliver clearer audio when watching streams.

    Product Information

    TE-V1R-KZN Price: ¥18,700 (incl. tax) Expected Delivery Date: July 2025 or later Available at: AVIOT ONLINE MALL shop.aviot.jp/products/te-v1r-kzn AMAZON amazon.com/dp/B0F6MJTGGX → Basic Specifications ・Driver: Hybrid type with φ10mm dynamic and balanced armature drivers ・Microphone for calls: MEMS microphone ・Battery capacity: Earbud single ear 85mAh / Case 600mAh ・Talk time*: Up to 9 hours ・Playback time*: Up to 19 hours (with charging case: up to 62 hours) ・Earbud charging time: Approximately 1.5 hours ・Charging port: USB Type-C ・Water resistance level**: Equivalent to IPX4 ・Weight: Earbud single ear approximately 6.5g ・Other features: Multipoint support (up to 2 devices), single ear usage, earbuds can be individually turned on or off, fast charging (up to 120 minutes of playback with a 10-minute charge), wireless charging → Accessories ・Silicone earpieces (1 pair each in sizes S/M/L) ・USB Type-C cable ・User manual → Bluetooth Specifications ・Supported codecs: SBC, AAC, LDAC ・Supported profiles: A2DP, AVRCP, HFP, HSP ・Bluetooth version: 5.3 ・Number of Bluetooth multi-pairing registrable devices: 8 *Exact time may vary depending on your usage environment **Earbuds only

    KizunaAI Profile

    A virtual being and artist who works under the theme, “I still want to connect with you and get to know you.” She debuted in 2016 as a pioneer of virtual YouTubers and quickly expanded her activities through her wide range of talents. After three years of sleep, she resumed her activities on February 26, 2025, and is now seeking new forms of expression through music. Before her hiatus, she focused on Japanese internet dance music. In this new chapter, while staying true to those roots, she blends indie band sounds and J-pop influences to introduce a fresh take on J-pop to the world.

  • DAN DA DAN is a hit manga by Yukinobu Tatsu, currently serialized in Shueisha’s manga app Shonen Jump+ (updated every Tuesday), with over 10 million copies in circulation.     I’m WurtS, and I’m performing the ending theme for the DAN DA DAN anime. As a huge fan of both the manga and the anime, I’m truly honored to be part of this project. In this crazy world where various life forms suddenly appear, I wanted to capture the characters’ complicated feelings—awkward but full of longing. We’ve packed all that excitement and heart-throbbing emotion into this wonderful song. Thank you so much, and I hope you enjoy it.

New Merchandise Reveal: Explore upcoming merchandise inspired by the GINTAMA universe. Exciting Giveaways: Participate in games and a quiz for a chance to win exclusive GINTAMA prizes. ”We are incredibly proud to bring the world premiere of ‘GINTAMA - Mr. Ginpachi’s Zany Class’ to Anime Expo 2025, a premier event for anime enthusiasts,” said Makoto Hijikata, Producer, TV TOKYO. “This spin-off offers a fresh and hilarious take on the beloved GINTAMA world, and we eagerly anticipate sharing it with fans for the very first time. item.title: SANDA's World Premiere Event With Paru Itagaki Set for Anime Expo!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • SANDA is a manga by Paru Itagaki, creator of BEASTARS, which won the Grand Prize at the 2018 Manga Taisho along with three other major manga awards. Set in a near-future Japan where extreme measures are taken to protect children amid a drastic population decline, the story depicts an unconventional Santa Claus hero in an action-packed tale. The anime adaptation is produced by Science SARU, the studio behind DAN DA DAN and Scott Pilgrim Takes Off. It is set to premiere in Japan on October 3, 2025, with a world premiere also confirmed for Anime Expo.
  • Alongside the broadcast date announcement, the second teaser trailer has been released. It showcases a world shaped by extreme overprotection amid a super-declining birthrate, focusing on the classmates of protagonist Kazushige Sanda (voiced by Ayumu Murase) at Daikoku Welfare Academy. How is Santa Claus treated in a Japan where children have almost disappeared? And how will Sanda’s interactions with classmates like Fuyumura develop? Stay tuned for more updates!
  • New Characters and Voice Cast Revealed, with Comments! Alongside the release of Teaser PV #2, several new characters have been revealed! Umeka Shoji voices Shiori Fuyumura, who discovers Sanda’s identity and sets out to save her missing best friend. Her friend Ichie Ono is played by Anna Nagase. Yuuki Shin voices Hitoshi Amaya, Sanda’s roommate, and Misato Matsuoka plays Nico Kazao, Sanda’s fiancée. Comments from the cast have also been released!
  • https://youtu.be/X2VRYMWbaes

    SANDA Joins Anime Expo!

    SANDA will be featured at Anime Expo 2025, North America’s largest anime and Japanese pop culture event, held at the Los Angeles Convention Center from July 3 to 6. On July 4, a world premiere event will take place, with author Paru Itagaki, director Tomohisa Shimoyama, and Science SARU producer Kohei Sakita in attendance. The event will include a live drawing session by Itagaki and a screening of Episode 1 of the SANDA anime. For more information, please check Anime Expo’s official social media channels.

    Anime Expo 2025 Overview

    Dates: July 3 (Thu) – July 6 (Sun), 2025 Venue: Los Angeles Convention Center Official Website: anime-expo.org Official X: x.com/animeexpo Official Instagram: instagram.com/animeexpo Official Facebook: facebook.com/animeexpo

    SANDA event at Anime Expo 2025

    Date: July 4 (Fri) Time: 12:30 PM – 1:50 PM Location: JW Platinum Ballroom Panelists: Paru Itagaki (author), Tomohisa Shimoyama (director), Kohei Sakita (producer) The event will include: ・Live drawing by Paru Itagaki ・World premiere of the first episode of the TV anime SANDA ・Commentary on highlighted scenes from episode #1 and discussion ・Q&A with the panelists ・Comment video by Ayumu Murase (who plays Sanda) ・Free give away for visitors: SANDA Towel (Tenugui style) Official X (formerly Twitter): x.com/sanda_anime Official Website: sanda.red
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Voice Cast of Sanda’s Classmates Revealed!

    Shiori Fuyumura (Voiced by Umeka Shoji)

    A 14-year-old classmate of Sanda who stands over 182 cm tall. She seeks help from Santa Claus to find her friend Ono, who suddenly went missing. To break the curse and revive the sealed Santa, she threatens Sanda with a deadly blade. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Fuyumura in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? Meeting Shiori Fuyumura during the audition was such a powerful experience that it feels like she’s become a constant presence in my life. I poured everything I have into this role. I’d be thrilled if SANDA reaches a wide audience. 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything you’d want to ask him for? A liver so strong that it can handle any alcohol.

    Ichie Ono (Voiced by Anna Nagase)

    A classmate of Sanda and best friend of Fuyumura. She suddenly disappeared from their class, and her whereabouts remain unknown. The school considers her dead, but Fuyumura is determined to search for her with Santa Claus’ help. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Ono in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? Ono was a role that really challenged me. I struggled a lot while developing the character, and I constantly felt a sense of anxiety and tightness in my chest. I hope that feeling comes through in Ono’s portrayal. Please look forward to the broadcast! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything you’d want to ask him for? When I was a kid, I was always the one receiving presents, so this time, I’d like to give something back. Maybe I could help out? Like riding in the sleigh with Santa and delivering presents around town! That sounds like fun.

    Hitoshi Amaya (Voiced by Yuuki Shin)

    Sanda’s roommate, also known as “Prince Amaya.” He is one of the few who know Santa Claus’ secret and wants him to return to fulfill an important wish. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Amaya in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? I’m really excited to be voicing Amaya in SANDA. I enjoyed bringing out his mysterious charm through my performance. This story really makes you reflect on what it means to be an adult. It’s a wonderful series, so please be sure to watch it! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything you’d want to ask him for? I’d love to ask Santa Claus for a Nintendo Switch 2. Even if I don’t get one, just a chance to win the pre-order lottery would be great. I’ve been good, so please! I’d like to play racing games on it!

    Nico Kazao (Voiced by Misato Matsuoka)

    Sanda’s fiancée, chosen by the country from birth. She’s a realist who wants to rebel a little before becoming a “responsible adult.” She always acts freely and often swears. Comment 1. How did you feel when you were cast as Nico in SANDA? And what message do you have for fans looking forward to the series? When I first learned about Nico, I was deeply captivated by her complete freedom from any constraints. She might be someone who truly understands the preciousness of the present moment. I’m genuinely happy to be able to bring her to life! Please watch as these lovable characters struggle and grow together. I poured my heart into this role and had a great time. Thank you for your support! 2. Since this is an action series featuring Santa Claus, is there anything you’d want to ask him for? I love eggplant, so I’d want lots of dishes like deep-fried eggplant soaked in light dashi and mapo eggplant!

    TV Anime SANDA Overview

    Broadcast begins October 3, 2025 in Japan Official X (formerly Twitter): x.com/sanda_anime Official website: sanda.red

    Cast

    Kazushige Sanda: Ayumu Murase Santa Claus: Hiroki Touchi Shiori Fuyumura: Umeka Shoji Ichie Ono: Anna Nagase Hitoshi Amaya: Yuuki Shin Nico Kazao: Misato Matsuoka Staff Original: “SANDA” by Paru Itagaki (Akita Shoten / Shonen Champion Comics) Director: Tomohisa Shimoyama Script: Kimiko Ueno Music: Tomoyuki Tanaka (FPM) Character Design: Masamichi Ishiyama Animation Production: Science SARU

(*1)
  • The winner of this tournament will advance to represent the United States at the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025, scheduled for October in Japan, the birthplace of BEYBLADE. This event promises high-stakes battles, highlighting the thrill of GEAR SPORTS for both players and spectators alike.

Registration closes once capacity (128 participants) is reached. Official Website: beyblade.com/worldchampionship2025

    We are thrilled to hold the tournament in Los Angeles, the entertainment capital of the world, to determine the top blader, who will advance to the BEYBLADE X WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP 2025. On the day of the tournament, the TOMY Company Beyblade development team will also come from Japan to offer their support. Just like in Japan, we’re eagerly looking forward to intense Bey battles in the U.S.

    Born in 1999, the BEYBLADE brand originated in Japan and has been enjoyed globally across generations for over 25 years. The fourth generation, BEYBLADE X, launched in July 2023, has surpassed 30 million units shipped worldwide (including 79 regions in Asia, North America, and Europe) as of April 2025, with intense battles taking place around the globe. In the United States, BEYBLADE is sold at major retailers such as Walmart and Target, the largest e-commerce company Amazon, and the leading game retailer GameStop. item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] Celebrating TRUE's 10th Anniversary!
item.content:encoded:
Miho Karasawa, who also goes by the stage name TRUE, has just released her 10th anniversary album titled "TRUE the BEST" on February 26 (her debut date)! You may know her for her passionate vocal style and straightforward lyrics in theme songs for anime series like Buddy Complex, Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet, Maria the Virgin Witch, Sound! Euphonium, and many others. Although she has been active as an artist since 2000, she debuted under the name TRUE in 2014, quickly becoming a powerhouse singer, flawlessly performing numerous opening and ending themes each anime season. We had the lovely opportunity to interview TRUE once more, to talk about the future and reflect on these ten years full of hits and challenges.

TRUE
Honey-Chan
Interview with TRUE
[gray-hex-decoration]
It’s been a year since our last conversation, and we're so happy to be chatting with you again! So, you recently released an anniversary album, packed with 30 songs and numerous hits. Was it challenging to select and arrange the tracks for this album? And if you had to choose, which song would you say is your favorite?
This release includes singles, lead tracks from albums, and key songs that represent my musical journey over the past ten years. With the exception of the first and last tracks, the songs are arranged in the order they were released. It starts with the first track, “TRUE,” and ends with “DelighT,” with the capital T at the end representing the T in TRUE. I wanted it to begin and end with TRUE, which is how the tracklist took shape. Every song holds a special meaning to me, so it’s hard to pick just one favorite.
The Limited First Edition includes a Blu-ray featuring two performances: TRUE Live Sound! vol.6 Encount, held at NHK Hall, and Sayonara Nakano Sunplaza Music Festival: TRUE Live Sound! vol.7 Ensemble, held at Nakano Sunplaza, both from 2023. Can you share any memorable anecdotes or special moments from these performances?
For me, live performances are life itself. I’m truly grateful to have these moments recorded. I hope that even those who couldn’t be there can still feel the passion of the shows through the Blu-ray.
https://youtu.be/x6fUsfL8UKw
And how about your most recent live event, TRUE 10th Anniversary Live Sound! Final Shuutaisei at Zepp DiverCity this January? How was that experience?
That show was the perfect way to wrap up my 10th anniversary. It was my first time performing in a large live house, and the audience’s energy was even greater than I had imagined. I felt that it was a meaningful milestone not just for me, but for the fans as well, marking the end of a decade. Throughout the anniversary year, I held various types of live shows, and I plan to use what I gained from those experiences moving forward.
Now it's time to celebrate your first decade as an artist, but given everything you've accomplished so far, we imagine you're already planning your next steps. Are you currently working on any new songs or projects to be released soon?
Yes, I’m trying various new things and plan to put even more effort into live performances both in Japan and overseas. Since last year, I’ve been doing joint live shows with other artists, and through these interactions, I’m working to expand my musical range. Another goal for the future is to create a theme song for a tokusatsu anime. I will continue my music activities, dreaming of the day that wish comes true.
In May, you performed three new shows in Japan as part of your TRUE Live Tour PLAY! vol.1 -ReCoda-. How did you prepare for these events?
This time, I did my very first hall tour. I felt like I received so many gifts and warm congratulations for my 10th anniversary, and so many people came out to celebrate with me at my shows. I’m going to use all that support as fuel to make each live performance a success from this 11th year onward, which will help me grow even more. It’s not exactly going back to my roots, but I’m planning to perform with the same band lineup as my very first live, carefully arranging each song to deliver it thoughtfully. In June, I’m also holding my first-ever Asia tour. It’s a new challenge to see how much I can convey beyond borders and language barriers. I’ll do my best!
We'll be looking forward to this! And to close our interview, could you share a message for our readers, many of whom have followed our previous interviews and are passionate about your music?
Thank you always for your support. I’m truly grateful to receive encouragement from people in many countries through social media. Your words keep me motivated. From now on, as an anisong singer, I will continue doing my best to share Japanese anime culture and anisong culture with all of you. I look forward to the day we can meet someday.
We've been listening to this new album since release day, and it brings back so many memories! At Honey’s Anime, we’re deeply passionate about TRUE’s music and have had the pleasure of witnessing her incredible growth over the years. If you’re new to her work and eager to discover more, be sure to check her out on social media.

item.title: Japanese Traditional Craft x The Ghost in the Shell: “TechnoByobu: TB-02” — An Art Piece That Transcends Time and Space Coming in 2026 from U/M/A/A
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • U/M/A/A has announced that it will release a second installment of “TechnoByobu,” an art piece that combines the spirit of techno with the traditional Japanese craft of folding screens, in 2026. This new series, titled “TB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,” is based on Shirow Masamune’s legendary cyberpunk series The Ghost in the Shell.
  • “TechnoByobu” is an art piece of a new era that reimagines the works of internationally and domestically acclaimed artists as folding screens made from wafer-thin golden brass leaves, a craft that has been handed down in Japan for over 500 years. The artworks, vividly depicted in vibrant colors on folding screens made entirely of golden brass leaf, have attracted attention as a fusion of traditional and modern art. The first piece, “TB-01: Electronic Fan Girl,” which was inspired by the album artwork of YMO (Yellow Magic Orchestra), generated significant buzz.
  • “TB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,” based on the world-famous science fiction work The Ghost in the Shell (Shirow Masamune/Kodansha), utilizes the physical medium of a folding screen with cybernetic visuals, creating a next-generation visual that merges past and future.
  • Scheduled for release in 2026 as part of a series themed around traditional Japanese elegance, the first work in the series boldly features Motoko Kusanagi and the Fuchikoma from Shirow Masamune’s original 1991 manga, on a golden brass leaf background.
  • Prior to the release, U/M/A/A will unveil the first prototype of the series at Design Shanghai 2025 (designshanghai.com) to be held in Shanghai, China, from June 4, 2025.

    • TechnoByobu Second Installment TB-02: The Ghost in the Shell

    ️TechnoByobu Second Installment

    Number: TB-02 Title: The Ghost in the Shell Artist: Shirow Masamune

    Product Overview

    TechnoByobu Official Website: technobyobu.jp Release Date: Scheduled for 2026 This piece will be offered as a limited edition, accompanied by a unique serial number. If you are considering a purchase, please register through the Customer Service form on the official website. Priority information will be sent to registered customers. Customer Service form: technobyobu.jp/cs Size: Height: 59.05 inches (1,500 mm) Width: 55.12 inches (1,400 mm) Weight: 8.8 pounds (4 kg) Material: Golden Brass Leaf Printing Method: Archival Pigment Print Technique: Kasane Graphica Multi-Layered Pigment Transfer Technique Price: TBD Series Concept: A lineup of distinct pieces infused with the elegance and spirit of Japan.

    What is TechnoByobu?

    TechnoByobu’s “techno” originates from the Greek word téchnē, meaning art, technique, or skill. It embodies more than just practical know-how; it’s a philosophical concept that encompasses the intelligence and creativity behind craftsmanship, as well as the futuristic expression of electronic music. Rooted in this background, “techno” is not only the origin of the word “technology” but also a layered term that blends cultural and artistic innovation. Based on this philosophy, TechnoByobu is composed of three elements: ・Artwork that evokes futurism (art) ・Byobu (folding screens), a traditional Japanese craft kept alive by artisans (skill) ・Digital certificates guaranteed by technology (technique) By overlapping these elements, TechnoByobu culminates as an art piece that expresses the multifaceted nature of “Techno.” Moving forward, it will continue to explore new possibilities of expression in collaboration with diverse talents both in Japan and abroad.

    About The Ghost in the Shell

    “The Ghost in the Shell” is a science fiction manga series written by manga artist Shirow Masamune, which began serialization in 1989, in Kodansha’s “Young Magazine Pirate Edition.” The story revolves around Motoko Kusanagi, a full-body cyborg with exceptional skill in both cyber and conventional warfare. With the rank of Major, she leads the aggressive unit “Shell Squad” as they confront highly intricate and sinister crimes. With its realistic art style, the series’ narrative explores the fusion of humans and technology, delving into cyberpunk elements and philosophical themes, while deeply examining topics such as personal identity. The series has been expanded into various forms including theatrical and TV animations, as well as games. Each of these adaptations offers its own unique story, interpretations, and expressions, distinct from the original manga.

    Unveiling of the prototype at Design Shanghai — the World’s First Public Exhibition

    Design Shanghai is one of the world’s most prestigious international design events and a driving force in the new frontier-breaking Chinese design world. In 2024, they invited more than 600 brands from 40 countries worldwide to exhibit new products and hold specially organized events. At this year’s 2025 Design Shanghai, starting June 4, TechnoByobu’s second installment, “TB-02: The Ghost in the Shell,” will be unveiled to the world for the very first time. During the exhibition, visitors will have the opportunity to see the prototype up close.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Exhibition Information

    Design Shanghai 2025 Date: June 4th-7th, 2025 Venue: Shanghai Expo Hall 3 “Beyond Craft Japan” 3F81 designshanghai.com

    About Rekiseisha

    In its founding year of 1905, Rekiseisha developed a groundbreaking scientific technique that had never been seen before: foil-pressed paper using brass leaf that was just as beautiful as the traditional gold foil (hon-kinpaku) but far more resistant to discoloration over time. This innovative manufacturing method has earned Rekiseisha international acclaim, with its foil products used not only by the Imperial Hotel, the Imperial Household Agency, and Nishi Honganji Temple, but also by global luxury brands such as CHANEL and GUCCI. HP：rekiseisha.com

    About U/M/A/A Inc. (United Music And Arts) (Planning, Production, Sales)

    U/M/A/A Inc. is a next-generation record label dedicated to bridging music and art—including media art, fashion, anime, games, manga, and technology—across Japan and the rest of the world. The label curates and delivers high-quality music that spans a wide range of genres, from club and electronic music to internet-driven styles such as Vocaloid and anime songs. Founded by Masakazu “Hiro” Hiroishi—formerly of the legendary Alfa Records, the company that brought Yellow Magic Orchestra (YMO) to global prominence in the late 1970s—U/M/A/A Inc. was established with the mission of carrying forward YMO’s pioneering spirit and the innovation of techno-pop into the modern age. In that spirit, U/M/A/A Inc. presents TechnoByobu—a project that embodies the fusion of tradition, technology, and art. Contact: U/M/A/A Inc. info@technobyobu.jp umaa.net

    Cat. Number：TB-01 Title: Electronic Fan Girl Licensed by ©2022 Lou Beach through ALFA Music, Inc. TechnoByobu’s first release is inspired by the album artwork of Yellow Magic Orchestra by Lou Beach. By recreating YMO’s iconic jacket with the beautiful shine of brass foil and merging it with technology to ensure the piece’s authenticity, it produces a new form of art. item.title: ASH and MindaRyn Announced as Theme Song Artists for Ultraman Omega!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • The Ultraman series is beloved across generations, and as its 60th anniversary approaches, the latest installment is poised to launch worldwide through broadcast and streaming. The tokusatsu drama Ultraman Omega will debut on July 5, 2025, in Japan.
  • It was announced today that the opening theme, “BRIGHT EYES,” will be performed by ASH, while the ending theme, “Missing Link,” will be performed by MindaRyn, with a rap by ASH.
  • Both songs will be released as a CD single on July 21, 2025. The product will include a limited-edition soft vinyl figure of Ultraman Omega Transformation Glow Color Ver. from the Ultra Hero Series.

    • Opening Theme

    BRIGHT EYES Vocals: ASH Lyrics: Yohei Matsui; Composition: NARASAKI; Arrangement: Kazuya Nishioka
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    ASH's Comment

    Hello, this is ASH. I’m honored to be performing the opening theme and contributing the rap part to the ending theme for Ultraman Omega. It truly feels like a dream to be involved with Ultraman, a series I’ve loved since childhood. I wish I could go back and tell my younger self—the one who used to send letters to Ultraman! Both “BRIGHT EYES” and “Missing Link” are songs about the importance of believing in yourself. I hope these songs plant a seed of courage in your heart.

    Profile

    A powerhouse rock singer who captivates fans with his distinctive voice and magnetic charisma. As the frontman of ASH DA HERO—hailed as “the ultimate rock band of the Reiwa era”—ASH leads the rock scene with a bold, genre-blending style rooted in rock, punk, and hip-hop. With a deep passion for anime and manga culture, he garnered major attention through his collaboration with the TV anime Blue Lock. In 2025, he embarked on his first world tour, further solidifying his presence on the global stage.

    Ending Theme

    Missing Link Vocals: MindaRyn feat. ASH Lyrics: Yohei Matsui, ASH; Composition/Arrangement: thug
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    MinaRyn's Comment

    I’m truly moved to once again be performing an ending theme for the Ultraman series! I sang with all my heart to capture the power and spirit of Ultraman Omega. I hope Omega’s determination to move forward without losing hope in the face of any challenge will resonate with people around the world. It’s a project I’m deeply proud to be part of. Please enjoy the ending theme, performed by ASH and me!

    Profile

    Originally from Thailand, MindaRyn was exposed to Japanese culture and anime from a young age and eventually relocated to Japan to pursue a career as an anime song singer. She is a trilingual artist fluent in Thai, Japanese, and English. In November 2020, she made her artist debut under Lantis with the ending theme “BLUE ROSE knows” for the TV anime By the Grace of the Gods. Since then, she has performed theme songs for numerous anime and tokusatsu series, including Ultraman Blazar, That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime, and Arifureta: From Commonplace to World's Strongest.

  • This new label aims to bring out the unique qualities of artists, from emerging talents to seasoned creators, across a range of genres and styles. A combination of the words “Unique” and “Era,” UNIERA seeks to spark a new wave for the next generation. With music at its core, it will embrace diverse cultural touchpoints such as anime, fashion, and toys, expanding its reach in Japan and overseas while offering a space for free expression and new creative possibilities for all artists seeking new challenges.
  • The first four artists to join UNIERA have been announced: LINKL PLANET, an idol group promoting plastic models worldwide; INUWASI, a powerhouse live idol group that sold out at KT Zepp Yokohama in a solo concert this March; majiko, who has over 200 million streams across Asia; and Daoko, known for the hit “Uchiage Hanabi” with Kenshi Yonezu, which has topped 600 million views on YouTube. All four are distinctive talents expected to help shape the future music scene.

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] nano.RIPE Talks New Album, Tour, and Over 20 Years of Music
item.content:encoded:
After over two decades in the industry, Japanese duo nano.RIPE continues to shine. Their latest full album, Hikari wo Hakobumono (“Those Who Carry Light”), was released on March 12, and features 13 tracks—including 10 brand-new songs—built around the theme of “initial impulses.” Even after 15 years since their debut, nano.RIPE remains driven by the same spark that first inspired them to create music. In this exclusive interview, we catch up with nano.RIPE to talk about the album’s creative process, their evolution as a band, and how they’ve kept their passion alive through the years.

nano.RIPE
Honey-Chan
Interview with nano.RIPE
[gray-hex-decoration]
After a 2-year break, you've just released your 8th full album, Hikari wo Hakobumono. How do you feel about it, and what was the creative process like?
During the two and a half years since our last album, we continued making songs and releasing singles. So rather than beginning from a single burst of inspiration, this album consists of 10 tracks carefully selected from songs we created in that period, older pieces, and brand-new ones written specifically for this release. We believe we’ve put together a really strong album this time.
And to promote this new release, you will be touring Japan from April to June. What can your fans expect from these shows?
This tour mainly features songs from the album, but we’re mixing in popular live tracks and making big changes to the setlist in each location! Whether you come to one show or two or three, we’ll make sure the live experience never gets boring!
https://youtu.be/SxzSYnV8d1w
What can you tell us about the evolution of nano.RIPE, both musically and as a duo, over the past two decades since you first started?
Although we’ve gone through several member changes, I’m really glad we’ve been able to keep going without stopping. When the members change, the sound naturally changes too, but that’s why we’ve made a point of clearly deciding which parts should change and which should stay the same. By focusing on creating music that stays true to nano.RIPE, I feel we’ve been able to grow.
Speaking of growth, how would you describe the new sound of Hikari wo Hakobumono and its theme of "initial impulses"?
This is the 15th year since our debut, and our eighth album, but we still have plenty we want to do and sing about. I think that’s because the “initial impulse” we had when we started the band is still with us. This album is packed with that feeling.
At Honey's Anime, we're thrilled about your new album, and many of your fresh tracks have been stuck in our heads since the first listen. Could you share a message with our readers who have been following your successful career?
Thank you so much for always supporting nano.RIPE! We’ll keep working hard to create great music. We look forward to the day we can meet at a live show.
We certainly be attending one—or more—of your shows this year! And if you're outside Japan but still love nano.RIPE, or you're just discovering them, be sure to check out their socials and follow them to stay updated on everything they're doing!
Connect with nano.RIPE Official website: nanoripe.com Instagram：instagram.com/nano.ripe, instagram.com/nano.ripe_jun X: @nanoripe_info Official fanclub: nano-fc.jp YouTube：@nanoripe Spotify：open.spotify.com/intl-ja/artist/1GQptL2kOEsfMXerW4OjMT

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] Rico Sasaki on Palette Days and Her Creative Journey
item.content:encoded:
With a growing list of anime credits and a voice that effortlessly bridges the worlds of music and performance, Rico Sasaki continues to leave her mark across Japan’s entertainment scene. In this exclusive interview, she shares her excitement over performing “Palette Days”, the opening theme for Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!, and dives into her unique process behind voicing the charming cat-boy Mewi. From heartfelt songwriting to her dreams of voicing unexpected roles, Rico Sasaki opens up about her passion, versatility, and the joy she finds in connecting with fans through both music and character.

Rico Sasaki
Honey-Chan
Interview with Rico Sasaki
[gray-hex-decoration]
Ms. Sasaki, thank you so much for taking the time to chat with us. It’s a real pleasure to learn more about one of our favorite artists! You've had several years of career and nearly a dozen appearances in anime. How are you feeling about your song "Palette Days" being chosen as the opening theme for the anime Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!?
When I heard I was chosen for the theme song, I was truly thrilled and honored! I was also happy when I passed the audition for the role of Mewi, and to be entrusted with the opening theme song as well! I almost jumped for joy.
And this isn't your only anime involvement this year. You recently performed as Doloris in the opening of BanG Dream! Ave Mujica and will also be voicing a character in the upcoming Isekai Mokushiroku Mynoghra. How do you personally relate to Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!? and what is the connection between your song "Palette Days" and this anime?
Every show has a completely different world, and getting to both act and sing in each one is truly fun and fulfilling! In Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!, I play Mewi, a cute cat-boy with the special ability to control magic stones. To fully bring out his charm, I read the original manga thoroughly, watched cat videos to study their meows, and practiced really hard!
https://youtu.be/CO3RPKGAUr8
While "Palette Days" was composed and arranged by KOUGA, with lyrics by Erica Masaki, another track on your latest single was written and composed by you. Could you tell us more about this particular song?
“Kimi to Boku no Hoshi” is a song about cherishing and never forgetting emotions—even loneliness and sadness—and turning those feelings into the strength to face tomorrow, with a firm resolve to become a star. It’s like a wish carried on a shooting star. To stir the listener’s imagination, I intentionally used vague expressions, kept the instrumentation simple, and went through many rounds of trial and error, repeatedly sharing my vision as we shaped the song.
You've had a notable career as a voice actress. How do you balance your time between your roles as a singer and an actress? What excites you the most about each?
Through singing, I can express my true, unfiltered emotions as Rico Sasaki. Through voice acting, I can become someone entirely different. Both are irreplaceable sources of purpose in my life, and getting to pursue something I’ve loved since I was young brings me more joy than anything else.
As an artist with such a distinctive voice, how do you prepare vocally for such varied projects like singing and voice acting? Do you have any special routines?
Eating well and getting plenty of sleep! No matter how motivated or excited I am, if I’m not healthy, I can’t give 100%, and I’d definitely regret that. So before a performance, I’m extra careful about taking care of myself. I also read lots of messages from fans. Even when I’m feeling anxious, their words calm me and make me want to see everyone right away. It instantly blows my fatigue away!
And to wrap up the interview, is there any unexpected type of role you'd like to voice in the future, such as a ruthless villainess, a quirky mascot character, or something along those lines?
I’d love to try voicing a handsome young man! I’ve played young boys around elementary school age before, but I’ve never had the chance to voice a teenage or adult male character, so I’d really like to try it. I’ll study hard to deliver a cool performance that gets everyone’s hearts racing!
Thank you again, Ms. Sasaki, for sharing your time and insights with us. We’re excited to see what the future holds for you—both on stage and on screen—and we’ll be cheering you on every step of the way!
Connect with Rico Sasaki Official Site: sasakirico.com X (Twitter): x.com/sasakirico Instagram: instagram.com/sasakirico_official YouTube channel: youtube.com/@sasakirico

item.title: PassCode Kicks Off “PassCode DESTINY to the NEXT TOUR 2025” to Promote New Album INSIGNIA! Music Video for DESTINEX Released!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • On May 24, the four-member all-female vocal and dance group PassCode kicked off their latest live tour, “PassCode DESTINY to the NEXT TOUR 2025,” at BayHall in Yokohama, Kanagawa. Additionally, the music video for their new song “DESTINEX,” which began pre-release streaming on May 21, was released on their official YouTube channel.
  • INSIGNIA, set for release on June 18, marks PassCode’s first album under their current lineup and their first new album in about four and a half years. The national tour to promote the album will cover 13 shows across 12 cities nationwide and serves as an important lead-up to their long-awaited arena concert, PassCode YOKOHAMA BUNTAI 2025 “DESTINEX,” scheduled for November.
  • PassCode’s Yokohama BayHall show kicked off what promises to be an intense year. From the first song, the energy was high both on stage and in the crowd. The members were surprised by the strong reaction to their new pre-release song’s debut performance. With a refreshed setlist, the four delivered a determined show pushing beyond “the other side of destiny,” and the 1,100-strong audience packed into the venue responded enthusiastically. This night suggested the entire tour could be their best yet!
  • PassCode’s new album INSIGNIA is set to become a defining work for the group. It includes a carefully chosen selection of popular songs released since Emiri Arima joined, along with six powerful new tracks led by “DESTINEX,” making a total of 12 songs. item.title: Mekakushe’s “Watashi Dake no Polaris” (from Kowloon Generic Romance) Now Streaming! Anime Lyric Video Also Available!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer/songwriter mekakushe’s song “Watashi Dake no Polaris” (My One and Only Polaris), which was used in Episode 7 of the TV anime series Kowloon Generic Romance, was released online on May 18.
  • The super-popular mystery/romance series is based on Jun Mayuzuki (of After the Rain fame)’s latest work, which has sold more than 1.4 million copies.
  • Following in the footsteps of the ending theme, “Koi no Retronym” (Retronym of Love), mekakushe and Ryohei Sakata (Hifumi Inc.) have created a light and lively rhythm that almost seems to skip along. The end result is a vibrant, heartfelt pop number that’s bursting with colorful stars.
    • https://youtu.be/wFYG8hFPYHw

    Product Information

    Digital Single mekakushe “Watashi Dake no Polaris” Lyrics/Composition: mekakushe　 Arrangement: Ryohei Sakata (Hifumi Inc.) On streaming websites: linkco.re/UeehU5YZ Lyric video (TV size): youtu.be/wFYG8hFPYHw Official audio: youtu.be/ZdH3hmUo8ek

    Mekakushe’s Comment

    This song is meant to be a kind of good luck charm. Just like the stars at night, songs can have a distant feeling to them because of how brightly they shine. So, I wrote “Watashi Dake no Polaris” with those thoughts in mind. Even on days when they’re hidden behind the clouds, stars still twinkle with the same intensity. I always want to stare at the special person right beside me, because their brilliant light means I’ll never feel alone!

    Mekakushe’s Profile

    Handling lyrics, composition, vocals, and piano performance by herself, the next-generation singer-songwriter Mekakushe enjoys immense popularity among artists and creators. Starting classical piano at the age of three, she gradually gravitated towards pop music. Her independently produced songs were featured in a Kao Laurier commercial, and she was one of the top artists on the Spotify official playlist “Kirakira Pop Japan” with a total of 3 million plays. She is a promising emerging artist with anticipated future success. With electronica as the foundation in her recordings, her musical style continues to expand, featuring classical solos and band sets in live performances. item.title: Animation Studio Satelight Celebrates 30th Anniversary with Streaming Launch of Nobunaga the Fool Songs
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Animation studio Satelight, known for popular series such as Macross Frontier and Genesis of Aquarion, will celebrate its 30th anniversary in 2025. To mark the occasion, streaming of character songs, the original soundtrack, and the Season 2 ending theme from the TV anime Nobunaga the Fool began on May 23, 2025.
  • Nobunaga the Fool is an original anime created by Shoji Kawamori—who also serves as special advisor at Satelight Inc.—and features his work as series composer and chief director. The show drew attention as a grand sci-fi Sengoku epic where legendary figures from East and West battle using armor-like mobile weapons called “Ikusa Yoroi.” The project also attracted attention for its innovative “multidimensional” approach, linking the anime with stage productions. The series continues to have a loyal fanbase to this day.
  • The character song collection includes six volumes in total, starting with Vol. 1 Oda Nobunaga (CV: Mamoru Miyano) and Vol. 2 Toyotomi Hideyoshi (CV: Yuki Kaji). These must-listen tracks bring to life powerful characters surviving in a war-torn world.
  • The original soundtrack is composed by Masaru Yokoyama, known for his work on Mashle and Mobile Suit Gundam: Iron-Blooded Orphans. The Season 2 ending theme, “Ran,” performed by ASUKA, features a powerful yet delicate vocal performance that captures the show’s emotional depth and highlights its characters’ inner struggles.
  • Together with the already-released opening theme “FOOL THE WORLD” by Minori Chihara, ending theme “AXIS” by STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION, and Season 2 opening theme “Breakthrough” by JAM Project, fans can now enjoy the full lineup of Nobunaga the Fool’s memorable music on streaming services.

    • Songs Released for Streaming

    TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Season 2 Ending Theme “Ran” / ASUKA TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 1 Oda Nobunaga (CV: Mamoru Miyano) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 2 Toyotomi Hideyoshi (CV: Yuki Kaji) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 3 Jeanne Kaguya d’Arc (CV: Yoko Hikasa) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 4 Ichihime (CV: Minori Chihara) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 5 Himiko (CV: Nao Toyama) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Character Song Vol. 6 Gaius Julius Caesar (CV: Yuichi Nakamura) TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Original Soundtrack Vol. 1 / Masaru Yokoyama TV Anime Nobunaga the Fool Original Soundtrack Vol. 2 / Masaru Yokoyama

  • The all-female vocal and dance group PassCode will release INSIGNIA, their first full album in approximately four and a half years, on June 18. Ahead of the release, one of the new tracks, “DESTINEX,” is now available on various music streaming platforms (released on May 21). In addition, the album’s cover artwork and full tracklist have been revealed.
  • “DESTINEX” also serves as the title song for PassCode’s long-awaited arena concert, PassCode YOKOHAMA BUNTAI 2025 “DESTINEX,” scheduled for November. The title conveys the meaning of “beyond a predetermined fate.” Before the song was produced, the group launched a sing-along project, gathering voices from fans around the world. Their passionate chorus is featured in the track, creating a powerful collaboration between the members and their fans.
  • The full album INSIGNIA includes standout tracks such as “Freely / FLAVOR OF BLUE,” which left a strong impression following Emily Arima’s addition to the group in August 2021, along with live staples like “Clouds Across The Moon” and “GROUNDSWELL.” Also featured are “WILLSHINE,” the opening theme for the second season of the anime SHY, and “SKILLAWAKE,” the opening theme for the second season of As a Reincarnated Aristocrat, I’ll Use My Appraisal Skill to Rise in the World. In addition to the lead “DESTINEX,” the album also includes five powerful new songs: “MIRAGE WALKER,” “VIRIVIRI,” “One Time Only,” “A certain Motor-Heart is not working right!” and “Echoes.” There’s no doubt this album marks a new pinnacle in PassCode’s career.

item.title: Rico Sasaki to Release “Majestic Catastrophe,” Opening Theme for Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Singer and voice actress Rico Sasaki will release her new single “Majestic Catastrophe” on August 27, 2025. The title track serves as the opening theme for the TV anime Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin, which premieres in July 2025.
  • Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra is a nation-building fantasy series that follows Takuto Ira, a legendary player who once topped the user rankings in Eternal Nations, a nation-management simulation game set in a fantasy world. While hospitalized, he loses consciousness and wakes up in Idragia, a world that feels just like the game. Thus begins a tale of fantasy and empire-building.
  • “Majestic Catastrophe,” the anime’s opening theme, builds on Sasaki’s signature rock sound while venturing into new territory with a symphonic metal style that reflects the anime’s world. The powerful, dramatic track is matched by Sasaki’s commanding vocals.
  • The single includes three songs: the title track “Majestic Catastrophe” and two additional tracks, one featuring lyrics written by Sasaki herself.

    • Comment from Rico Sasaki

    I’ll be performing “Majestic Catastrophe,” the opening theme for the TV anime Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin! It’s a dark and beautiful song that brings a sense of catharsis. I sang powerfully to reflect its pressing intensity, and delicately, as if searching for hope in the darkness. The heavy chorus, along with lyrics and a melody that evoke an ominous atmosphere, all work together to draw listeners into the depths of a dark musical world. “Majestic Catastrophe” stirs emotions deep within—get ready to be hooked by its irresistible darkness.

    Product Information

    Title: Majestic Catastrophe (OP Theme of Apocalypse Bringer Mynoghra: World Conquest Starts with the Civilization of Ruin) Artist: Rico Sasaki Release Date: August 27, 2025 Artist Edition Product No.: LACM-24740 (CD + BD) Price: ¥3,300 (tax incl.) Label: Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. Distributor: Bandai Namco Filmworks Inc. Anime Edition Product No.: LACM-24741 (CD only) Price: ¥3,300 (tax incl.) Label: Bandai Namco Music Live Inc. Distributor: Bandai Namco Filmworks Inc. Tracklist CD 1.Majestic Catastrophe Lyrics: Erica Masaki Composition/Arrangement: Ash Inoue (Dream Monster) And two other original songs Blu-ray 1. Majestic Catastrophe Music Video 2. Making of the Music Video 3. Original Movie “Majestic Catastrophe” Online Signing & Release Event Announced!≫ Date: June 2, 2025 – Stream starts at 19:00 Details: Online signing event via Limista

    Rico Sasaki's Profile

    Born November 10 Akita Prefecture Rico Sasaki loved music and singing from a young age and grew up surrounded by various musical influences. In her fifth year of elementary school, she won the leading role in the musical Annie from among 9,000 applicants. This led to an awakening in singing and acting, and she enrolled in a high school with a specialized music program, where she majored in vocal music. Despite her petite stature, her voice resonates with a soulful quality that surprises many. She is also currently active as a voice actress. Some of her main roles include Misumi Uika/Doloris in BanG Dream! Ave Mujica, Mewi in Welcome to Japan, Ms. Elf!, Daia Nijinosaki in Kiratto Pri Chan, Ayako Yamada in Kageki Shojo!!, and Chisa Sasuga in World Dai Star. item.title: Angelina 1/3 (from Gacharic Spin) Sings Theme Song for BANDAI’s LINK TRAVELERS!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • BANDAI has launched a new IP, “LINK TRAVELERS,” built around two main distribution channels: “SIDE:C (CANDY = Shokugan)” and “SIDE:G (GASHAPON = Capsule Toys).” Angelina 1/3 of Gacharic Spin, also often referred to as “Reiwa era’s Radio Star,” performs the theme song for the first promotional video, now streaming on major music platforms!
  • Following the major success of the original capsule toy figure series “Gashapon Quest,” LINK TRAVELERS, first revealed in November 2024, is a new project that expands into both the Shokugan and Gashapon markets. The series drew strong anticipation from the moment online pre-orders began, and is officially set to release in May 2025. With highly detailed figures and customizable parts, the new line offers users the freedom to play and create based on their own preferences, while its rich backstory and well-developed world setting will add further depth to the imaginative experience.
  • The first promotional video, which fully captures the essence of the world, was released on April 28. The promotional video features the song “Transcendence,” which was produced and composed by Eijun Suganami of the rock band THE BLACK HORN, with vocals by Angelina 1/3 of Gacharic Spin. The powerful drumming of Hana of Gacharic Spin, with her intense twin bass performance, also adds to the track. Comments from Angelina 1/3, Eijun Suganami, and K. Sawa, the project lead for LINK TRAVELERS at Bandai, have been released. We invite you to experience a wide array of content, including Shokugan, Gashapon, video, and music!
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WAEHAeOGyzE “Transcendence” on streaming services: lnk.to/LZC-3079

    “Transcendence” by Angelina 1/3 of Gacharic Spin

    Lyrics/Composition/Arrangement: Eijun Suganami (THE BLACK HORN/eijun) Release Date: April 28, 2025. Produced by Eijun Suganami Vocal, Chorus: Angelina 1/3 Guitar, Bass, Programming: Eijun Suganami Drums: Hana (Gacharic Spin)

    Message From Angelina 1/3 (Gacharic Spin)

    “I had the honor of singing as one of the voices in the world of LINK TRAVELERS, standing alongside characters who fight through despair in search of light and strength. It means so much to me to be part of this powerful project, especially with the incredible Eijun-san, whose work I deeply admire. The songs Eijun-san writes always give me the strength to move forward and take me to new places. I hope this song can be a source of strength for everyone out there fighting for their own freedom, just like the characters in LINK TRAVELERS.”

    Message From Eijun (THE BACK HORN)

    “When creating this song, I focused on capturing the thrilling sense of adventure and the cool, stylish universe of LINK TRAVELERS. I wanted the track to feel powerful and liberating, almost like breaking free from the everyday and reaching out toward freedom. Angie’s rock vocals are truly one of a kind, and they brought the song to life with incredible energy. She’s an amazing vocalist and also has a deep understanding of the world behind the lyrics. Thanks to her, the song turned out incredibly energetic, and I’m really happy with how it came together.”

    Message From K. Sawa (Bandai)

    “From the opening to the powerful chorus, this song does a fantastic job of fully expressing the world of the first installment of LINK TRAVELERS. There’s a line in PV1 that says, “A fateful encounter that sets the gears of destiny in motion will suddenly arrive one day,” and I truly feel that meeting Eijun-san and Angelina 1/3, who created such a beautiful song to accompany the characters embarking on their journeys into the future, was exactly that kind of encounter. I hope you’ll listen to the full version and enjoy it!”

    About Angelina 1/3 (Gacharic Spin)

item.title: [Honey's Anime Interview] STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION’s RON Reflects on 10 Years of Hits and Musical Evolution
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url=" ]

Celebrating a decade of genre-blending innovation and emotional resonance, STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION—helmed by the multi-talented artist and producer RON—marks its 10th anniversary with the release of "STEREO DIVE 03." In this interview, RON reflects on his evolution as a creator, the balance between artistic vision and collaboration, and the deeply personal threads woven through his latest work.

RON
Honey-Chan
Interview with RON from STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION
[gray-hex-decoration]
RON, thank you very much for this opportunity! It's great to have you back, and congratulations on the 10th anniversary of STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION! Looking back on the past decade, how has your sound evolved since the release of your debut track “Daisy”?
Over the past decade, I’ve written many songs, not only for myself but also as a music producer for others. Through my various experiences as a musician, I feel that the process of translating musical ideas in my head into concrete output has become more refined. I also sense that my creative repertoire has significantly expanded.
Your new album 'STEREO DIVE 03' features a mix of tie-up songs with anime, as well as original tracks. How do you balance the demands of working on anime theme songs with your personal musical vision?
I primarily approach my work in a way that aligns with the anime. From my creative repertoire, I carefully select the musical elements that best suit the series. For parts beyond the first verse that aren’t used in the anime, I sometimes take a more personal approach.
You’ve mentioned that the song '#03', which opens the album, represents your feelings of “looking forward to the future.” Can you explain more about the meaning behind the track and how it ties into your current journey as an artist?
To mark the 10th anniversary, I wanted to include a special touch. By bringing the intro phrase of “Daisy” to the very end, I aimed to express respect for the beginning while also conveying a sense of appreciation for what’s to come.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=haQ1-nHFE1I
Given that you’ve worked in many different contexts throughout these years, how have these experiences shaped your musical style and the way you connect with your audience? And how is that reflected in 'STEREO DIVE 03'?
In recent years, I’ve had more opportunities to perform in front of overseas audiences. The song “HIKARI,” which is included in the album, was created specifically as a piece that could be sung together with them. When I performed it live, I truly felt a sense of unity, which was an awesome experience.
Your work as a composer spans multiple genres, from rock to EDM to orchestral arrangements. How do you decide which genre best fits the emotional tone of a song, especially when it’s tied to an anime series?
I generally strive to write music in line with the request. When given full creative freedom, I refer to the script, storyboard, or any available footage to determine the appropriate genre and instruments for the scene.
Do you have any favorite anisong from your own repertory? If so, which one and why?
It’s hard to choose just one, but if I had to, I’d say “STORYSEEKER.” I love both the melody and the arrangement. I put a lot of effort into it, even using custom sampling data that I created myself.
With the 10th anniversary of STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION, what new goals and aspirations do you have for the future of your music and creative journey?
I want to reflect and think about what I truly want to create. I also aim to refine the balance between my own creative desires and external requests while deepening my mindset for pursuing what I love.
We’re sure many Honey’s Anime readers have followed your journey, some from the very beginning. Is there anything you’d like to say to them as we wrap up the interview?
I want to express my gratitude to those who discovered SDF or RON through anime. I’ll continue creating many more songs, so please look forward to them!

Final Thoughts

With ten years of boundary-pushing music behind him, RON shows no signs of slowing down. As STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION enters its next phase, his commitment to authenticity, growth, and emotional connection remains unwavering. Whether through anime tie-ins or deeply personal tracks, RON continues to craft music that resonates across cultures and generations—inviting listeners to dive even deeper into the soundscapes he so passionately creates. As STEREO DIVE FOUNDATION looks ahead to a new chapter, we also look forward to many more songs from this amazing band. We've been here to appreciate these 10 years of music, and we'll continue to do so in the next decade too!

It also reached No. 1 on six other Viral Top 50 charts. On the YouTube Shorts Daily Top Songs Ranking, it broke into the Top 50 in 11 countries and continues to dominate charts around the world (as of April 14).

  • The five main theme songs featured in the trilogy, ARIA the AVVENIRE, ARIA the CREPUSCOLO, and ARIA the BENEDIZIONE, have been recorded on albums by their respective artists before, but never on an ARIA album until now. The first disc will be a collection of 14 opening and ending themes from the anime, the second disc a compilation of 13 insert songs, and the third disc will feature an original collection of songs on piano by pianist and producer Mina Kubota.
  • In 2009, ARIA The BOX, a collection of themes and insert songs from the anime, was released with only 10,000 copies available which sold out immediately. The new best-hits album will be the only item once again featuring the complete collection of themes and insert songs from the anime, so you don’t want to miss out.
  • The album jacket illustration features original artwork by the creator Kozue Amano.
  • In addition, the second main visual for ARIA’s 20th anniversary concert has been released. The theme of the visual is “Thank you for 20 years” and features the cast in their respective teams holding various flowers.

item.title: Maaya Sakamoto’s 30th Anniversary Website Now Open! Voting for Maaya’s Best Song Begins!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Today marks the 30th anniversary of Maaya Sakamoto’s artist debut! The multi-talented singer, voice actress, actress, songwriter and essayist released her debut single “Yakusoku wa Iranai” on April 24, 1996. New photos and a special website have been released in celebration of the event.
  • The special anniversary campaign to vote for “Maaya’s Best Song” has also begun. This campaign invites fans from across the world to vote for their all-time favorite song from her discography.
  • In addition, official social media accounts for Maaya Sakamoto have been created to commemorate the event. Follow the official Maaya Sakamoto accounts for the latest news and updates on the artist!
    • Maaya Sakamoto’s 30th Anniversary Website jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/30th Voting Page jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/30th/fan-voting

    Maaya Sakamoto

    Born in Tokyo, she began her career as a child actress at the age of eight. She made her CD debut in 1996 with the single “Yakusoku wa Iranai.” Following her 2011 album You Can’t Catch Me, which topped the Oricon chart, she began actively collaborating with a wide range of other artists and musicians. Since her 2013 album Singer-Songwriter, she has also been composing music for other artists. In 2019, she released her 30th single “Uchuu no Kioku” (produced by Ringo Sheena) and her 10th original album Kyou Dake no Ongaku. In 2020, she released her 25th anniversary album Single Collection+ Achikochi and the digital single “Yakudo,” which topped the Oricon chart. In July 2021, her radio program “Vitamin M,” which she had been hosting for 20 years, reached its 1,000th broadcast and entered its 21st year. In May 2022, she released the double tie-up single “Sumire / Kotoba ni Dekinai,” with music written and arranged by Shigeru Kishida. To date, she has released 35 singles and 11 full albums. As a lyricist, in addition to writing her own original songs, she has also written many songs for other artists, including Kinki Kids’ “Hikari no Kehai,” Mamoru Miyano’s “Toumei,” and Walküre’s “Kaze wa Yokoku Naku Fuku,” and has published her own lyrics book Shishu (Kadokawa). She won the 38th Kazuo Kikuta Theater Award for her performance as Jerusha in the musical Daddy-Long-Legs. Her latest essay collection Manpukuron - Asu ni Kaburitsuke (Kadokawa) has also garnered attention. In addition to her singing career, she is active as a voice actress, actress, lyricist, essayist, and radio personality. Her fresh and vibrant voice is loved by fans not only in Japan but also around the world. In 2025, she will celebrate her 30th anniversary as a performer and is set to contribute the opening theme song for the TV anime Aru Majo ga Shinu Made. item.title: Aya Hirano Announces Digital Release of First New Solo Single in 11 Years!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Aya Hirano has announced that she will release a new single, titled “evolutions” on May 10, 2025. This track will be released under the Lantis label, the same label that launched her solo career in 2006. The song’s production is handled by Heart Company, led by Shigeru Saito, who supported Hirano’s career as the music producer of hits like The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya and Lucky Star. With the return of her original production team, Hirano’s music is set to enter a new phase.
  • “Evolutions” marks Hirano’s first solo single in 11 years. It is a powerful and energetic track that captures Hirano’s current style, reflecting the diverse vocal genres she has explored throughout her career. The song’s arrangement and composition are by John Kanda (Ajiwai), with lyrics written by Hirano herself.
  • Additionally, on March 8, 2026, Hirano will celebrate the 20th anniversary of her debut solo single, “Breakthrough,” under the Lantis label. As the countdown to this milestone begins, be sure to watch for the next chapter in Hirano’s music journey with Lantis.

    Aya Hirano's Profile

    Born in Aichi Prefecture, Aya Hirano began her career as a child actress, appearing in TV dramas and commercials starting in 1998. She made her voice acting debut in 2003. In March 2006, she debuted as a solo artist with the release of her first single, “Breakthrough,” under the Lantis label. From 2011 onward, she focused primarily on stage performances, and in 2024, she fully resumed her music career with the RE:BOOT live tour. In May 2025, she will digitally release her first new single in 11 years, titled “evolutions,” under the Lantis label. This track will be featured in her upcoming live tour, which will begin in April and visit eight cities. item.title: MyAnimeList’s “You Should Read This Manga” Final Lineup Revealed!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • MyAnimeList has unveiled the official list for the third annual “You Should Read This Manga 2025,” a global event designed to highlight exceptional new-and-upcoming manga available to the international fan. The final list, curated from 766 user nominated titles, features 77 unique manga series across four discovery categories.
  • This highly-anticipated event aims to spotlight recently published manga and connect fans worldwide with new stories that deserve more recognition on a global scale. For 2025, the project continues to serve as a cultural bridge between creators, publishers, and readers in over 240 countries and territories.
  • As an added incentive, MyAnimeList users who read 2 volumes of any title from the 2025 list during the campaign period will earn a time-limited profile badge.

    • About “You Should Read This Manga 2025”?

    A unique global manga promotion project carried out by world-renowned anime and manga community MyAnimeList in conjunction with industry professionals. The project is the first of its kind, using online nominations from users around the world to produce the ultimate list of manga recommendations for that year. Aside from the main category, “You Should Read This Manga,” the project includes a number of sub-categories, including series that fans would like to see animated.

    Categories & Criteria

    This global manga discovery project was launched with the goal of inspiring fans around the world to explore lesser-known but highly recommended titles. The final list is created from user-submitted nominations, which allows fans to vote for up to 10 titles and include persuasive reasoning for why each title should be featured. Titles must have seen an overseas release in 2024, and have a Score and Popularity ranking below #50 on MyAnimeList to be eligible for nomination. The 2025 edition includes four curated categories: You Should read This Manga 2025 For manga that readers simply really want to recommend to a friend! (e.g. Gachiakuta, Magus of the Library, Kagurabachi) Should Be Anime For manga not adapted into anime within the past 5 years. (e.g. Gokurakugai, Kindergarten Wars, Firefly Wedding) Best for Beginners For new readers; short, accessible, or recently adapted into anime. (e.g. Dandadan, Smoking Behind the Supermarket with You, RuriDragon) Unique Art/Story For seasoned manga fans seeking originality in artwork or narrative. (e.g. Veil, Kaiju Girl Caramelise, The Color of the End: Mission in the Apocalypse) Explore the full list of selected works here: mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/nomination

    Trends from This Year’s List

    Demographic Balance: Half of the selected titles were originally published in shounen or seinen magazines. Notably, one in four of these titles received more votes from female readers. Digital Origins: 25% of the titles come from web-based manga platforms such as Shonen Jump+ or Manga UP. Anime Demand: Over half the “Should Be Anime” picks are shounen, with two-thirds of these available for free via MANGA Plus. Female Reader Influence: The “Unique Art/Story” list saw the majority of votes come from female users, in contrast to the other lists. Breakout Titles: Girls love/yuri manga The Guy She Was Interested in Wasn't a Guy at All had total nominations almost equal to all GL titles combined from the previous year. Likewise, new nominations for action manga Kagurabachi doubled any other action title.

    Additional Content

    The project also features bonus recommendation sections created in collaboration with manga publishers and booksellers: Try This Manga — for Free! → mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/try-manga Publisher & Bookseller Picks → mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/more-recs Kodansha Critical Hits & Fan-Favorites → mxj.myanimelist.net/readthismanga/2025/kodansha

    About MyAnimeList

    MyAnimeList is an anime and manga community, with comprehensive databases maintained by its passionate user base. The website allows members to track their viewing progress, rate and discuss titles, write reviews, and discover new works through various community-driven features. With over 19.5 million users from more than 240 different countries and territories, MyAnimeList is an essential resource for the international anime and manga fan. *Figures as of March 2025. For more about MyAnimeList, please visit myanimelist.net. For more information or press inquiries, please contact: sales@mail.myanimelist.net.
