item.title: New TV Anime Maebashi Witches Premieres April 2025! Full-Size Opening Theme “Sugosugi Maebashi Witches!” Now Available for Streaming
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • Maebashi Witches is an upcoming original TV anime produced by Sunrise Studio of Bandai Namco Filmworks, known for titles such as Mobile Suit Gundam and Love Live! The full-length version of its opening theme, “Sugosugi Maebashi Witches!”, is now available for streaming. Performed by the Maebashi Witches, a five-member voice actor idol group portraying the anime’s main characters, the song features lyrics by Tsunku♂, composition by TORIENA, and arrangement by Yuki Kishida.
  • Blending the classic sound of the Japanese idol scene with infectious refrains, powerful kicks, and deep bass, this track is also a perfect fit for anime club playlists. Don’t miss it!
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IEYDX-VF974

    Creator Comments:

    Lyrics: Tsunku♂ I think everyone has childhood memories of playing flower fortune-telling—plucking petals one by one, eagerly anticipating the final answer. Even with only two possible outcomes, it always felt exciting. With that theme in mind, I wove the cast members’ names and various types of flowers into the melody to create this song. Writing the lyrics felt like solving a complex jigsaw puzzle—I was so immersed that time just flew by. The protagonists are adorable, and with a story full of youthful passion and a sense of achievement, I’m really looking forward to watching the show. Composition: TORIENA I composed this song with the hope that each member of the Maebashi Witches would shine brightly. I think it’s a lively and adorable track. Super amazing Maebashi Witches! Arrangement: Yuki Kishida Congratulations on the full-length release! First and foremost, I’m truly honored to have been part of this project. I still remember how excited I was when I first received the demo—it was already amazing. As I worked on it, I kept thinking about how I could contribute to make it even better. My goal was to create a sound that you’d want to hear anywhere—on TV, through your phone, or even in a club. I hope people enjoy it in all kinds of places!

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • TRIGGER, the group from Idolish7, has released their third original album, Trois. Based on the grand concept of Lueur des Trois (“The Light of Three”), the album is structured as a grand ensemble divided into three movements: Origine, Passion, and Scène. Each section opens with “Prelude: Lueur des Trois,” while the individual tracks tell the story of TRIGGER’s origin, passion, and journey to the stage. Listeners are invited to immerse themselves in the symphonic poem of Lueur des Trois.
  • Among the standout tracks are “Triple Down,” an emotional and progressive dance music piece produced by Ryo Takahashi, with rhythmic and seductive lyrics by multi-artist R・O・N., as well as “Sol,” an innovative electronic track composed by Taiki Kudo from the dance vocal group Da-iCE.

item.title: Aru Majo ga Shinu Made’s Ending Theme Song by Aoi Teshima, Written and Arranged by Yuki Kajiura!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • It was recently announced that the ending theme song for upcoming anime Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, airing April 1, will be sung by Aoi Teshima. The song “Hana Saku Michi de” was written and arranged by songwriter Yuki Kajiura.
  • You can listen and watch the newest music video for the anime that was released today featuring a short version of the song.
  • Aru Majo ga Shinu Made is a heartwarming fantasy about Meg, a 17-year-old apprentice witch, who is told by her long-lived teacher, Faust, that a terrible curse has left her with only one year to live. In order to break the curse, Meg sets out to bring happiness to those around her and collect the joyful tears shed by 1,000 people within a year.
  • The ending theme song “Hana Saku Michi de” was produced by songwriter and composer Yuki Kajiura, who has gained a huge following around the world thanks to her work on the soundtracks for many popular anime. This song is a collaboration between two artists leading at the forefront of their respective genres.
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=raGGkWkCAPY

    A Message from Aoi Teshima:

    I had the pleasure of singing the ending theme song for Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, “Hana Saku Michi de.” This was my first time singing something written by Yuki Kajiura. The words and melody felt nostalgic somehow and I was able to really put my heart into it. It would make me happy if you all enjoyed the anime all the way to the ending theme as well.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Aoi Teshima Profile

    Aoi Teshima was born in 1987 from Fukuoka Prefecture. Following the release of her demo CD The Rose, she made her debut with "Therru's Song" featured in the 2006 Ghibli film Tales from Earthsea. In 2011, she sang the theme song for the film From Up on Poppy Hill. Preceding her debut, she released four highly-acclaimed film music cover albums and an original concept album. Through her music, Aoi Teshima continues to convey a worldview that only she can express. In celebration of the 15th anniversary of her debut, she released her first best-hit album Simple is best in 2021, and held a commemorative concert of the same title across Japan. On February 22 of the same year, she released her first live album LIVE 2022 "Simple is best" containing footage from the concert. Her exceptional voice has been in high demand for numerous theme songs and commercials thanks to her ability to move the hearts of her listeners with her songs, and her acclaim has been growing both at home and abroad.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

    Yuki Kajiura Profile

    A multi-talented music composer, producer and songwriter. She made her debut in 1993 as the composer and keyboardist for See-Saw. In 2002, her song “Anna ni Issho Datta no ni” became a hit as the ending theme for Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. She has since gone on to produce musical groups and continues to produce anime theme songs and soundtracks. In 2020, her work on the theme song for Demon Slayer: Mugen Train, “Homura,” alongside the singer LiSA, resulted in the track winning the 62nd Japan Record Awards. She’s also composed music for Japanese films and television programs. In 2023, she released PARADE, her first album in nine years under her personal label FictionJunction. In December of the same year, she held her first two-day concert, “Kaji Fes.2023,” as part of her global tour Yuki Kajiura LIVE.

item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • The newest installment by Sunrise (Bandai Namco Film Works) in the Macross franchise was first announced during “Walküre FINAL LIVE TOUR 2023 ~Last Mission~”. During ABEMA’s live broadcast of the “Macross X Sunrise New Animation Announcement Special”, it was announced that auditions for the next song princess in the new series will be held in 2025. Music production for the anime will be a collaborative effort by labels FlyingDog and Lantis (Bandai Namco Music Live).
  • Music for the new series will be produced by FlyingDog, who has headed music production for the franchise thus far, and Lantis (Bandai Namco Music Live), the producer of hit series LoveLive!. This powerful duo produced a brand new theme song for the auditions to be the next Macross song princess. The song "I to I" combines a sense of speed and passion, and with the catchy phrase "Hear this whole-hearted song!", it’s giving fans high hopes for the upcoming series.
  • Auditions will be accepted until Wednesday, April 30, 11:59 PM (JST). Those interested in auditioning can enter by uploading a video of oneself singing the song “I to I” to YouTube. The song is available to download for those interested in making derivative works such as dance or instrumental videos as well. Those uninterested in the audition are also welcome to participate.
  • Additionally, there will be videos uploaded every week of past Macross song princesses and special guests singing the theme song as part of a special campaign to promote the new series. The first video of the campaign features Minori Suzuki, winner of the Macross Delta song princess audition and voice of the heroine Freyja Wion. There will be more videos of special guests singing along to “I to I” released every week for everyone to enjoy.
  • Information about the audition and special guest covers of “I to I” will be available on the official audition website, YouTube, X, Instagram and TikTok accounts. Follow for the latest updates.

item.title: Maaya Sakamoto Announces 36th Single “Drops”
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • It was recently announced that Maaya Sakamoto’s latest song, “Drops,” will serve as the opening theme for the upcoming TV anime Aru Majo ga Shinu Made, which begins airing on April 1. Today, it has been confirmed that the song will be released as her 36th single, and the cover artwork has also been revealed.
  • The lyrics for “Drops” were written by Yuho Iwasato, who has collaborated with Maaya Sakamoto on many songs. The music was composed by Naoto Kiyota, an up-and-coming composer making his debut collaboration with Sakamoto, and the arrangement was handled by Shin Kono, who has been arranging Sakamoto’s music for many years. This combination of familiarity and fresh talent makes for an exciting team.
  • The coupling song, “Twilight,” features lyrics co-written by Maaya Sakamoto and Yuho Iwasato for the first time in 28 years, with composition and arrangement by Tomoya Kawasaki. This electro-style number marks a bold new direction for Sakamoto.
  • The Limited First Edition comes with the Maaya Sakamoto 30th Anniversary Acrylic Stand, “Omote mo Ura mo Sakamoto Maaya!” (Maaya Sakamoto on the front and back!). This exclusive anniversary item features a newly photographed image of Sakamoto with the FlyingDog logo on the base. The acrylic stand is double-sided, with her back view printed on the reverse.

    • Product Information

    Artist: Maaya Sakamoto Title: Drops Release Date: May 21, 2025 Product No./Price: Limited First Edition / VTZL-255 / ¥3,300 (tax incl.) Standard Edition / (CD) VTCL-35386 / ¥1,320 (tax incl.) The Limited First Edition comes with the Maaya Sakamoto 30th Anniversary Acrylic Stand, “Omote mo Ura mo Sakamoto Maaya!”

    Tracklist

    1. Drops (OP theme of Aru Majo ga Shinu Made) Lyrics: Yuho Iwasato Composition: Naoto Kiyota Arrangement: Shin Kono 2. Twilight Lyrics: Maaya Sakamoto & Yuho Iwasato Composition / Arrangement: Tomoya Kawasaki 3. Drops (TV size) And two instrumental tracks

    Maaya Sakamoto

    Born in Tokyo. Active as a child actress from age eight. She made her CD debut in 1996 with the single “Yakusoku wa Iranai.” In 2011, her album You can’t catch me topped the Oricon chart. In 2013, she released Singer-Songwriter, the first album for which she wrote all the music. In 2019, she released her 30th single “Uchuu no Kioku” (produced by Ringo Sheena) and her 10th original album Kyou Dake no Ongaku. In 2020, she released her 25th anniversary album Single Collection+ Achikochi and the digital single “Yakudo,” which topped the Oricon chart. In 2021, she released her concept album Duets, which featured a variety of artists, and in the same month, she celebrated the 25th anniversary of her CD debut with a concert at Yokohama Arena, which is now on sale on Blu-ray and DVD. In May 2022, she released the double tie-up single “Sumire / Kotoba ni Dekinai,” with music written and arranged by Shigeru Kishida. In July of the same year, her radio program “Vitamin M,” in which she has been a personality for 20 years, reached its 1,000th broadcast and entered its 21st year. In 2023, she released her 33rd single “Mada Tooku ni Iru / un_mute.” As a lyricist, in addition to writing her own first album, she has also written many songs for other artists, including Kinki Kids’ “Hikari no Kehai,” Mamoru Miyano’s “Toumei,” and Walküre’s “Kaze wa Yokoku Naku Fuku,” and has published her own lyrics book Shishu (Kadokawa). She also won the 38th Kazuo Kikuta Theater Award for her performance as Jerusha in the musical Daddy-Long-Legs. She is a voice actress, actress, lyricist, essay writer, and radio personality, and her vibrant voice has won the support of fans all over the world. Official homepage: jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya Official YouTube channel: youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh

item.title: AVIOT to Release Kamen Rider W Collaboration True Wireless Earbuds! Pre-Orders Open!
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has opened pre-orders for the TE-V1R-WCJ true wireless earbuds created in collaboration with Kamen Rider W. These earbuds, which are based on the TE-V1R, feature the voices of Doubledriver, Lostdriver, and Gaia Memories, along with sound tuning supervised by Mitsuru Matsuoka.
  • Based on the latest model of AVIOT’s hit V series, which has sold approximately 150,000 units*, the TE-V1R-WCJ is a special edition designed to immerse users in the world of Kamen Rider W.
  • The design represents a collaboration between AVIOT and the in-show fashion brand Wind Scale, combining the essence of the series with a touch of fashion through unique details such as the differently colored top parts on the left and right earbuds.
  • With full support from Bandai Co., Ltd., the voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status includes approximately 140 sounds, featuring audio from the Doubledriver, Lostdriver, and Gaia Memories. Additionally, a “special voice” function can be activated by holding the right button, bringing Futo’s heroes and their intense battles to life during use.
  • Through the app, users can switch between 10 modes featuring five riders in various forms: Kamen Rider W Cyclone Joker, Kamen Rider W Heat Metal, Kamen Rider W Luna Trigger, Kamen Rider W Fang Joker, Kamen Rider W Cyclone Joker Extreme, Kamen Rider Joker, Kamen Rider Accel, Kamen Rider Accel Trial, Kamen Rider Skull, and Kamen Rider Eternal. Relive the excitement of the series with these dynamic modes!

    • Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOT’s popular V series, which has sold approximately 150,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDAC™ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of September 2024 Special Voice Lines With full support from Bandai Co., Ltd., the voice guidance for notifications like power and connection status includes approximately 140 sounds, featuring audio from the Doubledriver, Lostdriver, and Gaia Memories. Additionally, a “special voice” function can be activated by holding the right button, bringing Futo’s heroes and their intense battles to life during use. Through the app, users can switch between 10 modes featuring five riders in various forms: Kamen Rider W Cyclone Joker, Kamen Rider W Heat Metal, Kamen Rider W Luna Trigger, Kamen Rider W Fang Joker, Kamen Rider W Cyclone Joker Extreme, Kamen Rider Joker, Kamen Rider Accel, Kamen Rider Accel Trial, Kamen Rider Skull, and Kamen Rider Eternal. Relive the excitement of the series with these dynamic modes! To see the other voice lines, please check the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-wcj. Special Design Inspired by the collaboration between AVIOT and the in-show fashion brand Wind Scale, the earbuds and charging case prominently display the brand’s logo. The design also incorporates differently colored top parts on the left and right earbuds, capturing the essence of the series with a stylish touch.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Packaging The packaging features the Wind Scale and AVIOT logos on the front and back, with a striking image of Futo’s nighttime cityscape on the inside. Additionally, two over sleeves are included, featuring either Kamen Rider W and Kamen Rider Accel or Kamen Rider Skull and Kamen Rider Eternal.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Special Tuning The sound tuning was supervised by Mitsuru Matsuoka, who played Katsumi Daido/Kamen Rider Eternal and has provided numerous songs for the Kamen Rider series, including the theme song for Kamen Rider W Forever: A to Z/The Gaia Memories of Fate. Users can enjoy an exclusive tuning that brings the world of Kamen Rider W to life.
    [sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]
    Mitsuru Matsuoka Profile Born on August 12, 1971, in Osaka Prefecture, Mitsuru Matsuoka made his major debut in 1995 as the vocalist of the rock band SOPHIA. He has written lyrics for all of the band’s approximately 200 songs, creating numerous iconic tracks, including “Machi.” In addition to his music career, he has taken on lead roles in numerous dramas, films, musicals, and stage productions, demonstrating his versatility as an actor. His notable appearances include the TV dramas Hito ni Yasashiku (2002), Kaze no Haruka (2005), and Yamada Tarō Monogatari (2007); the grand musical Titanic; the stage play Kisaragi; the dramatic production Rurouni Kenshin; and the off-Broadway musical Forever Plaid. In recent years, he garnered attention for guest-starring as a Rider in Kamen Rider and is also recognized as the artist responsible for performing the most theme songs in the franchise’s history. Beyond his role as a vocalist, Matsuoka is a multifaceted creator and artist, actively pursuing endeavors such as publishing photo books, writing novels, designing products, and hosting television programs.

  • AVIOT, operated by Preseed Japan Corporation, which manufactures and sells consumer electronics, has opened pre-orders for the TE-V1R-AZL true wireless earbuds created in collaboration with the smartphone game Azur Lane. These earbuds, which are based on the TE-V1R, feature 100 newly recorded voice lines and packaging illustrated by Kasu Komeshiro.
  • Based on the latest model of AVIOT’s hit V series, which has sold approximately 150,000 units*, the TE-V1R-AZL is a special edition designed to immerse users in the world of Azur Lane. It includes five character voice modes: Le Malin, Implacable, Ägir, Kearsarge and Owari, for a total of 100 voice lines specifically recorded for these earbuds.
  • The packaging showcases an exclusive new illustration by illustrator Kasu Komeshiro, and both the charging case and the earbuds themselves are designed to maximize the allure of Azur Lane. Through the earbuds, the KAN-SEN, dressed in pajamas, deliver exclusive voice lines that offer soothing moments to commanders during their daily battles.
  • A special video featuring Owari and Ägir introducing this product is now available on AVIOT’s official YouTube channel and the product page. Please enjoy this exclusive short movie, which depicts an original story unique to this release.
    • https://youtu.be/8NzwQd0HDcY

    Product Characteristics

    Base Model The TE-V1R is the latest model in AVIOT’s popular V series, which has sold approximately 150,000 units*. The earbuds offer an ultra-long battery life of 19 hours (62 hours with the charging case) and Adaptive Hybrid Noise Canceling, which automatically adjusts the noise reduction strength based on the surrounding environment. They also feature the new Hybrid Dual Driver 2.0 for enhanced sound quality, LDAC™ support for high-resolution playback, and wireless charging functionality, making them a high-grade model that perfectly balances sound quality and functionality. *As of the end of September 2024 Special Voice Lines In addition to voice guidance for notifications such as power and connection status, this model includes a “random voice” feature with a total of 100 newly recorded voicelines! There are five modes, featuring Le Malin, Implacable, Ägir, Kearsarge, and Owari. Users can switch between modes using the dedicated app. To see the other voice lines, please check the product page: aviot.jp/product/te-v1r-azl. Special Design The earbuds feature a sporty yet refreshing blue reminiscent of the ocean as the base color, complemented by a metallic finish for added depth and a mechanical touch. Users can switch between the two modes at any time using the app. Gaming Mode Features a low latency mode that minimizes audio-video sync issues, providing a smooth experience for watching videos and gaming. *The free AVIOT SOUND ME app is required to use gaming (low latency) mode.

item.title: MyAnimeList and Honeyfeed Open Writing Contest “NOVELOUS Worlds” Powered by Shogakukan
item.content:encoded:
[sourceLink asin="" asin_jp="" cdj_product_id="" text="" url="" ]

[en]What You Need to Know: [/en][es]Lo que necesitas saber: [/es]

  • MyAnimeList (MAL) and Honeyfeed (HF) proudly announce the opening of “MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - NOVELOUS Worlds.” This collaboration aims to spotlight talented international web novel authors by bringing their stories to NOVELOUS, a light novel reader app launched this January by the renowned Japanese publisher, Shogakukan. Anime enthusiasts are invited to craft captivating tales inspired by two prompts: “Love Transcends Boundaries” and “The End is Now.” Centered on themes of love and death, the contest seeks page-turning stories that will ignite the imaginations of new readers on the NOVELOUS platform.
  • The NOVELOUS app promises to bridge the gap between global audiences and the beloved Japanese storytelling format of light novels.
  • To celebrate its launch, NOVELOUS has partnered with MyAnimeList and Honeyfeed to bring fresh, original talent into the spotlight. Through "MyAnimeList x Honeyfeed Writing Contest 2025 - NOVELOUS Worlds," authors from around the world are invited to showcase their creativity, with a chance to have their works featured on the app.

    • Prompts

    The contest challenges writers to craft compelling stories based on one of two prompts: “Love Transcends Boundaries:” Explore the power of love to overcome cultural barriers and obstacles, highlighting bonds that defy the odds. “The End is Now:” Dive into a world on the brink of destruction, where humanity has only one year left—how will people respond to the ultimate countdown?

    How it Works

    Submissions will be hosted on Honeyfeed, a platform for aspiring novelists, from February 11, 2025, to May 7, 2025. After the submission period, a panel of judges will select finalists, and fans worldwide will participate in the voting phase, from June 23 to July 24, 2025, on NOVELOUS. Winning stories will be announced on August 4, 2025.

    Prizes

    The contest offers monetary rewards for outstanding entries: → Most Voted “Love Transcends Boundaries” Entry: US$3,000 → Most Voted “The End is Now” Entry: US$3,000 → Judges’ Choice Award: US$3,000 This writing contest not only celebrates the launch of NOVELOUS but also serves as a platform for emerging talent to shine. Writers, don’t miss this chance to expand your readership and have your work featured on this exciting new app! For complete contest details, submission guidelines, and updates, visit mhwc.myanimelist.net/202502-

    About NOVELOUS

    NOVELOUS is an app for reading Japanese light novels. While many people are already familiar with the countless anime and manga series born in Japan, light novels, which often serve as their source material, remain lesser-known. This is partly due to the lack of widespread translations. Through NOVELOUS, Shogakukan, one of Japan’s leading publishers, will introduce North American readers to light novels that have yet to gain wide recognition, offering translations directly from the source.

    About MyAnimeList

    MyAnimeList is one of the world’s largest communities and databases for Japanese anime and manga, with 16 million registered members from 240 countries and regions worldwide. An indispensable site for tracking anime and manga progress, it holds over 1.2 billion records of viewing and reading big data. Founded in 2004, MyAnimeList has become a crucial source of information for overseas fans, especially among Generation Z in North America.

    About Honeyfeed

    Honeyfeed is a leading writing platform that empowers authors to create, share, and engage with their original stories. With a vibrant community of readers and writers, Honeyfeed provides an immersive space for storytelling across various genres, including anime and manga-inspired narratives.
